text:
this place is truly a hidden gem! 

first of all, the decor and atmosphere creates an amazing intimate ambiance that is original and unmatched in local restaurants in Las Vegas. the style is eclectic and the music suites this place perfectly without overpowering customer's conversations. 

secondly, the food is fantastic! the seared diver scallops were beautifully cook and the spicy seafood pasta was phenomenal. 

Andy, the part owner/manager was very gracious and took great care of everyone equally. the customer service here is better than the 85% of the restaurants I've been to on the strip. I would sincerely recommend 'the sparklings' for that reason alone!

this place has the ability to accommodate any sized party wonderfully and I am definitely coming back and recommending it to everyone! it's simply fantastic

Went for a late night drink with my wife and we sat at the bar. We had the garlic fries and a couple IPAs. Great vibe, good food (our app was great), we will definitely be back for a traditional meal.

So impressed with this place!  The food, atmosphere and service were top notch.  It's just a short drive away so I can definitely see us returning here on a regular basis.  The Caprese salad was delicious as was the grilled chicken and avocado sandwich my boyfriend ordered.  He said it was the best he has ever had!  So good!!!

I'm not sure why I'm finding complaints on service here !
? I love Jose and the other hunk Anthony ..I hadn't been there for a bit but Jose especially is super sweet, always warm and friendly and handles his bar with impeccable timing yet not in your face, giving you privacy if you're with someone ....I love this place becoz of these two bartenders who always make me feel like Home even after a period of not visiting they never forget you!

Went for the 1st time with my friend who has recommended it & it was amazing.. you walk in the place is beautiful, service was good and the food was soo good I had gotten then fried shrimp and mushroom pasta I'll definitely be going here again!
Beautiful interior, food is amazing and reasonably priced. Late night bartender Ray makes beautiful cocktails.

First time there and will not be the last. Very similar to Honey Salt in summerlin. Nothing else like this in the Southwest part of the valley. Great for a date night or casual dinner. VERY reasonable prices. Shabby Chic interior is a great setting 

We started with the caprese salad, bacon and date wrapped meatball and the scallops. All fantastic.   Main course filet mignon and chicken parm. Not much to say about the parm. Pretty basic but very good. Filet was melt in your mouth good. Outstanding meal.  Desert was creme brule and flour less chocolate cake. Both were delicious.  

Service was very attentive even though they were very busy for Valentines day. Definitely coming back. Nice to have this kind of place so close to home

I was pleasantly surprised. Walking in here I thought I was underdressed for the decor. Pleasant and quiet dining experience. The bar is where I spent most of my time. A great IPA recommended by a bubbly bartender and an evening of apps. The crispy gnocchi was well created with great balance of flavor. The sliders were a good size and full of flavor. Portobello fries were awesome. The dipping sauces are crafted well and have purpose on the plate. The staff were prompt with fulfilling my needs and well educated about the menu. The manager for the night is also the owner named Andy. When he made the rounds to our location I was pleasantly surprised with his personal interest with our happiness of experience. Overall Awesome.

I always get a great experience coming here. We always come in during the later hours and the bartenders are always really nice. The food is also just as good! Crab and spinach dip are my favorite! Last night I just tried the flourless chocolate with vanilla ice cream, it hit the spot! Atmosphere is just as nice too!
This place is Amazing! Nice local restaurant that is classy and contemporary. Highly recommended.

Amazing food and ambiance.  I must say never had gnocchi like this before. It is seriously to die for.  Service was top notch.  The waiter even helped us find the right type of beer we would enjoy.   The manager came around to make sure everything was good.  We would definitely come again and tell our friends and family.

This place is awesome. So gorgeous on the inside AND they are open until 2am....on weeknights! My husband and I sat at the bar and enjoyed the Short Ribs, Calamari Salad, Sliders, Creme Brulee, and Flourless Chocolate Cake. Everything was amazing. Our bartender gave us excellent recommendations and the manager came out to ask us our opinion. Great service. We will DEFINITELY be back.

Great atmosphere, attentive service and delicious food with reasonable prices.  I love the variety in seating options as well - Booths, tables, long tables, bar area, etc.  Free wi-fi and accessible outlets make this a great working spot too. Bacon and date meatballs are delish!!

Went to this "Barstaurant" for the first time tonight and enjoyed ourselves! Tried several of the cocktails (Citrine, Chandelier, & Emerald) and loved them all. We ordered a couple of soups and multiple appetizers and were not let down. The bacon date wrapped meatballs are delicious.

The decor is trendy and cute. Servers are friendly (maybe even a little too much so). The only reason I subtracted a star was because of the strong smell of chemical cleaner in the air. It smelled like they had sprayed cleaner all over and then wiped it with a bar rag that had been sitting out for a while. If this place can address the smell issue, it will be 5-star for sure!

A friend of mine introduced me to Sparklings not to long ago. I must say everyone there is extremely friendly and so down to earth. A Very attractive atmosphere. The menu is the bomb.com!! I live in Henderson and it's worth the drive at least once a week. To José, Char, Andy, Rey and Anthony... thanks for making every visit so pleasant!! 

Muah
MzMj
FIREBALL queen

Love everything form this bar!!!  Bartender its amazing, food its the best! C food Wow ! Try like 4 diferent dishes! Best place only trendy place in these área! N ricky what r u talking about best Bartender Ever on 8/15/14 i Was there next to u ! he say hi to u ! Well come to the place hice u a menú u ask for n IPA HE DID IT ! right away u Drink it in a rush took some money out of ur pokect n took off rude!

I came here for a friends birthday. As soon as I walked in I was amazed by the friendly service and fancy yet relaxed atmosphere. I had the bourbon mule (whiskey fan) and it was decent. Not as strong as i would have liked but still good. A friend and I shared the scallops and ribeye and we were stuffed! The service was fast and friendly. I would highly recommend this place for a nice dinner date with a special someone!

It was our last night in Vegas ( we have been here a week) and we wanted to try a local place. We had a great meal, very relaxing atmosphere, excellent service and good prices. We had the crispy gnocchi for an appetizer- delicious! My husband and I fought over the last drops of the sauce on the serving dish. I had the shepherds pie- so yummy and my husband had the ribeye, mashed potatoes and broccoli. We ate everything! Very enjoyable experience. Definitely would recommend.

The drinks are very good and Rey makes the Picante Margarita and its spicy and delicious. The Appetizers are super good too. We like the ceviche and the tuna tartare. The Spicy pasta is very good but our favorite is the TRIO for dessert, it is a flourless chocolate cake, vanilla bean ice cream and créme brulee. delicious!!
They have a great atmosphere and amazing service. I really recommend this place. The food was delicious. As well as a great ambiance. This was a great place.

This is an amazing place to have dinner, went here with my partner and friends. The food was absolutely amazing and the service was outstanding. Our server name was Angel and he went above and beyond to help us. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone and I would recommend asking to sit in Angels area. Angel made us feel welcome and made sure he answered all of our questions. He was very upbeat and attentive to all of our needs. Food wise I would order the filet mignon or the pork chops both were to die for.

We went on a Thursday night since it's a restaurant we drive by all the time.  The interior is cute with a large chandelier in the middle and tables with comfy chairs all around.  A bar is on the other side of the restaurant and there were two big screen tvs.

The host greeted us and let us choose our table.  He was very attentive to us and a few other groups he was waiting on.

We got our menus and glasses of ice water and perused our menus.  We ordered a few appetizers; Parmesan Truffle fries and the Crispy Gnochhi.  My boyfriend ordered the Jambalaya and I ordered the braised short ribs.

The appetizers were yummy.  The gnocchi was really flavorful and the fries were crisp and topped with tons of Parmesan.

My boyfriend liked his Jambalaya, but it was a little salty.  My braised ribs were so tender the meat fell off the bones.  And the sauce was fantastic!

The food and service was excellent.  The best part is they are located not far from our house, so we will definitely go again!

Was very curious to see what this place was all about. First time I walked in, I turned around and left. It looked too upscale. Then I tried it again...totally casual. AMAZING food and very reasonable prices. Pretty cheap. Have recommended it too many and all have agreed. Great date night place. Nice to have a non-chain place to eat and smoke  free environment. Must try!

I first visited The Sparklings last year, around Thanksgiving. Not a week as gone by since then that I haven't been in for lunch, dinner, drinks or all three. It's a beautiful space, modern and sophisticated, but completely comfortable for any mood you're in. I've shown up in a cocktail dress and also in post-workout gear. Every seat in the place is comfortable - and I've pretty much sat in them all. 

The service is impeccable and consistent. The manager, Andy, is now a good friend.  I've ordered about 90% of the menu, and it's all delicious. The only reason I haven't ordered the other 10% is because 1) I don't eat pork, 2) I'm lactose intolerant and there are a few items they can't alter enough for me. But they will always try. The bartenders Ray and Jose are the sweetest boys you could want behind a bar. They make tasty drinks, too.

I've thrown parties here, had surprise parties thrown for me here, brought all my friends here and celebrated my last birthday with my family here only two days ago. Now it's your turn. Go! 

(And order the clam linguini, and the scallops, and the hamburger steak which is an extra tasty loco moco. And the grilled octopus, and the chicken breast sandwich, and...)
This is a local gem.  The staff are ALL so friendly.  The food prices are  reasonable.   If you like small plates, they have a lot of appetizers. I am obsessed with the crispy gnocchi!

Had the rib eye, scallops, calamarie, and gnocchi. Everything was well prepared, semi casual environment as there is a bar in the corner. Prices are reasonable for a weekday impromptu dinner out with friends. No complaints.
Amazing food! Crispy gnocchi with pesto are the best! They have great cocktails selection too.

this place used to be my favorite spot, idk what happened lately but the food became awful, they serve me a fake calamari and my clams pasta is watery add to that my shrimp scampi taste like pasta and water. I was so happy when i walked in to the restaurant even bragging to my mom in law how good calamari is to this restaurant, after eating to sparklings the other night i sure will never go back... it is just awful!!!

Area
The Sparklings is an Italian and American fusion casual dining, which located in Southwest area of Las Vegas. Since southwest area of Las Vegas is becoming very big attraction for local residents, there are a lot of great restaurant in southwest including The Sparklings. Also, there are many house and apartment communities, which they can target for many regular customers

Parking
There are many parking spots available for Sparklings customers. It is not a parking space that Sparkling individually own, but shares the spot with other business that located in the same complex.

Interior
The Sparklings has great interior design. It looks like they have the real Italian theme interior design that makes a customer to feel the real Italian cuisine. It is very vintage and rustic, but also modern in some ways. Restaurant has many seats and tables available for the customers. Also, Sparklings has individual party room and many booth areas for big party of people. Sparklings are divided into two parts, which is a bar area and dining area. Customers can have their drink and enjoy time with bartenders in the bar area, and other customers can enjoy their meal in clean dining room.

Kitchen
Kitchen is located in the back of the restaurant. It is not open kitchen, only thing I can see was that whenever the food was ready, chef ring the bell and server goes in to grab and give to the customers.

Customer Service
Employees seem very professional in the restaurant. Servers wore black pants and black shirt with green apron. Bartenders wore black pants and black shirts with black vest. Servers are always moving around, checking on customers' plates and all ready to answer every question for the customers. Bartenders seem very friendly. They were very outgoing that wants to have a conversation with customers.

Food (Spicy seafood pasta)
Sight: Served with very clean white bowl and silver wear. Also, pasta seemed very well cooked and seafood seems fresh.
Aroma: Aroma of pasta was spicy and pungent smell
Taste / Flavor: Taste was spicy and bit of saltiness behind. The Flavor was very rich mixed with seafood and other spices.
Texture: The pasta was soft and seafoods were chewy. Texture was nothing like I was eating seafood that was thawed. 

Overall, I highly recommend to try out this place since the price and quality of their service and food balanced really well!

Went to The Sparklings on 9/12 for my birthday celebration. Tired of the normal chain restaurants, I wanted something different and cool; something on the fancier side but with a good price point (Nothing seemed to be over $30). And with Yelp's help I found this gem :)  

First, the decor is so my style! Very shabby chic meets vintage. That chandiler is amazing (I couldn't stop looking at it) I felt like I was having a relaxed yet upscale dinner in New York with friends. I love the marble table we ate on and the chairs were even super cute. I loved everything about the interior. It wasn't as big as I thought it would be, but for me it created a more private feeling.

Secondly (and most importantly) the food: The food was really good. I ordered the zucchini sticks for an appitizer and had the spaghetti with mushroom and bacon cream sauce for my main course. I'm a big fan of zucchini sticks and these were excellent! Cripsy on the outside, nice and tender on the inside and the sauce that was served with it was amazing. My spaghetti- bomb! Creamy, flavorful, and a good amount of sauce. I also tried some of the grilled chicken wings (which were also excellent) and I appreciated that they were grilled and not fried. My friends enjoyed their food as well. My sister is still raving about the chicken sandwhich she ordered- she said it was one of the best she's ever had (and believe me she's had a few-she loves chicken sandwhiches lol) 

The service was good as well (our server Jason was really cool) They were all attentive but didn't hover over us the whole night which I appreciated. 

My guest all kept complimenting on the decor and the food which made me really happy, especially considering this was my first time trying it, so it made me feel like I did a good job picking a place and that taking a risk sometimes turns out right :) 

My birthday this year was filled with so much laughter, generosity, and happiness and I want to thank The Sparklings for being an intricate part of my special day. And eventough it's clear on the other side of town from me (lol) I can't wait to go back. 

Wish you much continued success!

Best service ever in las Vegas, the most beautiful restaurant... Decoration its so Creative n so beautiful am planning to celebrate my b day here... Food is amazing try crispy gnocchi n cheese plater, that #Rey  (server) recommend  he is so cool n fun to b whit super profetional  definitely if I come back I want him to serve my parties n so as the bartender Angel he brought my drink to my table (team work) a chandelier super good drink Its a signature of the house... Main course spicy c food pasta it comes whit scallops, squids, shrimps, mussels in a red sauce whit spaghetti awesome thanks again Rey and Angel u awesome!!! #Sparklings #best #in #las #vegas...
This place is 100% awesome! Food is crazy good and staff is very friendly! I highly recommend this place!
Great quality food and perfect ambience. Service can be slow at times.

We were in town for business/pleasure and needed a break from the strip. After reading some reviews we settled on The Sparklings and were not disappointed. The place is beautifully decorated and comfortable. Our server, Tyler, was warm and friendly. We wanted to do a bunch of small plates and knew some of what we wanted to order (crispy gnocchi, diver scallops, Caesar salad, French onion soup) thanks to other yelpers' reviews, but Tyler was also happy to steer us in the right direction and spoke highly of the fish taco special. Everything was great. We also had the trio of desserts, some drinks and an espresso. Our bill for everything was $66 thanks to an insane 5-10pm happy hour special!! The whole evening was exactly what we were looking for. We would highly recommend it!
Really loved this place!! The food was great, good portions and great ambiance. Good place for a gathering as well. Prices are reasonable.
Jose and Eric are those guys!! Best service in town. Eric made sure we had the time of our lives. He even introduced me to my future wife.

Had a fabulous lunch here yesterday. Try the small plates/appetizers.  The gnocchi with pesto cream sauce, glazed nuts & sausage was to die for!  Raymond provided excellent recommendations, service and a couple of entertaining dance moves. Thanks Lori and Mace for the reservations and good company!

A real hidden gem.  Had a small gathering of family to celebrate a birthday and found the setting very nice.  Had passed the restaurant many times before thinking it was more of a casino restaurant type but it was very pretty inside.  The staff was exceptionally attentive and the bar, also very nice.  The food was delicious as well.  Will definitely return.

To be honest, I'm writing this review before even eating my first meal here. People are friendly and you'll be greeted soon after you are inside. The drinks menu is absolutely creative and the food sounds quite promising.. Gotta count on previous reviews for something ;)

Either way, right off the bat- this place get 5* in my book.

Good to have a nice restaurant around the SW area where I live. We like the atmosphere, the decor and the high ceiling which feels nice when you walked into The Sparklings and the service is excellent. 

The food over all was good. We ordered bacon & dates meatball. The sauce was sweet and tasty. Grilled octopus was also good but the portion was small. Only 3 pieces on our plate when the price was $7. It's kinda expensive I think. Scallops cooked perfectly but too much butter in the sauce. Not a big fan of their wings...and by the way they were so small. The clam linguine was ok. I think the noddle was too hard, but we still will go there :)

I'm going to go ahead & say that this is the classiest local hot spot on the southwest side of town. I visited during happy hour (5pm-10pm, 30% off all alcoholic beverages) for a friend's birthday, located right next to The Lodge. 

Every single dish I ordered was delicious: Crispy gnocchi, grilled octopus, sweet potato fries & the flourless chocolate cake. This was already expected since the owner of this restaurant also runs Oyshi & Soyo down the street & I love their food as well. The octopus dish especially surprised me because the meat itself was tender & held a lot of its flavor. Anthony was our server/bartender & he was very patient with our party & helpful with recommendations. Tasty cocktails too.. I'll definitely be coming back!

Was there a while ago... Good service friendly staff... Food not bad... I had bacon wrapped meatballs for app and were tasty...for entree the spicy seafood pasta... sauce could have been a bit thicker for the pasta to have more flavor! It was a good experience overall great environment good timing and would go back!

What can I say? This place is very different. The decor is nice but leaves me wanting more. The food is good. Seems like a lot of stuff that can be made easily at home but it's still good. 

Seems like a good, relaxing spot to hand out with a few drinks.

I love the ambiance here.  The bacon wrapped meatballs were amazing, I can't wait to go back and try their happy hour.  The service was a little slow towards the end when they got busy otherwise my review would be 5 stars.

My new husband and I was married on Jan. 12 in Las Vegas. We were looking for a special place to house our small reception and make it fabulous.  The Sparkling was everything we wanted and more!  Andy Ko is the manager there. He went out of his way to make our night perfect.  We did a beautiful buffet...yet was seated at a beautiful long table,  The food was excellent!!! THE SERVICE WAS PAR NONE!!!!  Andy allowed us to have the bar, play our own music for dancing, let us set up a beautiful cake table, and the reception was perfect!!!  The Sparkling is a beautiful restaurant, with personal caring that goes beyond the extra mile.  It is like everyone there is your personal friend, and make sure you know it!  THANK YOU ANDY AND YOUR BEAUTIFUL STAFF FOR SUCH A WONDERFUL NIGHT.  YOU GAVE US SUCH A GIFT!!!!!   THE NULIKS from CALIFORNIA

My new favorite spot. Hands down! I love the docor here. Super cute!!

We ordered Tuna Tartare and the crab spinach dip. Both were delicious!

My mother ordered Pan seared Salmon as an entree. I tried a bit of it and it was soooo good! I had shrimp tempura with mushroom pasta? It was beyond another level! Arg! can't wait to come back! Absolutely impressed with the food and the service!

The Sparklings is an order of magnitude above any other restaurant within several miles. Where to begin: 

1) The decor. This is a tastefully decorated space with a crystal chandelier and every chair is comfortable. This is a place to take your date, or to celebrate your special occasion.

2) The food. The menu items are ambitious and perfectly executed. I had the beef short ribs which melted in my mouth. The lobster bisque hit the spot as well. 

3) The service was professional, attentive, and not intrusive. It's the kind of service you appreciate, because you don't get it very often.

4) The value. You can spend as much or as little as you like on your meal, but do you have the willpower not to indulge in the wonderful appetizers, drinks and desserts? I think not. It's not significantly more expensive than other Southwest Las Vegas neighboorhood eateries, and the food is better.

5) What it isn't. It's not incidental to some video poker bar. It doesn't have a smoking section.
Met here with good friends.. Made an evening of it.  Food was yummy, service was great, pretty room, great bartender.. Chocolate martins.. Delish..

My girlfriend and I had dinner here last night in the lounge. The hostess had informed us that drinks were 30% off from 5:00 - 10:00 pm if they were served in the lounge. We were seated promptly and greeted by a friendly bartender.

On the way in, we walked through the dining room. Another reviewer described the interior as shabby chic, and we agreed. High ceilings, funky, fun furniture and a good amount of space between tables left an impression that this would be a great spot for larger groups of friends.

The cocktails we ordered were good and tasty, but a touch on the sweet side. The bartender warned us about one particular drink in that was VERY sweet, so we steered clear of that one. They did have a fine beer and and wine selection as well.

We ordered 3 appetizers and one main course. We began with the truffle fries, the bacon and date wrapped meatballs, the arugula and walnut flatbread, and finally, the jambalaya.

Everything was ok. Nothing really stood out, however. I'd call it bland, really, except for the negative connotation of the word. So, a shade tastier than bland. The jambalaya especially had virtually no spice in it at all. The fries and the flatbread were probably the most flavorful -- the fries due to their garlic, herbs and truffle oil and the flatbread had amazing fresh basil.

The jambalaya did arrive already split on two plates for us which was a nice touch. We were too full for desert afterwards. The three apps, one main course, and four total drinks (two for each of us) came to about $60.

We look forward to returning as they are open late (2:00 am most nights I think) and sampling again from the menu.
Very nice restaurant. Nice decor. Staff was wonderful and friendly.  I would be definitely come back a gain.
Place was amazing!! Definitely recommend the Crispy Gnocchi and bacon date wrapped meatballs.... Service was awesome as well, very helpful on what to recommend..
The food was amazing and our server Charlan was outstanding! I've been longing to eat here and it was well worth the wait...

The staff and atmosphere is amazing. Unfortunately I wasn't amazed with the food. The BBQ sliders were okay. The scallops were great but undercooked. The calamari wasn't crispy at all. And the langosta bruschetta had too much creaminess to it. After eating one you can't really eat more. You need to clean your palette with something else because there is too much dairy. I kind of felt sick after eating those. 

Because the staff and the atmosphere of the place was so nice, I may give it another try. Hopefully other items taste a lot better. I really wanted to like this place.

I absolutely ADORE this place. Definitely a diamond in the rough! I hate that it is so far from me. I would love to visit the happy hours and mingle every week if it were closer to me. They're open very late too! (2AM on weekdays and 3AM on weekends!). Don't let the outside esthetic fool either! It's BEAUTIFUL in the inside! The decor is a little luxurious with a quaint country home style. The chandeliers and  flowers are my favorite. I also love the furniture and cabinetry. 

Anyway on to the food and drinks. My best friend and I visited on quiet weekday. We order a bottle of their Riesling, crispy gnocchi, prime rib-eye, créme brulee, and chocolate cake. Loved everything except the chocolate cake. It was FAR TOO RICH AND SWEET for my palette, but I'm sure many love it that way. It was not the traditional sense of cake either. Just straight hard, rich flour less chocolate. No cake whatsoever. I like sweet desserts, but this was too much. I'll stick with the créme brulee in the future. 

I will definitely be returning again and again! I want to tell everyone about this place, but a small part of me wants to keep this little gem a secret. However since there is very few patrons that I have seen, I don't want to risk them suffering from lack of business. Therefore, I hope more people visit, but of course I hope it doesn't become over saturated and cliché like many popular restaurants on the strip. Good thing this establishment isn't on the strip for vultures to ruin it!

So if you're  sensible and will appreciate a delicious meal in a beautiful quiet setting with superb service, RUN to this place quick! Get the enjoyment of exclusivity now before everyone finds out about this best kept secret gem in the south!

My husband and I dined here for my birthday, and it was fabulous!  The service was very professional and very attentive.  We live so close and cannot believe why we hadn't tried it sooner.  The Steak Diane and Filet Mignon were perfectly cooked, we will definitely be back!
THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Everything I've eaten here has been absolutely delicious, I'm mean everything is fantastic not joking  the host Angel is as awesome as they come. Great lounge area also
This place is amazing!!! The cocktails, appetizers and entrees are impeccable. I've had 5 star restaurants on the strip and The Sparkling is by far the best.

Pleasant surprise when you enter this place! It's a nice comfy upscale decor, our server was fantastic, even the owner checked up on us,  food is delish and reasonably priced, especially since the quality was thumbs up!

This place is amazing! It's my absolute favorite lunchtime restaurant. The Gorgonzola flatbread with honey is outstanding. Lots of choices for vegetarians. My boyfriend and friends love the bacon wrapped meatballs. The waiters here are very nice and pleasant. This place should be way more busy with the quality of food that you get.

Great staff, great food, awesome happy hour, cute atmosphere.. minus the bad music. Gone a few times and it's SO quite and awkward with the bad elevator music they play.  Even the staff complained about while we were there. Livin it up a little guys, especially in the bar ;p

I went here with my girlfriend for the first time last week. The restaurant had a nice vibe with a classic/modern look. The service was great, our server was very nice and polite. I ordered the Rice Au Gratin which was great. My girlfriend ordered the chicken and shrimp Cajun pasta. The flavors were there but it was served with penne pasta and the majority of the sauce sat at the bottom of the plate. The dish was good but I think a linguine noodle would be better. Can't wait to give some other dishes a try.

A...mazing. This is a neighborhood gem. Started out with the bacon and date wrapped meatballs. I had the filet and partner had to salmon. Perfection. The menu is VERY eclectic....  there is definitely something for everyone. If you aren't into a steak or seafood, the sandwich selection is pretty good. Next time I am going to try the turkey and cranberry sandwich. We ended with the vanilla creme brûlée. Again, perfection. Great bear and wine selection, and I definitely recommend the signature cocktail the Chandelier, especially if you love bubble gum vodka! 

Go see Jason. He took AMAZING care of us! Will definitely be going back!

This is also a great venue for wedding receptions, showers, birthday parties and business meetings. You can buyout the whole restaurant, only the bar or reserve a private meeting room that holds up to 12 people.

Perfect sized portions, Excellent Food and amazing atmosphere.  Its like nothing else in the SW part of the valley.. I stumbled upon it after finding out from a friend that his son worked there.

I used to pass by it thinking it was just another PT/Lodge type bar as the outside decor would make you think that.. However step inside and you are transported to a different world.

I have been back 3 times since then, its the perfect location to have a nice date night... not to expensive, not to high class... a great spot overall.  

I will be back again and again.

Oh Bonus !!! The Owner and Staff are all amazing..  Try out their cocktails !!!!!!

What a beautifully decorated restaurant and bar. Friendly staff. The spaghetti with mushroom & bacon was amazing. Definitely coming back for happy hour (M-Th 5-10pm) especially since it's just down the street from my house!

This place is excellent for a pretty fancy meal without having to pay a pretty fancy price in a pretty fancy atmosphere. Not very casual actually, I'd say for the female, a casual dress or a nice blouse and for the gentleman jeans and a nice shirt. Besides the place, the food was astounding!! For appetizers, we had the brown butter gnocchi (I believe) crisp on the outside, soft and chewy inside (maybe enough for 2 but we all got a taste) . Delicious. We ordered the cheese platter. Amazing. I'm sorry I don't remember exactly what it's called on the menu. I had the pesto pasta (I forgot exactly what it was called but I'm pretty sure it was the only pesto dish). It was excellent creamy pesto sauce in linguine with Italian sausage, peas and pine nuts. The others ordered ribs, other pastas, rotisserie chicken, BLT's... Everything was amazing and impressive. They do an excellent job in presentation. AND THE PORTIONS. Don't get me started! Such generous portions almost everyone went home with leftovers. The place is perfect for a date or even a birthday party (all ages) they offer a nice private room if you want to reserve for a party, but I went with almost 10 people, a long booth was perfect for us. The service is great too, excellent young men that work there. BEST PART: The prices are unbelievably reasonable, for the large portions and quality food. Good for kids, (well behaved).

I decided to come here the night after racking my brain over where I wanted to eat. I could not for the life of me decide where I wanted to go. It's a semi fine dining restaurant with affordable pricing. 

I went with 2 other friends. We each ordered appetizers and an entree. We ordered the grilled octopus, portobello mushrooms, and spinach and crab dip as appetizers. The grilled octopus was overly chewy. I just kept chewing and chewing and chewing. The flavor wasn't that great either. I liked the spinach dip, but didn't like the crab that went on top. They offered 6 pita bread pieces, which I didn't feel like was enough bread. I had tons of dip leftover after using up the pita. I LOVED the portobello fries! It's huge pieces of the mushroom cap lightly battered and deep fried. The mushrooms were very moist and the batter was crunchy and delicious. My friend ordered a steak salad, and it was delicious! The dressing was a bit sweet, but I loved the feta cheese. The jambalaya was okay. I've never had jambalaya, so I don't know if it was the best I've ever had. I ordered a mushroom and bacon spaghetti but I wanted linguine instead. It was a creamy sauce and really delicious. 

For dessert, we ordered the trio which came with a mini creme brule, flourless chocolate cake, and ice cream. The flourless chocolate cake tasted really rich. 

All in all, I had a great time. I would definitely go again. My only issue is that they should a bit more variety on the menu. They do have a ton of appetizers, so the next time I go I might just order a bunch of those.

My husband and I have driven by this place countless times and never gave it a shot. We went to a bday dinner here the other night and our minds were completely blown! We ordered a bunch of appetizers and they all were great, the grilled wings were exceptionally delicious, the bacon wrapped date stuffed meatballs were perfect, our friend's father said his philly cheese steak was the best he'd ever had (and he's always on the hunt). We went back for lunch today and it was amazing, we sat on the patio, which was beautiful, and we ordered the wings again (our 3yr old loved them), the portobello fries, meatballs, calamari salad (delicious!) And this awesome turkey, brie, cranberry sandwich that was to die for! Not one thing has disappointed us and the service today was on point. This is my new favorite place to hang and eat! I believe they are kid friendly until late night. They had boosters and highchairs. Their beer and cocktail list is decent as well. Check this place out, it won't disappoint!

Mediocre food and service but very pretty decor and reasonable prices. Large varied menu with something for everyone. Good place for families as well as couples. They were out of the wine we ordered and then spilled some on the table when pouring the much more expensive replacement. Have no bread - and have a lot of items that dipping bread into would be enjoyable.

We checked this place out after waiting impatiently for it to open for months. It was worth the wait! Super cute & chic decor. My husband had the short ribs which were good but a little tough and fatty (still really good and flavorful - still would recommend) & I had the rice au gratin recommended by our waiter, Jason. It was delicious. The portion sizes are just right. Service was good even though a little slow - seems like maybe they are working out the kinks. We will definitely be back & want to check out happy hour M-Th at 5-10pm. Once they get outdoor seating I could see us spending a lot of time there! Check it out!

Saw this place on Yelp maybe a month ago and we just recently had our second visit here! Let's just say that this place is definitely one to try! (I don't yelp a lot but this is a place to post about!) 
Our first visit we had Jason as our server and he was great! We went around lunch time and there which I didn't mind at all! We tried Zucchini fries, arugula salad, scallops, and the crispy gnocchi our first time & the second time around we got to try pasta and short ribs for our entrees! SO GOOD! Each and everyone of these times! We also had the flourless chocolate cake which is more of a fudge I think. It was good, very rich, but still good! We got full so expect good portions for all of them! 
Ambiance is great for like a nice lunch out with girlfriends or a dinner date! Prices are more than reasonable for the quality of their food! 
Definitely enjoyed this place a lot and will be coming back again no doubt!
Found this hidden treasure after a long day. They served the  best fresh food in Vegas! Will be coming back

I stumbled upon Sparklings looking for a good breakfast place...my wife and walked in, sat down and noticed they make a dish called Crispy Gniochi....the first time we had it was in New York and the Sparklings version did not disappoint....the ambience was wonderful and we will definitely be returning

Looking from the outside it looks like a regular bar, however as soon as you walk in it is very chic and romantic feeling. Very classy and elegant. I loved the decor and the service was great. The appetizer was okay, main dish was okay and the dessert was okay hence the three star review. I would still come back to go to the bar section as it looked very relaxing and not too overwhelming or crowded!

the spicy seafood pasta.  It's my favorite.  i can't order anything else there because it is sooooooooooooo good.  I love that they'll try to up the level of spice to meet your desire when you tell them to make it extra spicy.  Love the bartenders there, all of the are super nice and friendly!

Found this on Yelp. There is a disconnect between the exterior and interior design, but that is to be expected off the strip. The interior is chabby chic and extremely cute! It was surprisingly empty on a Friday night. They have areas for more intimate private parties as well. We had a great waiter, attentive and friendly. The food was pretty good. My friends had a veggie sandwich and a shrimp poboy. They loved it. The spinach crab dip was pretty good & the gnocchi was awesome!! The only disappointment was the clam chowder, it was just ok..nothing great.

Delicious appetizers and cocktails !!! The servers are all super attentive and nice !!  I always get the octopus and gnocchi   

The atmosphere is flirty and fun. The decor is amazingg 

Perfect place for a girls night out !

First of all, the decor in this place is gorgeous.  The detail, the style, all lend to a fancy, yet casual, bordering on hipster-esque, night out on Rainbow Blvd. 

I wanted to steal all of their furniture.  

Other positives include really friendly, but not creepy friendly, waitstaff.  Our food came out almost immediately and water was always timely refilled.

Okay, so, the food...

We ordered the following: diver scallops (appetizer), butternut squash gnocchi (appetizer), tuna tartare (appetizer); and fries.

The diver scallops were perfectly cooked but....there were only 3....and they were small (the rest were fried rice cakes).  The tuna tartare was also delicious but included only a small portion.  But, good execution all around.

The only things I didn't really enjoy were the butternut squash gnocchi and the fries.  You'd expect a sweetness in the butternut squash gnocchi but unfortunately the squash tasted unripe, making the dish a little bland.  The fries also, sadly, tasted a bit uncooked/raw (and cold).  I'm not sure how you mess up fries, but, those suckers needed way more time in the fryer.

Overall, I'd return because I had a great experience.  Some of the food, yes, was a little off, but I have a feeling it will improve.

3.5 Stars.

Thoroughly enjoyed our late dining experience.  Food was expertly prepared. Veggies were done tender crisp. Filet was perfectly done. Ribs were awesome. Seafood pasta was nice and spicy. We would recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes fine dining at a reasonable price. Our waiter was attentive and entertaining.  Loved the experience.
Good quality food for the price. Upscale casual decor and a nice, clean look. Decent wine list, attentive service. All in all, a very enjoyable, quiet meal close to home.

Mi wife and I travel often and we love to visit this place, The bartender Angel is super friendly, awesome & hooked up the liquor which made everything else better. They have so many great drinks on the menu & everything tastes like candy. We had a few cocktails and really enjoyed the variety. The drinks were really good and creative. I ordered the raspberry bourbon mule and my wife a raspberry lemon drop. Let me just say, our martinis was made with fresh muddled raspberries and tasted perfect; the equal parts alcohol and equal parts raspberries and pink sugar around the glass rim were on point. it was a great choice! I loved the decor so elegant, but comfortable. The atmosphere at the bar and restaurant is really nice so it felt like we had the place to ourselves which was nice. The service was excellent and the food was great! I started with the French Onion Soup which was amazing! The broth, the bread and the gooey cheese made the best French Onion soup I've had to date. My wife chose the Rice Au Gratin with chicken. It was creamy she was also curious about grape, basil and ricotta flat bread so we definitely had to order that! It was also topped with candied walnuts, arugula and drizzled with balsamic. It wasn't crazy over priced like restaurants on "the strip" and it was just as good or better. Definitely a great hidden spot just 10 minutes for the strip. We will be coming back :)

Ray was a great! There were quite a few of us and he made us feel at home! He joked and laughed with the girls and made everyone feel comfortable. 

This is my first time here but I would definitely come back for dinner!

I used to rave about this unique restaurant, but it showing a lack of love from the staff.
Was most recently there on the 25th of February. We were a party of 4, 2 couples. Our server was average, but I was a little surprised when she ask if we wanted separate checks at the beginning of the conversation. No, we did not want separate checks, thank you very much,
Next, we were informed when ordering coffee, that Sparklings Does Not have coffee. "Only Expresso with no free refills", as she put it. C'mon, buy a dang coffee maker!
I will say the food was good; pork chops big and juicy, beet salad yummy. My only other complaint, the guy cleaning tables was over-zealous with a toxic spray bottle. I think it showered our desert and wine.

Food is hit or miss. For the most part, it's good. Sometimes the food takes a while and is missing something, like bread or extra sides u order with the pasta or other dishes. Good atmosphere, decent food, okay service. I feel like the cooks need to be trained a little better so the food quality, presentation is consistent.
Oh, if my extra bread is late with my pasta,  don't bring my pasta. And if the bread is burnt, don't bring it to me late and ask me if I want a new one. Lmao, common sense. I want what I ordered, in good quality.

Been here twice now, absolutely LOVED it!!!! First time was date night with a bunch of friends and our spouses. The 2nd visit was a girl's night out for my friend's birthday..we had a blast. They have the most unique setting and we had the coolest table/seats and both visits the server was super friendly and helpful with recommendations. Recommend this place to anyone, we will be back for sure!!

Love this restaurant, my friends and I come at least once a week. I usually get their grilled octopus, steak salad, sweet potato fries, and scallops. The grilled octopus is really tender and is flavorful. And not to mention Andy is always welcoming!

Upscale dining and quality food but cheaper than you would think!  The owner Andy and the entire staff are awesome.  I haven't had really anything that isn't good!  Love the turkey cranberry sandwich- and the bar tending staff is the best around!

Honestly, I'm very surprised at how disappointing my experience was. We showed up around 6 on a weeknight and the place was pretty empty. Strangely, we weren't greeted by anyone when we came in, and we weren't sure if that meant we were supposed to wait or seat ourselves, so we waited and felt awkward about it. After about a minute and a half, one of the servers came out and noticed us standing there so he refilled someone's water and then showed us to our table.

The service was fine, no real complaints there. We ordered the Grapes, Arugula, and Ricotta Flatbread for the appetizer. For the entrees we ordered the Shrimp Po' Boy and the Chicken Parmigiana. The flatbread had great flavors, but it was seriously unwieldy. I admit that I can, at times, be coordinationally-challenged... but in my defense this was a piece of flatbread that had grapes and candied walnuts sitting on it, with no sharp knife to cut it into pieces. We ended up with a lot of sticky balsamic glaze on our hands, and I personally got a couple of grapes and walnuts in my lap and on the floor. So that was fun. 

Her Shrimp Po' Boy sandwich was good. Though in my opinion the small garnish salad on the side was a little measly looking. My Chicken Parmigiana was kind of crazy. The chicken itself was this massive flattened piece of chicken that covered almost the entire plate. I have never seen a piece of chicken like this, I wish I had taken a picture. Anyway, it was breaded and fried, and then set on top of a pile of watery, bland spaghetti. And I mean watery as in, when I tipped the bowl, about a quarter cup of water came forth. That was the water that hadn't already absorbed into the bottom of the chicken breading. It was soggy and strange and disappointing. The flavor of the chicken and breading was good, but I couldn't get over the sog factor. The pasta was unappetizing and I couldn't really eat much of it. 

The cocktails were nothing to write home about, especially for the price. I got something with "fresh" blueberries in it... and dared to eat one of them. It had no flavor, other than the taste of (possibly) freezer burn.. and the mealy texture that fruit sometimes gets. It was very gross.

The last thing I feel like mentioning just for the sake of being a complainer is that they were playing a collection of popular songs covered by someone on piano/violin. This included Sweet Child O' Mine by Guns N' Roses, and Unforgiven (I think?) by Metallica. Though there were no vocals in the recording, that didn't stop the guy at the table next to us from rocking out with his best Axl Rose impression. It made for an interesting ambiance, but it wasn't quite my cup o' tea.

Bottom line, I won't be back, and I won't be recommending it to anyone. I'm not much of a Yelp reviewer but this place has such amazing ratings I was left feeling confused by my experience and thought I should chime in.

My wife and I really like this place. The food is always well prepared, and they offer a solid variety of menu items. The tappas are very good - I really crave the gnocchi dishes as soon as I enter the building. Try the club sandwich - seems like a vanilla type item to order - but the Sparklings does it better than anyone.

Fancy restaurant atmosphere at mid-level prices. A hidden gem.  Good place to bring a date.

Great food. Ordered the scallops as an appetizer; they were well prepared and not rubbery. Ordered the filet; was cooked perfectly and the gravy was excellent without being too heavy. The clam linguini was not the best. It skimped on sauce and should have been tossed before service. For dessert, the creme brulee was good.

Service was great, the server was attentive and personable. The atmosphere was modern and refined.

Overall - highly recommend.

I went here after seeing it on UNLOKT instagram. The inside is super cute and trendy,  our server was really friendly, but honestly the food was just average and overpriced in my mind. We had the truffle fries which were delicious. I had the tartar and a beet/apple salad and my husband had the grilled veggies and a house salad. My beet salad seemed to have 3 slices of apple and a couple bites of beet...while it did not taste BAD, it was underwhelming. The tartar was just fine, but nothing really memorable. the grilled veggies were meh, and still kind of raw tasting and the house salad was essentially just greens with no dressing, we had to ask for more. I would go back but i just think things seemed too pricey for what they are considering the food competition in vegas...
This is a relatively  new place, the deco, food and service  are all 5 star. Highly  recommended. I have a new place to dine when ver I am in town.
Super cute local spot with good food! The crispy gnocchi is amazing!

Food was awesome, but service was super slow and we were literally the only ones in the restaurant. They took forever to check up on us. We had to keep asking for more water. Apps were great! We ordered the crab and spinach dip, crispy gnocchi, and the sliders. Our entrees were not as up to par as our apps. We had the rice au gratin and the Philly cheese steak. Everything was pretty good, but service was eh.

Loved everything about this place! From the service to the food. I ordered the Filet Mignon and a bottle of wine, the Bogle. It was seriously the perfect combination! The Filet Mignon was like butter, it was seasoned perfectly and it literally melted in my mouth. Hands down THE BEST I've ever had!!!!

I must say, I was pleasantly surprised! What appears to be just another basic bar on Rainbow, is actually a very chic & cozy restaurant/bar/lounge. Beautiful chandeliers & a separated bar/restaurant area. We ate at the bar & first ordered the Crab/Spinach dip. Unfortunately, we didn't enjoy that particular dish, WAY too fishy in taste, as if the crab hadn't been prepared correctly. However, we then tried the cheese platter to go with the amazing bottle of wine we ordered, and it did not disappoint! A very nice array of cheeses, grapes, & nuts. We also tried a salad, for the life of me I can't remember the name, & that was excellent as well. The bartender was very friendly & outgoing. Definitely want to come back and try this place on the restaurant side. It looks like a very nice date spot!

Went to this place with two of my girlfriends and I will definitely come back! The ambience and decor is very relaxing, clean and modern. Happy hour was great for the drinks (30%off)! I had the blueberry mojito and it was very yummy! For food, We ordered the turkey cranberry sandwich and it was sooo good! We also had the scallops for an appetizer and they were cooked perfectly. My only suggestion is that the scallop sauce have more spice or seasoning. The service was top notch and we felt very taken care of! My friends and I had a very nice time and were very pleased with the overall experience.

I'm disappointed to say I  didn't  have a good experience. I was very  excited to come here today,  also called to see if it was busy and if I needed to make reservations.  They informed me that I didn't need to reserve a table and that we'll be able to get in if we came right away.  

Surprisingly when we got there we were the only table there. I thought they'd be busier but good for us we didn't have to wait.  They sat us at a table right across from the kitchen that was reaping of sewer smell. The floors were wet leading to our table.  As I looked  into the kitchen was when I saw the whole kitchen drenched in some kind of murky water and everyone running around trying to mop the filthy water up.  No wonder the whole place smelled like sewer. At this point I wanted to stand up and leave but didn't want to ruin dinner for everyone else.  We asked to be moved to a table towards  the front door. Out of site out of mind...

We ordered fried calamari which was bland, the octopus appetizer was just ehh. The seafood pasta was flavorless and the noodles were hard.  The clam linguini was ok. The only thing that I can give this place a star for is the decorations. It's simple & cute but smelling like sewer... I'll can pass!
This place is outstanding. Nailed it on food service ambiance. Cocktail list is a bit sweet for my taste but not enough to affect my experience at all. Grape and arugula flatbread awesome

Very good!  The food is good, the place is San, I got great service and I love to go here.  I read some of the other reviews and I can't say enough good things about this place.  The ky down sidek s there can sometimes be a wait but that is a good sign that you're at a good place in my opinion.

I actually really like the fact that this is a Non gaming bar restaurant.  The decor was clean and chic and jason,  our bartender was great. For a local spot I feel they have a good selection of beer, whiskey,  bourbon and wine. We had some food from the late night menu (crab spinach dip, fried zucchini,  mushroom pasta and gnocchi) all that with 2 wine glasses,  2 beers for 77 isn't bad. Food, service and atmosphere was great, I will definitely come back. 
P.S ladies! jason changed one tv channel so I wouldn't have to sit through another miserable basketball game

My husband and I regularly dine at this restaurant. Great spot for locals. We always bring friends and family when they visit and everyone loves this place. The service is overall always great and the food is heavenly! There is not one item we have tried that we don't love! My favorites are the spicy seafood pasta and pan seared salmon. 

There was once where we had a poor experience and spoke to the owner Andy. I do want to say that he was apologetic, took the time to listen and addressed our concerns. No establishment is perfect but it is how the owner/manager deals with the issues that count. We were satisfied with Andy's approach and have happily continued to dine here and never had another bad experience. Highly recommend!

If I could give 0 stars I would. I recently dined in at The Sparklings for lunch. I ordered a chicken sandwich and subbed mayonnaise for pesto from the lunch menu and when it came to the table it was covered mayonnaise. I told the server and she apologized and took it back to the kitchen, when she came back to the table she brought the same sandwich and placed it back on the table and brought a side of pesto. I specifically asked "is this the same plate and sandwich" she said "ya the chef isn't going to remake it so I brought a side of pesto". Honestly, I couldn't believe the customer service and lack of responsibility that this restaurant  displayed. I don't usually write reviews but for the pure principle of the service that Sparklings demonstrated I will not return there.

Regarding your rude and dismissive response, I think your comment further confirms what I have expressed. You may think that the behavior your staff displayed is justified through your response; however, that is also incorrect. In addition to the lunch order we also had dessert and coffee. Clearly, your priority is purely monetary. It's evident that your lackadaisical  approach to a business is why you are never busy and unable to handle or accommodate costumer requests.

Our waiter Eric was really good and caring. It's not something you see a lot these days. The food was really good, the only thing that disturb me was that when the meals come at the table they are warm, almost cold. It's line the meal has waited a little bit too longer before coming to the table. That is the only reason I give 4 stars.
Great food, very friendly staff, as well as fantastic surroundings inside and out. Will definitely be back soon!!

This is one of my favorite bar/restaurants in Vegas. Because bars like this in Vegas barely exist! No annoying poker machines, or the smell of smoke. The decor and vibe is inviting and endearing. It has a colorful, urban and rustic feel. The food is GOOOOD (I recommend the brussel sprouts..they will actually make you LOVE brussel sprouts)

I threw a party here on October 24. The owner, Andy made this a super easy going experience. He gave me a bit of freedom (within reason) to make the party my own. Including choosing my own music. I was able to request MY FAVORITE BARTENDER, ANGEL. And him and Ray were ON IT. I had about 45 guests and the service was quick, friendly and incredible. All of my guests were happy with the evening and commented on how adorable the venue was. I really can't thank Andy, Ray and the super attentive server/host (forgot his name, sorry!) enough for their help making the party such a success. And especially to Angel for ALWAYS making me feel like a star when I come into The Sparklings...by greeting me as soon as I walk in, and remembering my name and favorite drink!
The food was average but the ambience is superb. I would not come back to eat but maybe for drinks since it is such a nice place. Our waiter was friendly

i went back after getting an email from the manager to go back and try their food again.  So this time we went back and everything was great.  We ordered completely different dishes and everything we tried was good.  The customer service was also really good.

This restaurant has a very uptempo an chic  atmosphere.  Great for a date or to bring friends for drinks.  The menu is steaks, sandwiches and tapas.  Even some vegetarian options.  We came at midnight for a snack and a cocktail, just to test the waters.  We had a great time and had the pleasure of being served by Angel, a heartfelt/knowledgeable bartender with an exemplary attitude for customer appreciation. Thank you Angel!!!!  See you soon.
The food, the service, the pricing is all A+. Very cute and laid back resturaunt to eat at. Great for some gatherings as well non-expensive!!
New and exciting. Good menu with different cuisine. Great bartender and drinks.

I have to say that our waiter was really nice and polite. The food was mediocre but the worse part was when in the middle of our meal the manager and the employees started to sweep and spray the dining area like nobody was there.. There were 3 tables with customers eating but they just decided to start the cleaning process regardless.. We were in shock to say the least.. Please, see the pics because they're self explanatory.. If I was in charge? I would have invited those 3 tables to go to the lounge area while the main dining room is being cleaned. But no, they decided to go full cleaning mode while customers were eating.. Disrespectful, out of place and tacky. Not even at McDonalds.. Gross..

Made a reservation for my dad's birthday. Loved this place. We got one of the booths in the back which is kind of in it's in little room which made it more private for us. Very decently priced and the food was delicious. Our party ordered the crab and spinach dip and the calamari for appetizers. The steak Diane plate. Pan seared salmon, and the ribeye. We left no crumbs behind! The service wasn't bad either, it didn't feel like they were rushing us to turn tables, as normal restaurants do. We were able to enjoy our time. Definitely will be back.
5 star from me for this restaurant food is amazing service is awesome ....ambiance is so romantic thumbs up all the way

Seriously just too cute, I love everything about about the place, but most importantly I love the sincere service provided by our hilarious server José!  Thank you for the experience,  we will surely be back!! I recommend ordering  the spicy seafood pasta, scallops, and the raspberry ginger mojito, everything was absolutely delicious.

First time here...only stopped in because a friend said it was recommended.  Food was great. The decor was young and fresh. They have a decent selection of alcohol. The best part was the service. They are very attentive. I would absolutely go back very soon.
5/25/2014 - Party of 3. We enjoyed our dinner and drinks... Braised Beef Ribs - Pretty Tasty  & Spicy Seafood Pasta - Just OK. Staff was on point most of the time.. We would go back..
Great place! Have been there late at night a few times, and food was still very well prepared and fresh. The bartender, Angel, is extremely nice and attentive.

Great food - but HORRIBLE SERVICE.  It took over 35 minutes to get drinks.  During that wait no one came to our table to even take our food order.  We ordered a second round and it took another 25 minutes so we actually went to the bar and stood there til they got it for us. 5 minutes after we served served ourselves - we got our food.

If they get their service down - the place would be a money maker.  In the meantime - I wouldn't waste your time to eat here because it'll literally take you all day.

Love this place for a late night bite! The staff is always friendly and helpful and the food is always amazing. Everytime I go it seems dead but they've been open for a while so I'm hoping they do well (to be fair I usually go closer to closing time). Best thing hands down the scallops app. I bring friends here all the time and they're always super impressed with both the ambiance and the food.

The restaurant is beautifully decorated with a modern decor. The staff was very attentive and the food was delicious. We started with mojitos and cerviche. Both were great I would recommend the blueberry mojito. We also had steak Diane and the filet! Don't forget to order the cheesecake!

Our first time coming here-myself and the boyfriend - we walked in and was impressed with the decor and atmosphere. We ordered a variety of dishes from the crab and spinach dip, bacon and dates wrap meatball and the turkey and cranberry sandwich. We both enjoyed the food immensely. The food was absolutely delicious- quality ingredients and gourmet taste at a very affordable price. The staff was extremely personable and I also liked the music a lot  this was our first time here but definitely will not be our last.
Love this place! Underpriced for as good as it is! No need to hit the strip when this place is in your backyard...save your gas! Chill atmosphere and world class service!

I have been here date nights or causal wine sipping numerous times since they have opened not even a month ago.

I'm very impressed with The Sparklings.
I waited months and months for it to open and even asked "when are you opening" to a construction worker once :)

It is truly amazing the remodel that was done inside of this building. The inside used to have private hibachi rooms for goodness sake. 

The ambiance of the former sushi joint 
is now an updated and posh Martha Stewart worthy lounge. Whatever the hell that means, I just made it up. Sounds weird huh? Just look at the pics it's truly lovely. The chandelier that everyone takes pics of and talks about is magical.

The menu is a more causal (Sage like) menu. Modern American Fusion? Who cares about the title. It's just good food. 

We have not ordered entrees here YET because we have already had dinner or were on our way to dinner on our visits. 

They said that they can accommodate to vegan for us no problem. I look forward to a pasta or a special custom creation. The items that we have had (so far) are very good.

Portobello fries, flat bread, salads....wine, wine, and more wine :)

The service is super accommodating, almost too much service. I guess because they are newer they want to help and help a lot. Lol. 
The over-service was only in the dining area. In the lounge the service is perfect.

I truly love the way the did the garage door in the lounge and the way the patio area looks.

I really want to sit in that left hand side back lounge booth with a ton of people. It's really soooo big it could fit 10+++ people. I love it. Their left side dining area private table would make a large gathering super fun.  

I will update when we order full entrees and remember to take more pics since we are here soo much. 

Just go, it's a marvelous addition to the beautiful SW area. I am proud to be a regular.  
 
Oh and hubby said no I could not redecorate our whole house like the inside of The Sparklings :(((((((;

;)

One of my favorites place that's close to my house. Added bonus that kids meal is only $6!!! I mean $6, wow!! And my kids stick to the kids menu since the food is amazing. I love the wine selection too.

First off let me say what I was very impressed with the decor and layout of this place. However with as nice as it was they use paper napkins instead of cloth. I know that is nit-picky and a little pretentious but it in no way effected the overall rating, just wanted to point it out.  

The food here was good. I was hoping for better but just I kept thinking to myself that it was nothing that blew me away. The one thing I always get if on a menu is the grilled octopus and they had one. It was flavorful with I think a soy sesame sauce but it was a little to tough. The Braised Short rib was also good but not amazing. My favorite thing that night was the Gorgonzola Flatbread with honey. 

Also they have a pretty good wine selection and relatively cheap bottles of wine. For that alone I might be back soon.

Maybe they were just having an off night and when I come back it will be more to my liking.

If I could give this place zero stars I would!

The service is beyond AWFUL!!!!!! 

I went here to have drinks with my girlfriend and I arrived before she did and we wanted to sit in the bar. There were two empty stools on opposite sides of the bar. I asked the bartender if she could arrange the seats so there could be two together, she looked at me like I was at total idiot, rolled her eyes, moaned and walked away- she didn't even give me a response!! So then I proceeded to ask the other customers at the bar if they would be willing to move so I could have two seats together and they were very happy to. Why the bartender couldn't do that is so frustrating. 

We ordered a cheese plate and wine. We received our wine in about 10 minutes after ordering, we NEVER recieved our cheese plate!! We asked about it maybe 4-5 times and the bartender told us, when she would look at us after waving her down, that 'It was coming', or 'It's almost done'. Almost done?!?!?! It's a CHEESE PLATE!! We waited waaaaaayyyyy to long for it, almost 30 minutes. 

It was a bit busy, and they wern't properly staffed. That is no excuse for awful service and never receiving a cheese plate. 

I really wish this place was better becuase I live just down the street, I will never be going here again.
The bar is way to small and the main dining area is so large and awkward, why would anyone sit there is beyond me.
Food was below par. For foodies like us, it was very disappointing. But everybody there was just drinking. Maybe that's why the rating is so high, because it's more of a place to go mingle.

I don't know why this place is so quiet...such a great happy hour and such wonderful food. Love the ambiance and the small "rooms" with tables for a more intimate atmosphere. They are so great accommodating kids too and are very attentive when I have come with my family in the past

After our first visit, we have come back to The Sparklings several times.

My co-workers had a dinner night-out and I highly recommended this place, and so everyone came in with the high expectations I set for them, and they were all please with the service and the food and thanked me for telling them about this place!

 We also invited our friends from out of town to join us and they also LOVED their experience here. 

This isn't a biased statement, but their Rib Eye steak is the best I've ever had in my life. I'd say better than the steaks I've ordered at a lot of higher-rated steak restaurants where you'd pay for it a la carte. They pick the best cut of meat that just falls apart when you cut into it. 

This has easily become my favorite restaurant, and EVERYONE needs to try it out, you won't be disappointed.

Great food, great prices, gorgeous venue. Come for happy hour, the bar staff is really friendly and make great drinks. This is a great date place also. We have tried most of the appetizers and all are great, but the truffle fries and steak salad are the best. We also tried the crab dip and the lobster bruschetta and they were tasty but not the best. 

My husband has ordered the cajon chicken and shrimp pasta and he thought it was really good. He ordered the chicken parm before also and said it was average and would have preferred to get the pasta. 

Can't beat this place for the ambiance, apps, and drinks! Glad it is right next door to my apartment :)

Well started off as a good evening as the company I work for seems to enjoy this place!!! Tonight was good for a awhile although the food here is always average at best it means more to me to hang out with those you love than the food but anyways the bartenders are complete assholes!!!  If your beverage was refilled then you were lucky!! Most times it meant for you to go to the bar only to be told to wait!!! Plus be careful because if you disturb one of the bartenders locals/regulars chances are you will be kicked out for doing absolutely nothing wrong!! Kind of just the way they are there!!! Not the most welcoming environment!!! I won't be going back!!!!

This is one of those local hangouts that you will
Drive past until a friend introduced you. When I first started to go I found the food to be fantastic especially for the price. Over the last year I have noticed standards have started to decline. It is still a great restaurant and bar but they need to do some work on their customer service, particularly the the guys serving behind the bar.
Excellent atmosphere and food!! Why haven't I heard of this place before! Must add to the rotation!!

Have been here a handful of times since the first visit and never disappointed. Food is always amazing and the go to app for my wife and I is the grape and arugula flatbread. Can not go wrong with anything you order since everything is packed with flavor.

Was a little u sure when walking in, but so happy I gave this place a chance!! To start, I ordered the bacon wrapped dates/meatballs, I wasn't completely amazed by these, but the weren't bad by any means. The AMAZING appetizer was the crispy gnocchi, it was soooo amazing, we ordered a second one after we devoured the first. For the entree, I ordered the Shepherds pie. What impressed me most about this item was the fact it was made to order and not pre batched!! I wanted it without mushrooms and peas, to my surprise, this was no problem!! It was definitely the best Shepherds pie I've ever had.  The only issue I saw was that there was only one employee working the room (he was hostess, waiter, bartender, and busser) and although we arrived at 3pm on Sunday, which is probably extremely slow time for them, he was busting his ass running around and when he was going to the kitchen to get meals, customers were waiting for a table long enough that one couple left. This situation never effected us thankfully. I will definitely be back!!

I can't say the food is awesome, but it was decent. What I loved was the chandelier and the color tones in the restaurant. It was a nice quiet sit down restaurant.. casual but dressy. It's a nice place to meet some friends and chat. It wasn't too loud and almost had a fancy cafe like atmosphere.

I had spicy seafood pasta. It was good.  A little on the bland side but not horrible. The Truffle fries were good too. 

It's not a must go place for me but it's definitely on my list of places to go to have a casual quiet dinner when meeting someone.

I celebrated my daughter's 2nd birthday here with close friends and family. Had a wonderful lunch, and excellent service. Andy the mgr will work with you with how much servings you need for a certain amount of people. I was a little embarrass cause the kids were running around the place (sorry Andy), thank you Dina for entertaining the kids also!
Love this place, it's right around the corner from my house! Angel is awesome!!! The calamari is amazing, their diver scallops amazing, and their white wine clam pasta dish is bomb!!!

Ambiance:  The restaurant is in the southwest area and  they serve Italian cuisine. This is my  first time at sparklings, and  the whole vibe is cozy and a good place to socialize,with friends, and  family it would be great  place for a date. The dining area has great spacing  of which  you can definitely have a conversation. overall this would be a good place to dine and entertain  friends and  family.

Service: Service was great, the waiter was attentive to our needs, and the small requests to be changed in our food  was well received. 

Food: Food has been good, I ordered the steak diane and requested the beef to be cooked medium and my order turned out great. My wife ordered the Spicy Seafood pasta minus the spice. The spice was definitely removed, the pasta however was not al dente and  was swimming in sauce. 

Overall: I would definitely come back to try the other entrees, dining experience is great since the place is conducive to socializing. There are a few misses in the food which can be rectified by requesting the changes with the servers.

Was pleasantly surprised when I walked in. It's such a cool upscale colorful looking interior. The benches and seats are ALL velvet and beautiful! Great first date place. We had the portobello fries (TO DIE FOR) which were so flavorful! My glass of wine was great. Ordered a pasta with white sauce and it was very "clean" and fresh tasting like they just made it in the back from scratch but definitely needed a little flavor. I kept adding salt and pepper but if you bring it home and add season salt it would be the bomb! My mom got the pork chops and they were WONDERFUL. It was almost like a light teriyaki glaze flavor. The dessert trio was great for sharing for 2. Only gave it 4 stars because our server only had 2 tables and took so long to bring the check which killed the vibe and whenever I called him over for something he seemed a little annoyed but nothing that wouldn't keep me from coming back.

Ambiance is really nice here. Food is really good I got the classic burger with side of truffle fries! And it's really good. They also have a separate bar. The staffs are really nice... (shout out to our server tyler) definitely would be back to try the other menus they have the prices are also decent not bad for a nice place and good service.

My husband and I love this place the ambiance the house music the bartender Angel is our absolute Fav!!! He is always helpful engaging caring about each and every client he serves!!! I love the 5-Star quality food like short ribs with mashed potatoes the cheese platter, the best drinks here not watered down like most places in Vegas. But definitely stop by the bar area after you eat at the restaurant to meet Angel, he will lighten your day up!!! Oh and kudos to the best music in a restaurant!!!

As a party of two, we were seated immediately and received prompt and friendly service.  Had the butternut squash gnocchi, seared scallops, and caesar salad for appetizers.  Had the linguini with clams and the salmon for our entrees.  Had a flourless chocolate cake for dessert.  Every dish was phenomenal.  We got all of this, plus two glasses of wine and a beer, for under 100 bucks.  All around fantastic dining experience; we will be coming back.

Our first time here. We started with the date bacon wrapped meatballs & tuna tartar. I'd recommend both. They came out promptly, almost fast food fast, but they tasted nothing of fast food. Loved both, would totally order again. I ordered the short ribs for dinner and my husband the ribeye. I LOVED my short ribs but I have to say, his steak was not worth $25. It was something you'd get at, as he put it, the truck stop except they call it a skirt steak. It was thin, poorly seasoned, and really not what I'd expect for even a $15 steak, much less $25. All in all it was a good meal, id just not recommend the steak. We ended with a flour less chocolate cake that was heavenly. Presentation on all the food was that of a fine dining establishment, the service was extraordinary, and the decor is modern/contemporary/southern. I will defiantly be eating here again, and it's for sure a place to bring company!

About two years ago I drove by this place and thought "oh, how cute they have fairy lights! I want to see what they have going on." Little did I know that I would become OBSESSED with this place. Two years later, and I do not tire of their food or drinks. I plan everything here from Bachelorette party brunches to simple BFF dinners. I have come here every year for my birthday for the last two years as well. The atmosphere is great, the staff is SO friendly. I've not once had a bad experience or encountered anything even remotely close to unsatisfied. 
The staff clearly help each other out. If no one is up front, it is most likely because they are running dishes or behind the bar. If your glass looks half empty, any employee will come and fill your drink. 
Absolute love, all around.

I would come back here again... Pappardelle pasta isn't homemade, so I didn't order it.  Instead, I ordered steak Diane, it was pretty good.  And the crab and spinach dip was nice as well, but too much cheese..

Nice newer restaurant on the out skirt of town! Everything we tried was delicious and prepared perfectly! I got the 12 oz Ribeye and Michelle tried the BBQ baby back ribs and we were truly impressed! Meat feel off the bone for Michelle and mine was the perfect Medium! Garlic mashed potatoes were strong and delicious, steamed and grilled to perfection! Ray are server was top notch and super friendly (make sure you have him sing for you!! Lol) . We will be back again!
Loved the food, the service and the prettiness decor! Long happy hour. I will be frequenting. Thank you for the great experience :)

I came here last week for a good friends birthday dinner. Although most of the party arrived at the time the reservation was booked for (9:30pm; super late because nothing else was available?), I arrived 15 minutes late. The server brought out the birthday girls' drink but quickly left before I could ask for water and before the other 6 people who ordered drinks could ask if there's will be coming. Waiter shows up 15 minutes after dropping off the first drink and asks me what I'd like. I politely asked for water...which he went to an absent table, grabbed a water off of that and then handed it to me.
