I'm in the service industry, as well as two other guests at the table, and we were baffled at how terrible the service was. We understand being short-staffed but it was our group (12 people), one couple, and another party (~20 people). It took almost 30 minutes for the people who originally ordered their drinks to get them. We were able to order our food after about 45 minutes of wondering what the hell our server was doing. Dinner arrived by 2 or 3 different food runners/servers for myself and 4 people at my side of the table. As the birthday girl, myself and a few others finished, the server asked the birthday girl what she would like for dessert (he was absent as we were eating) when another girl from the other end of the table had to say, "Before anyone talks about dessert, when are we getting our dinner?" The other half of our table didn't get their dinner!!!! 
I felt like an ass for not realizing that the other half didn't get their dinner. However, how did the server not catch that? Oh, because he didn't bring out anyone's food and was completely absent while the few of us were eating. Mind you, when they did bring out our food initially, the server popped by to make sure things looked good so far. I asked for silverware because they brought out my food with nothing to eat with. He ran to another table, grabbed a naked pair, and handed it to me. That's fine, but there weren't any napkins so I couldn't wipe my hands after eating the zucchini sticks. 
Anyway, the manager (I'm assuming that's who it was), came over and apologized for not having the other half of the tables dinner out due to the receipt not completely printing in the kitchen and ensured us that the waiter did put in the orders. The orders for the other half of the table came out but one was wrong. The woman who ordered originally asked for no sauce (allergy) but they brought out one with sauce so it had to go back immediately and be remade. The poor girl decided to order another glass of wine while waiting for her food to be remade only to be told that they were out of that wine. 
I know this is a long review, but I'm hoping that the manager/owners read this and fix their service issue. The decor was nicely done, food was okay, but my goodness was the service terrible! The only reason why I left an 18% tip was because we had a larger party and the server had mentioned that he had 3 teenage daughters in passing. I felt bad for the guy and maybe it was a bad day (we all have those) but that's no excuse for how terrible the service was. If you can't handle it, ask another server for help or pass it off completely to someone who can. We were not a rude bunch and were always polite but the service...I'm flabbergasted at the service!!! Our reservation was at 9:30pm, we waited for others to arrive, ordered food at by 10:30pm and because of the terrible service and our mysteriously disappearing server, we didn't leave until 12:30AM! We shouldn't have been there for 3 hours and twiddled our thumbs waiting for our server to magically appear. The birthday girl was so embarrassed for choosing the restaurant that she sent everyone apology texts after we all left. 
Bottom line - fix your service.

This place is my go to whenever I need a place to eat or drink. When it comes to having visitors, needing to celebrate, happy hours, or just cause this is the place to go. Food and drinks are amazing as well as the service. It's rare to have all those things come together in one location! LOVE this place!

Stopped into this place since a few friends wanted to try it out. Boy I should have suggested somewhere else! Not a good place to eat at all. And it seems that the place does not know what type of decor it should be going for as none of it matched. They didn't stick with 1 design but had several that were completely mismatched. 

On to the food. Tried 3 of the items off the menu. First off was a Flat bread pizza & I cannot remember the price of it but whatever it was - not worth it. It was completely soggy in the middle & just no taste to it at all. My friend ordered that & I tried a piece of it but - gross. 

Truffle Parmesan Fries "sea salt, parsley, lemon garlic sauce" ($6) - It came with one dipping sauce which was just mayonnaise (seriously?) & the chunks of garlic were falling off but there there really was no taste to the fries whatsoever & they were not crispy. They weren't even salted. Since they were cool when we tried to add salt to them it would not stick. I've had Truffle fries at other venues & they at least have the truffle sauce on them - there was nothing present on these fries. Would not ever order them again. 

I ordered the Crispy Gnocchi "creamy pesto, Italian sausage, peas, crushed candied walnuts" ($7.50) because it sounded so excellent & after the complete let down of the other two food items I was still hungry. It seems that they forgot to put the order in as I had to ask them for it after sitting for 30 minutes & not receiving it but others that ordered food after me were getting their food. Finally when it did arrive I was grateful as I was starving after not have hardly eaten anything all day. I do have to say that this dish as great. I really loved it. Wished the portion would have been larger in fact. 

Service was good in the beginning of the evening as the bar area was not that full. But as the night went on we constantly had to flag bartenders down. Bartenders left our food dishes that we clearly were not eating from sit in front of us for over 45 minutes. At that point I placed them on the rail of the bar so they would take them. I would think that it would be common sense if you see plates that have most of the food still on them that you would ask if everything was ok or if you liked your food - nope finally took plates away with most of the food on them after I had to move them onto the rail where they make drinks without a peep if all was ok. After paying our bill we were still finishing our drinks & never once did the bar tenders ask if we needed anything else even when our drink glasses went empty & we were still there talking. Didn't even ask if we wanted another drink or a glass of water. In fact they were actually ignoring us & wouldn't even look at us or come to the place on the bar we were sitting. 

How this place has 4.5 stars is completely beyond me. I think it has to be the employees/owners/their friends writing the reviews to bump it up that high. The Crispy Gnocchi is what is saving them from getting zero stars (although I realize yelp doesn't allow zero). The other food & service gives them a zero. Even though the Crispy Gnocchi was great I won't be going back to this place. Not worth the drive even if it is close to my work.

I really really enjoy coming to The Sparklings.

As with a lot of other restaurants I heard about this place though foodie co-workers. The Sparklings is opened by the same people who opened Oyshi down the street. The inside is to me very "hipster" but I love the set up. They have a bar to the right that is sectioned off with a window. There are a cluster of tables in the center and long booth seating with tables along the wall and on the left there are sectioned off semi private dining rooms. 

Everytime I've been here I've had the same server, Jason, and he is awesome. He really knows the menu and will joke around with his customers. Charismatic. 

We've tried several things on the menu but it seems like everyime we come here we are starving and I never remember to take pictures. 

My personal favorite dish is the Shrimp Linguini and the Creme Brulee. I'll have to update this review later with pictures.

All in all, wonderful place with great atmosphere and service. The food is good and priced well. Definitely need to try!

The Sparklings has some fantastic items in the appetizer section. 2 to 3 appetizers plus 1 entree would be perfect for two. Pricing doesn't look bad.

On our first visit, we ordered following three items. All good, I would have rated 5 stars for that visit.

- Seared Diver Scallops - served with crispy rice cakes and lemony beurre blanc $7.5 (5/5)
- Grapes and Arugula Flat Bread - candied walnuts, ricotta & balsamic vinaigrette $9 (4/5)
- Spicy Seafood Pasta - Spaghetti with shrimp, scallop, mussel, squid in house spicy light tomato sauce $15 (4.5/5)

On our second visit today, we ordered following five items. Hits and misses - mixed result. Not perfect, but less than $50 bill for 5 items is impressive.

- Crispy Gnocchi - creamy pesto, Italian sausage, peas and crushed candied walnuts $7.5 (4/5)
- Crab & Spinach Dip - grilled and fried pita bread $8 (3.5/5)
- Lobster Bisque - served with wonton crisps and green onions, sour cream optional $9 (2.5/5)
- Steak Salad - petite filet, spinach, red onion, feta cheese, apple and white vinaigrette $10 (3/5)
- Shrimp Po Boy Sandwich - shrimp tempura, remoulade, lettuce and tomato $8.5 (3/5)

Found this restaurant on yelp and decided to give it a try this past Saturday night.

Love the proximity of the location to my house.  Less than 5 minutes away.  It's located in the Southwest part of town, near the Blue Diamond area.

The restaurant itself is very spacious and there's a beautiful chandelier in the center of the restaurant.  There's more of the long table seating and humongous booths than there is for couples.

Unfortunately, it was DEAD on a Saturday night.  Very surprising considering it is "Valentine's Day" weekend.. although there were several others dining it, it was just a bit too quiet that night.

As for the food, we ordered:
- Calamari salad for an appetizer (A-ok.. I wouldn't order again)
- Crispy gnocchi with italian sausage and peas (the sauce was very tasty!  however the more I kept eating, the more I felt it was a bit too creamy and heavy for my liking)
- Cajun Chicken and Shrimp Pasta (yummy & tasty.. sauce was just right)
Prices were overall reasonable.  For our meal, we spent just about $30 or so.

Server we had was nice and just the right amount of attentiveness.

Overall I think I can give this restaurant one more try.  I hope they expand a bit more on their menu.

I don't know how  this place gets such high reviews on Yelp. It was subpar to say the least.  The only redeeming quality was that the server had a really nice attitude and was very friendly.  The food was terrible - please don't waste your time.

I don't usually give negative reviews, but this was awful! The lobster bisque was the very worst I have ever had. I threw it away after one taste.   I also got the shepherd's pie. I don't quite understand how this dish is categorized as shepherd's pie. It was huge chunks of greasy ground beef mixed with equally large chunks of vegetables sitting in said grease.  There was a scoop of mashed potatoes sitting in the middle of it...clearly it was cooked separately as it's on dish and added to the overcooked ground beef. The pie crust on top was ridiculous.  Since these were so disappointing I decided to really inspect the "crab" spinach dip so I put it on a plate and dissected it. It was somewhat decent for a spinach dip, but I am being 100% serious when I say I saw absolutely no crab, nor was there the slightest hint of crab presence in the flavor.   

On a positive note- My husband said the salmon was delicious, although the serving size was very small. 

I am so disappointed, as the reviews on this place are wonderful for the most part. The food I tried was legitimately awful so I have no desire to give it another try. Skip this place, it's not worth it.

We finally had the chance to check this place out! The ambience is really nice. The pricing is really good! The only good App. We had were the portabella mushroom fries this was fired & seasoned very well! ( we also had the truffle fries and spinach dip, honestly both were bland. Not enough truffle on the fried and the spinach dip from Costco is way better) I had the seafood pasta-  this was REALLY good. Will come back to try more of the menu and get the seafood pasta again. It's beautiful inside. Oh and their Moscow Mule was really good, as well!

Delicious delicious!!! The flourless cake is amazing!!! It si now my favorite restaurant. I always have the spicy seafood pasta. The appetizers are also delicious, try the tuna tartare, the seared diver scallops, the ceviche, the veggie quesadillas and the crispy pesto gnocchi. Everything really is delicious!!
Great new restaurant in the area. Wide range of food choices, amazing ambiance, and friendly staff. Food was great!

My girlfriend and I come here AT LEAST once a week of not more. If we miss a week we fee lost and confused about not seeing our man Angel, the bartender here at Sparklings. Absolute gem of a bartender and always friendly, personable, and even knows our drink orders by heart. Definitely recommend the Pyramid draft beer and the Kenwood Red. All food is great but the Steak salad and zucchini sticks are definitely a good compliment to any drink you get. So take your significant other down here to Sparklings and tell Angel his favorite couple sent you. Well we'll probably even see you here. Yeah it's that serious.

From the outside, I didn't expect the interior to look so classy- gorgeous namesake chandelier is the highlight of the dining room, bar area is quite nice as well. Décor reminds me of Alice in Wonderland with upscale-tea-party dishes and some garden figurines, some private seating areas available for groups.

Best for lunch or drinks and apps, rather than dinner IMO.
Almost didn't order the CRISPY GNOCCHI because I'm not a fan of that pasta in general, but the positive reviews persuaded me and the pesto sauce won me over: good combination of flavors and textures in this dish.
PORTOBELLO FRIES are simple and tasty with two dipping sauces, GRILLED OCTOPUS is perfectly charred but would prefer an even portion to the set of three received, hard to share. SEARED DIVER SCALLOPS are delightful, but deceptively plated with crispy rice cakes that look like additional scallops. The lemon beurre blanc is the perfect sauce for this dish.
Steer clear of the LOBSTER BRUSCHETTA though- recommended by our server, this dish was a disaster that put me off finishing my meal. Menu describes it as lobster, avocado, and mango (neither of which we even detected), in a cream-cheese aioli, on toasts. It reminded me of a really bad country club's version of seafood salad. Pairing seafood with cheese is tricky, this dish does not do it well.

Good wine and cocktail selection, the Justin Cab or the two sparkling by-the-glass options are solid, but frankly I'm baffled as to why the menu has so few glass options in the first place. Service was polite and attentive, love the variety of seating options.
I love this bar.  My friend practically lives here.  I'm surprised they don't make him pay rent.
Sparkling is always the best. Come and try it! It's reasonable price and great service as well.

The only thing stopping this place from being 5-star is the hideous looping elevator music soundtrack.
Sump-sump-sump. Wah-wah-wah-wah....
Moving on!
Food is spectacular, Service is awesome, the drink menu looked good, so did deserts. Price was fairly decent and they were serving late.
The bathroom is beautiful inside.
It's also a restaurant, and the booths can have the curtains drawn to make it all private. 
This is the kind of place where jeans and a t are somewhat out of place.
The whole vibe is upscale and beautiful, like the Cosmo.

Had an amazing dinner tonight!  Was amazed at the atmosphere of the restaurant. It was not what I expected when I pulled into the parking lot!  The inside is elegant and spacious with beautiful statement pieces.  The staff was prompt and polite. Our server Tim was absolutely great! Very honest and funny.  Was a pleasure to have him serve us, he made sure to constantly check on us regardless of how busy the restaurant was.  I loved that he knew the details of the dishes and made great recommendations. The French onion was delicious as were the truffle fries!  All in all a great evening!  Will definitely be back again.  Thank you sparkling a and Tim for a memorable evening

Well everyone, there you have it. See how this owner conducts and replies to anyone who has an issue with his restaurant/staff. He is completely unprofessional, and if you say something he does not like he bashes you on here. How brave :)  He wanted to state that most of my reviews on yelp were 0 stars but that's not true. I even complimented the decor of this establishment in my review... but I guess that isn't good enough. He even states I am an "unhappy person?" how would he know that by me visiting his restaurant? - oh wait, he got one thing correct - I wasn't happy that i spent $200 and got slow service, had a bar tender as a waiter (who was also rude and kept calling me Bebe, Sugar etc. I don't need to be called pet names by anyone, like many of people have stated on here) had to step on threw up on the bathroom floor and had to deal with a male walking into a the lady's restroom. So I guess he is correct- I am unhappy. Unhappy with the service I got! Finally this guy got something right! (Yay!) Any other business owner would in fact look into this and have the business sense to reply in a professional manner. As threw up all over the bathroom floor (health hazard) the waiter who thinks its okay to call women by pet names (sexual harassment much?) and a male walking into the lady's room is quite serious. If you ask me - this guy is the one who is unhappy.  But then again, I would be unhappy too if I got a comments like this. - But heck yea! I will stay away! And I will make sure others do as well. No one deserves this AT ALL.
Been here two times, everything went super well ! 100 stars!!! Write more about it later ...

My wife and I recently dined here because she was looking for spots that were open late. We came in around 12:30am and were promptly greeted by Jose who sat us. He led us to the bar but we asked if we could sit at the big booth next to it and he said of course. We started with a Caesar salad, the French Onion SoupThe Caesar had a great flavor, the onion soup was really good, I also got the spinach and crab dip. The breads that come with it are amazing, especially the crispy one. For our mains my wife got the butternut squash gnocch and Ricotta Grape and Arugula Flat bread and my wife adored the flat bread, and I got the Rib Eye with a wine sauce, mashed potatoes, and asparagus. The Steak was amazing and a perfect medium. I particularly loved the wine sauce that comes on it and Jose brought an extra side of it for me without me even asking. He was so polished that it was surreal. He was polite, on point with pre bussing and refills and at one point I dropped by fork while eating my steak and before my wife had even completed offering me her's to use he was already there with a new roll up. I am in the field and a high volume and high class restaurant and I was still way impressed. The food itself was delicious, the ambiance was really nice with nice music, and the service was phenomenal. I highly recommend coming here, especially late night and you should hope you get Jose.

Great decor and good menu. Happy hour is a bonus too! Enjoyed the scallops and a steak salad. Atmosphere was fun and I loved the music. Jazz piano helped me relax. The bartender Anthony was friendly too. I will definitely be back!!

Yes a fan I am! Here's why...first of all it's about time we have an upscale gourmet eatery in this otherwise chain restaurant laden area of SW Vegas. Secondly the food was very nice and at 30% off happy hour prices on a Friday night, we had a grand time trying a variety of appetizers which matched well with our prosecco (sparkling like the restaurants name) and novelty cocktails, I had a blueberry ginger mojito, or two...yet I digress...the food, bacon wrapped meatballs (divine), langostino bruschetta (splendid) and fried zucchini sticks (nice). The last but not least thing is the ambience... feminine, artsy, delicate yet comfortable... a contrast against the  predominately male staff.

Food was decent - they have great salads. The service was a bit lacking - although admittedly they were busy. Took a long time to get our server at first, and then drinks for half the table didn't come. Eventually we caught someone and they came out but dinner was more than half way over at that point. 4 stars for food and decor - one star off for service assuming it was a bad night.

This place was amazing ! My friends and I went for brunch and truly enjoyed ourselves. The bottomless mimosas were $18 and worth it ! The food was AMAZING and the proportions given were WELL worth the cost. It's more of a fancy place with chandeliers and music like Tina Turner "what's Love got to do with it" and Mariah Carey songs lol. I would recommend this to EVERYONE. I got the chicken and waffles and asparagus on the side . I will definitely visit again whenever I decide to visit Vegas again !

Another new place that I loved...

I've been on a roll recently with my bookmarks & this place has been on the list for a few months. Walking in its so beautiful! You would never expect the inside to look the way it does & I love moments like that. 

We opted for the bar tonight because it was calling our name & felt very casual. The bartender was awesome & hooked up the liquor which made everything else better. They have so many great drinks on the menu & everything tastes like candy.

The food was excellent & we decided on a few smaller plates so we could taste a few different things. We ended up with a great Caesar salad, the crispy gnocchi that were phenomenal, the bacon & date meatballs (my favorite item) & then the decadent bacon & mushroom cream spaghetti which can't be described well enough by me. It was a really great meal that was very casual & memorable. 

Great menu, service & beautiful decor.
A pretty great place! Not only is the food amazing but the environment is so nice. I definitely recommend it!

The ambiance and decor is STUNNING!! Reminds me of southern country chic. You could definitely host a large dinner party here. 

This is more like 3.5 stars because the food was just ok. I ordered the scallops appetizer and the bruschetta appetizer based on other reviews on yelp. The size of the scallop itself were so tiny!! Did not look like any of the pics on yelp. The crispy rice was way too hard so I just ate the scallops. The flavor and preparation was good though. The bruschetta was the best thing I tried although it was not memorable and something I probably won't crave for in the future. Also had the truffle fries and that was good too but nothing special. 

My friends had sandwiches which looked better than what I had. They both loved their meals. So maybe I will go back to try other dishes/apps and give an updated review.

Other than that prices are decent and decor and ambiance is amazing!
Love this place! Had my birthday dinner here. Foods great, service is great and it definitely added to an amazing birthday! Tyler our server was the best!
I liv coming here when I visit Vegas. The ambiance is beautiful. It has the elegance of the 40s era.  The seats are comfortable and space between each table.

Thanks for perfect service tonight and the wonderful staff here at Sparklings. Clayton and Andy were so attentive and the food was spectacular! We'll be coming here again and again for sure. Come for the happy hour too!

Came here early on a Friday night and it was very cozy and welcoming! The service was amazing. It wasn't too busy yet, although when we left around 6:30 it was starting to get kind of busy. I got the truffle fries and the Amethyst cocktail. Both were very good and the cocktail was very strong! Would recommend coming here during the less busy hours, and the bar seating is just as nice as the regular.
Amazing food, amazing drinks. Went for happy hour. Can't wait to go back. Had the salmon. It was mouth watering. I wanted to order two. Hahahaha.

This is a great new local spot. If you live in mountains edge, theres no close good sit down restaurants. This restaurant has a beautiful atmosphere and wonderful food! We ordered 5 different items and everything was amazing. We will definitely go back and highly  this new restaurant! Happy hour 7 days a week 5-10 in the bar 30% off all   alcoholic beverages.

We first went to this place earlier in the year, when it opened, and we loved it. I typically always get the steak salad, but have tried various other appetizers/entrees/desserts and they have all been so tasty!

I absolutely LOVE the decor in this restaurant as well as their outdoor space... so much so, that when my fiance and I were stressed out from trying to plan our wedding, we decided to have the restaurant host our reception! We worked with Andy and created a wonderful menu and experience for our wedding guests. He was very patient and understanding and just wanted to make sure we were happy. On the day of the reception, he was there for the majority of the time and made sure everything went smoothly. I really could not have had a better experience with Andy and his staff. Although I was nervous at first, since it's not a traditional wedding reception spot, I was pleasantly surprised and elated at the professionalism of everyone involved. Since it's still relatively new, I'd say about 99% of our guests had never been there and most of them raved to us about how good the food was, so I hope that they return on their own and continue keeping this place in business!

The cost for the reception was VERY reasonable and not inflated by the wedding industry. If it can handle a wedding reception, I would definitely recommend this restaurant for any private event.

Ok, so hardly anybody in the restaurant on a Saturday night was our first clue. We made a reservation based on the good reviews but it was clear we didn't need one since it was practically empty. I have to say a pretty nice decor and nice atmosphere but then again to me it's about the food. It was just sub par. But I'm from New York and to have to pay for bread that came with only enough butter for one slice of bread really put me over the top, no salt and pepper on the table and couldn't find a waiter when I needed extra Parmesan . For me and my husband we'll never return. I'd say skip it. Zest was so much better. And I'm just saying as a New Yorker.

Just ate here based off of other Yelp reviews.  Was looking for a restaurant off-strip close to where my parents live for Mother's Day dinner.  Wish my experience was like other reviewers, but there were some big red flags for me here.

1. Sunday night and the restaurant wasn't even half-full.  I suppose you could argue that it was a Sunday, but I don't think 8:30 is late, especially on a weekend and a holiday.  You could also argue its new, so perhaps people don't know about it, but the manager said it's been open for seven months...

2.  Very strange decor:  I dig the high ceilings with exposed rafters and industrial looking fans.  But then there's a huge crystal chandelier in the middle of the space.  There's other modern touches, but then there's always some strange old-fashioned thing mucking it up, like tacky gold frames, more gold light fixtures, and multicolored pastel painted walls.  It's like someone wanted to decorate a restaurant inspired from the apartment from "Friends."  Add to that the bizarre layout--it's almost one big room with not much privacy at your table, but then again, when you walk in, there's a gigantic piece of floor real estate that could be a dance floor.  

3.  Menu is all over the place.  I don't know why, I thought it was going to be Italian, based off of other reviews and the photo I saw of the menu pasta section.  But it's definitely not Italian, nor any specific cuisine.  There is Italian on the menu, along with French, American, and even Hawaiian, so said our waiter.  In fact, when questioned, the waiter told us there is no real theme and that they try to give everyone a bit of everything.  That seems unfocused and generic to me.  

4.  Biggest red-flag is that while the three of us still had appetizers we were eating, the waiter brought our three mains at the same time.  Our waiter was a nice guy, but how could he make such a faux pas?  I mean, surely he would have known that he had not taken our apps plates--that Hell, we hadn't even finished them yet.  To me, that's a terrible sign of a restaurant because it means the timing wasn't right, and I wonder how much of our entrees were pre-cooked and re-heated for them to come out so fast?   Not sure who's to blame for the lapse in etiquette, but either way, doesn't look good on the kitchen or the wait staff.  Plus, waiter didn't apologize for this or even seem to be aware that you just can't that.  

As for the food itself, pretty mediocre.  Clam and Spinach dip was intensely rich and could've used less cheese, especially since half the order came with deep fried pita bread.  Zuchinni sticks were ok.  French onion soup was the opposite of the dip--not rich enough.  I had the salmon entree, and while the salmon was cooked perfectly, I thought the cream sauce it was served in was old-fashioned and cloying; Mom had linguine with clams, which is pretty hard to mess up; and Dad had braised short-ribs, which were served cold.  I suppose a restaurant can't cook short-ribs to order, so obviously they need to re-heat what was cooked earlier, but you'd think they could get the temp right, especially since they rushed out the entree as mentioned above.

I feel bad to write a negative review because I really wanted to like this local restaurant that's in a great location for people who want to avoid the Strip.  But I certainly wouldn't go back, not unless at a minimum the menu was revamped and refocused.
I came here not too long ago and the place is lovely. The service was pretty great and so was the food. The only sad part is that my friend and I had a really bad stomach ache the next day.

This place has a cool atmosphere but the food is lackluster. It tries to emulate trendy places in LA but the food definitely falls short.  It too bad cause the inside is cool.   They should consider a brunch menu on Sunday.

Right around the corner and I don't know why we waited so long to try it! This little gem is kind of hidden but it is one of our new faves! Very cute inside and the food was phenomenal! We went in very late one night after a concert and sat in the main dining room, all the other patrons were in the bar area. I ordered Tomato Basil Soup and the Blackened Rainbow Trout. The soup was SOOOO flavorful and rich. The Rainbow Trout tasted so fresh and bright, and the portion size was just right. Our server, I believe, was the bar tender since it was so late. He was super friendly and chatty and made sure not to forget about us in the dining room. We've heard so many great things about this place and they are all definitely true. Highly recommend this place!

Similar vibe and menu selection as Honey Salt, which is why we chose it. Our waiter was the owner/founder - very kind, friendly, and attentive - conversation with him was the cherry on top of a great meal. Great drink and appetizer selection, above all. Highly recommend the pesto gnocchi. Calm, open, friendly ambiance.

I came in for lunch with a friend. The decor was really nice and put service was good. The food was just okay. I didn't really find anything memorable. The server said their gnocchi was their best dish but my friend and I found it really bland. We got a couple items including a flat bread with grapes and the tuna tartare. Everything was just okay

Love the atmosphere, love the food, love the staff! You MUST get the portobello fries. SO delicious and a reasonable price, especially for an appetizer. The crispy gnocchi is also on point. The turkey and cranberry sandwich has a nice twist with the brie cheese and all the flavors marry beautifully together. The spicy seafood pasta is also delicious. So far, we have not been disappointed with anything we've ordered off of the menu, and don't think we will be.

First off, this place is in such an obscure location. But if you can gather up the energy to get over there, it's worth it. Their menu offers the type of items I always looks for at new American restaurants. The interior design of the place is also super eclectic and feels very homey. 

The bartender was super friendly, as well as our waiter and the manager. The drinks were really good and creative. I loved the combinations on the menu. I wanted to try every single appetizer, but sadly that isn't realistic. The ones I did try were good. Some of them weren't executed as well as I had hoped. But still, I wasn't extremely disappointed. The pesto gnocchi was by far my favorite thing I ate. I highly recommend it as well as the fried zucchini. Mmmmm so good!

Love this place!  Super cute gem tucked away in a spot you would never guess.  A friend had to tell me about it or I never would have gone. Nice atmosphere with some fun decor.  There are lots of different seating postures so you can find what you like: sofa, lounge chairs, regular dining table, bar seating, and booth seating.  

The food is good as well. Didn't knock my socks off but definitely worth trying. 

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is bc the service is slow. We were sitting in the lounge area in the bar so perhaps they just need to get a server to cover that area rather than the bar tender.

I will definitely be back!

OMG!!!!!!  Took my friend here who was visiting from Seattle..There was a large table of 12 or more dining..Very quiet group.. We were seated  for lunch  and had the place all to ourselves after about 15 min.  The place is nicely decorated..Love the huge booths in the back  for larger families.   We decided on Lobster Bisque and 5  appetizers.. The Flat bread, Bruchetta , wings, Gnocchi, and Bacon Date wrapped  meatballs.. All were delicious,  and the presentation was beautiful..I would  definitely return ... really nice meal..

Great spot for a casual dinner or drinks. Good atmosphere. Good menu. Good prices. Menu is a bit small but you sacrifice quantity for great quality. The gnocchi is delicious. And any of the pasta dishes are fantastic. Definitely a new neighborhood favorite spot for date nights.

Hubby and I tried this place out today, as we are starting our healthy routine tomorrow. I have been wanting to check this place out but we never had time, and figured it would be perfect as a send off to our current eating habits. Based off on recommendations I've seen here on yelp, we ordered the crispy gnocchi, seared scallops, and portobello fries. The gnocchi and scallops were pretty good, hubby liked the little rice cake things that came with the scallops. The portobello fries were okay, nothing too special. I think the portobello fries at Echo and rig were better, but that's just me. We were also going to order the tempura and mushroom pasta, but we were both still pretty full from lunch earlier, and the appetizers filled us up, so we had to pass on that. The appetizers were decently sized for the price, which was good. All in all, food were okay but nothing totally struck me as special. We probably should have come here on an empty stomach so we could have tried more of what The Sparkling had to offer. We will give this place another shot (on one of our cheat days ^_^)

Went to Sparklings late night, very excited since my girlfriend and I had heard that it was very good.  

Let me start off by saying that this place is open late (until 2am) and the bartender had told us that 2 servers had left shortly before a small late night crowd of 4 small groups came in.  

As we entered we were not greeted by a host or hostess.  We waited for about 2 minutes then decided to walk over to the bar.  1) Because there was someone there who could helpe us and 2) because the music was way too quiet in the dining area, uncomfortably quiet.  It's a very large open room and with all that silence and only 2 couples eating, it had this kind of echo that big open rooms have.  Was a little strange.

Bartender was very friendly and attentive given the fact that he was serving 4 groups and working both the dining room and the bar area.  

The food sounded really good, but I wasn't very impressed.

-The gnocchi sounded delicious.  It was good, but nothing great.
-The Shepherd's Pie was actually pretty good.  Nothing incredible, but good.
-Bacon and date wrapped meatballs were...good.  Are we sensing a theme here?
-Salmon over rice with caper sauce.  Good.  Sauce was great in flavor, but lacking because there was barely any on my salmon.  

The service was great at the bar, but I was shocked that we waited 2 minutes at the front for a host which never came.

The music in the bar was too loud and over the top.  One of the TVs was playing infommercials.

I very much wanted to give this place more stars.  Especially since the bartender was so nice, but we unfortunately had a 3-star experience.

My bf and i came in because i was craving Sheperd's Pie and they had it on their menu. I admit that it was close to 1am which is an hour before they close at 2am....and we waited for about 5 minute before we were seated since the bartender was going to wait on us. That was a little odd to me... But oh well.

Service was 2/5... We were the only patrons in the restaurant area and we seemed to be a nuisance to them since they seemed to be having a ball in the bar area. But i didn't feel like drinking...i wanted to eat since I had just gotten off of a 14 hour shift and was starving. And if dining this late was not what they wanted to do they should not keep the restaurant open. They should just keep the bar open. I would have given 1 star but the busser was great so I have an extra star for his service. 

The food was...I have no other words... But the food was horrible. Brussel sprouts...I normally love them... And I did eat all of it...As read above I just got off a 14 hour shift and was starving. So I ate it... But it was so burnt and bitter. Blah then the sheperd's pie... Was cold. The mixture inside was soupy instead of a creamy meaty filling. They did have a little bit of mashed potatoes on it underneath the puff pastry.. But that was cold as well...I would have complained but the attitude of the server was as such that I did not want to waste my time saying anything. 

Maybe if I had come at a different time, the service and the food would have been better. Who knows? I see that other people had better service and food then I did. But with the food that I tasted and the service that I received will not have me rushing back which is a shame since they are just down the street from me.

I loved the atmosphere and decorations  of this place. Everything almost seemed mismatched yet it all seemed to go together. Its a huge open space so I am sure even if they were crowded it wouldn't seem that way.  Had a house salad for appetizer and the jambalaya  for an entree.  Good service here as well. Be sure to read what's in the house salad before ordering! It was great. I appreciate  the attentiveness  of the waiter to be sure that I was okay with it. As it isn't your ordinary house salad. For one thing it comes dressed, with grapes and apples. Which I loved since plain salads are so boring. Had the amethyst  cocktail  which was nice fruity I wish I could have ordered it in a tall glass! Jambalaya  was good as well but I wish I had some more shrimp! Lol I love shrimp!

Let me start with the good: the ambiance is great with a large chandelier in the center of the dining area, shabby chic decor all around and mood lighting. The not-so-good: the food was greasy and mediocre, especially for being so expensive. Happy hour is only at the bar seating, not at tables. And the drinks I had were average and again, expensive. I'm not planning on going back.

We were really excited to try this place out since it's close to home. We were underwhelmed. A group of four of us ordered eight appetizers and two salads and it was just okay. The gnocchi was the star of the show. Fries were soggy, scallops were a total let-down (the plate came with TWO scallops and four scallop-imposter rice cakes). A few items were missing from the salads. Our server was slow despite us letting him know we were headed to a movie and despite the early hour. It wasn't even busy. We ended up having to split up so one person could wait for the check and the rest could head to the theatre. And we all left semi hungry and unsatisfied. 

I do like the open, spacious and well-lit dining room. And I love the idea of the semi-private dining areas-would be great for birthday dinners, etc. They have a good start on the decor, but I think they could benefit from a professional designer to really make it work.

We were in the area and was hungry after wet and wild.

Good place. Venue was nice. It was about 2pm and it was dead. Service was nice.

Seafood pasta was really good. Ribs were pretty good. And the chocolate dessert was delicious. 

 I would try it again.

I always liked this place, but this time, the pick-up experience was TERRIBLE. I was made to wait for another 20 mins when I arrived 25 mins after I placed the order on phone. 

If you do to-go orders, you should place my order in the list as soon as I made the order on phone, but not make it look like the order was never placed until I am already there for it.

Plus, NO dressing for salad, and NO utensils were given. How amazing:)

I've visited the Sparklings restaurant several times and they never disappoint! It is such. Unique restaurant as the set up is elegant with different dinner tables set around, giving each set of guest the feel of having that fancy elegant private dinners. It's pretty awesome that they even have small private table areas and rooms. The menu is awesome as well. Prices are fair and reasonable since the taste is so good. You must get the crispy gnocchi, tuna tartare, crispy scallops and seafood pasta! Hehe all so good, and the workers are very friendly as well. I love this place and definitely recommend to come here for a nice date, or special occasion :)

I love this place.  I used to live near by, but have since moved and I still travel here to eat because it is THAT good!  I went here a few months back with friends and sat in the lounge, the food and the drinks were good.  I came here with my husband last Friday and the food was still amazing, the service was swift and the prices were on point.  I recommend you eat here and give it a try.  I love that I do not have to go to the strip for food this good with the ambiance to match.    I had the crispy gnocchi, bacon wrapped meatballs, salmon crostini and scallops.  The portions are generous, so I had to take some home, but since scallop does not generally do well reheated, I ate all of it before I left, plus it was delicious.  Yummo!

Hidden gem! For the time being anyway. It's not what you would expect (especially if you've been to the restaurant that was previously in this space), but you'll be pleasantly surprised! The decor is really cute, food is great and service is excellent. We've been here several times and enjoyed our meal every time.

Highlights are the salmon crostini, lobster bruschetta, meatballs, and spaghetti with mushroom and bacon.

Love this place! The interior is super cute and spacious, they have small and large tables to accommodate all party sizes, they also have a bar/lounge area. The food is so delicious and for a great price. Love the crispy gnocchi with pesto and sausage, bacon and dates wrapped meatballs, tuna tartare, fried zucchini, turkey and cranberry sandwich, smoked salmon crostini - as you can tell I've been here a few times! Great place for locals and for big celebration or romantic dinner date!

I was here at Friday night at around 11:30 pm for the first time,the place was a bit empathy maybe because of the late hour or the big lounge/restaurant room we felt like that .The place is well decorated n designed an have a great environment with a good music on background .
An now for the mean reason I came here the FOOD,
It Was ok n that's it,I was really hope it's going to be very good but it's not,I think there is a lot of thing they need to improve in the food n this place as a great potential,
Don't get me wrong if you looking for a place with good vibe good music n ok food sometimes it's a perfect place so go n check it out.enjoy.

I'm so impressed!  We are having a great time here.  I will return without a doubt.  Beet salad is great, salmon app is good, tuna tartare, scallop app (DH; you're "Kray Kray!)
Gnocchi with sage and brown butter is a must!  I'm so thrilled and refreshed by this place!  Creme brûlée is better than most on the strip!  Run! Don't walk to Sparklings!  This is a place for true ladies!

Really enjoyed this place. The ambiance and setting is retro and chic, vintage and eclectic. The servers were attentive and food came out pretty quickly. Food tasted, looked and felt amazing. I was looking for an Alfredo pasta fix, and this place absolutely did it with its Tempura Shrimp and Mushroom pasta-AAMMAAZZZZE. It's heavy, but so incredibly delicious with a kick of lemon. I'd recommend as a cheat meal:) Had the zucchini sticks to start, and it came with ranch and some spicy creamy sauce. All were excellent (and I'm not much for ranch, but this was yummy). Also tried the brown sugar gnocchi. This was ok. I don't know much about gnocchi so I couldn't tell you much except that it tasted fine, but seemed like it could have had more taste. Portions were great, including the trio dessert (which was also wonderful). Best of all, price point! As a local joint and has a local, I would expect nothing more or less than the prices set here. Excellent place to bring girlfriends, or for a date. There's a bar area that looked cool, but I didnt actually visit that part. I would absolutely make another visit, and recommend to friends and guests. This is a four star review based on this initial visit.

Little late on the review, but better late than never! My girlfriend and her family took me here on thanksgiving and we enjoyed everything!! This was my second time here and both of my experiences were amazing. You're greeted as soon as you walk in and we were seated immediately. Our server's name was Eric and he did an amazing job and maintained awesome service. He had a very positive attitude and made us feel welcomed. The first time I tried this place I was served by Tyler and he was great as well! Tyler and Eric are good. We ordered the truffle fries as an appetizer and I got the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. They give a good amount of fries and it was enough to satisfy the 5 of us. I really enjoyed my Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta as all the flavors blended really well. The portion is very generous. The main course options can range anywhere from $9-$30+ depending on what you order. This place is definitely affordable while upholding a fancy upscale vibe. Definitely will be back!

The Sparklings is such a cool and unique new restaurant. I love it! The first thing you notice about the place is the atmosphere. There's a beautiful chandelier in the center of the room and there are individual dining rooms that are separated so it's almost like you are eating in your own private dining room. Then there's an area that reminds me of a kitchen with a line of china cabinets along the wall. Outside of the main room there is a separate bar area that you can see thru glass windows. You have to see the place yourself to appreciate their whole vibe that they've got going on and it's hard to explain, just trust me. It's a place you're going to want to come to and take guests to, to impress them when they come in from out of town. It's just one of those quirky-chic spots that you will always remember.

Jason, our quick witted server was great! I have a good little banter going on with him every time I visit which makes my experience fun.

My absolute favorite thing to order is the Spicy Seafood Pasta. It has the perfect amount of kick and garlic to it. Noodles are always cooked perfectly. And there's a lot more to the menu that I haven't gotten to try yet. I tend to be a creature of comfort though and if it ain't broke don't fix it so I find myself sticking to my old faithful Spicy Seafood Pasta when I eat here. Some favorites that I recommend would be definitely that along with the Crispy Gnocchi.

My only suggestion to the owners of The Sparklings would be to add more main course dishes to their menu. Lots of appetizers to choose from but not much to choose from in the main dish department. Other than that, I have no complaints. They treat me well and remember me and what I order every time right down to the smallest detail, for example: the crushed red peppers I like on the side. Don't even have to ask. Service is excellent! 5 stars. :D

Disappointing every single time. The food is good but the service is terrible. One time I was sick and didn't want to cook so I ordered take out and the credit card machine was down. The guy asked to take a picture of my credit card and I refused. I told him when the machine was up and running I'd come pay or they could keep the food. 

It was a $29 to go order for what is a nicer restaurant (cheap compared to everything on the menu). 

The machine ended up going back up after midnight. He knew I was sick and relentlessly called and texted. I would have just comp'd the meal, not expect a sick person to come back at midnight. I explained to him that I was sick and went and paid the next day. The point is either call me the next day or let it go but don't hammer me with calls and texts at that hour over a $29 meal. 

I decided to give them another shot. My boyfriend and I went for dinner. We are late sleepers and this place is open until 2. Walked in at 1:12 and the guy said the kitchen is closed. I said so early? He said the kitchen closes half an hour before closing. I said it's 45 min and asked if we could order to go. He said they were slow and closed the kitchen early. Then why tell me the half hour rule?

Fix your credit card machines and learn to tell time. Please and thank you

This is one of my most favorite places in Vegas! Service is awesome! Food is spectacular! They recently expanded their menu. I love the turkey and cranberry sandwich, the sliders, the side of fries, the steak salad, the ricotta flatbread, and the chicken parm! Everyone should come here at least once - that's all it'll take to keep your coming back!

I really enjoyed this restaurant. The atmosphere and decor is great and so is the food. I really enjoyed my evening. The service was average but it think it may have just been because we went later in the evening.
Love this place.   Great food and drinks.  Great atmosphere and outdoor seating.  I keep coming back.

The food here is amazing!!  Great atmosphere and service as well.  I highly recommend ordering several things on the appetizer menu vs a meal because you get the chance to try a large variety of the things they offer.  Each small plate that came out was better than the next.  We were a party of 4 and ended up ordering about 70% of the items on the app menu.  We all walked away full and excited to have been able to try so many different items.  Among the favorites were the Langostinos, truffle fries, scallops, and gorgonzola flat bread.

Great Hidden Gem! Get the word out about this place, good food, great service, atmosphere is fantastic, rustic romantic, chic, but still masculine. 
Casual or dressy you won't feel out of place or uncomfortable. 
House salad was great and the blackened trout appitizer was fantastic. Pan seared salmon was good, but the trout had more flavor. 
For dessert went with the trio...such a good choice to share!
We will cone back for sure. Looking forward to them starting to do brunch on weekends sometime in the near future. 
Until next time Sparklings ;)

Walking in I instantly felt comfortable in this place.  Which is strange because if they wanted this place could be super pretentious, but it's not.  It's AWESOME.  
The decor is perfect.I don't even know what to call it, we actually debated it for a good chunk of time while sitting back admiring.  Until the food came and then it was game on!
We started with the portabello fries and also the roasted beet and apple salad.  The salad was good but those fries, daaaayyum. Not overly fried, yummy flavor.  Just do it, they were excellent.  
For an entree, I ordered the spicy seafood pasta, at the recommendation of our delightful server.  It was in fact, spicy, it was also chock-full overflowing with seafood.  It did not disappoint.  But I'm going to go ahead and repeat - it was SPICY.  Just in case you think it's only a hint of spice, nooooo.  It's some damn good heat.
A friend ordered the shepherd's pie and damn if it didn't look glorious. The crust was flakey, buttery goodness.  There were 4 of us including a vegetarian and a vegan and EVERYONE loved this place.  That's a pretty difficult thing to pull off.  Just sayin'
Dessert - because we had too.  We got the trio which included flourless chocolate cake, vanilla ice cream, and creme brulee.  OH THAT CREME BRULEE! Delightful.  Scrumptious! The cake was great, I didn't even try the ice cream. I was too full and I needed to eat more of the creme brulee!
So if you can't tell. I think this place is the bee's knees and I will most certainly be back on all of my trips to Vegas.

This place used to be a bit better, or maybe that was the "new place" veneer that my mind gave it. The food is average, the drink selection is OK at best and the cool atmosphere now seems empty and unused. You should eat here once to see what I mean, then delay your review. If you ever eat here again, please challenge this posting should you feel the need.

The SW needs more places like The Sparklings. Went with a friend on a Monday afternoon. Super quiet inside, a group of girls in the corner had just finished another bottle of Prosecco. There honestly isn't a single bad seat in the entire restaurant. 

We kept things simple with lunch with the club sandwich that was massive, had a couple of beers and the crispy gnocchi which was recommended by the waiter. All was super Delish and lucky me, I live a block away. Will definitely be coming back. 

Also- love that the bar/gaming area is seperate to the restaurant.

I've come here about 3 times now and I'm finally writing a review.

I think my favorite part about this place is the bar. It's separated off in a cute little corner of the restaurant but the bartenders can make a mean Jameson and ginger ale. And it's great because it has its own little seating area to just sit and relax and watch some sports on the big screen tv if that's what you wanna do.

However. This place is more of a "dress up and look spiffy while eating" kind of joint. Which I'm all for. The decor is so cute inside and more upscale than just the regular/casual restaurant.

My friend and I ordered and shared the langostuine bruschetta (bomb! 10/10) and the spaghetti with mushroom and bacon cream sauce with shrimp. It was very good (9/10) but tasted heavy on the sauce. We tasted a bit of the pesto gnocchi and thought it was alright, nothing special (7/10). 

But. I must say. I tried a bite of the medium rare filet mignon and a few bites of the coffee tempura ice cream. AND OH MY GOODNESS. I will come back o this place every day if it means I get to taste such beautiful creations. 

PS ask for Eric, he's a very good server. Nice guy.

I have to admit I'm a "foodie" and will try a fish or foul at least once. The Sparklings just does it for me. I love happy hour and the food. Jason is always right on time. Favorite is the Calamari salad and I could go on. Nice atmosphere just a cool little place

My favorite place to catch up with my Las Vegas friends when I'm in town. Came in over Christmas (I'm a bit late catching up on my Yelps) and sat with a party of 5, in our favorite little corner with the sofa and chairs. Happy to find out we came during happy hour, so the drinks were reduced-price (I think 20-30%, not sure). We ordered several small bites to share and all was delicious. Get the Cheese board for sure.

This place has the cutest ambiance! The interior design is super dazzling. They have a place for private parties and separate room for bar lounge. As far as for the food, it's delicious the ravioli spinach was tasty. It's cute place for date night!

The Sparklings is a lot of fun.  It has an interesting atmosphere that invites diners to look around while eating.  The menu is straightforward with enough variety to appeal to everyone.  There're a lot of beer options on the menu with a full bar partitioned around the corner, which keeps the restaurant from feeling light a nightclub.  I always look forward to having a quick dinner here and am looking forward to trying their bunch.

I've been waiting for this place to open, since it's so close to the house. I drove by our the other night to see some people in the bar and got excited to know that it was finally open. 

My friend and I went there yesterday for some food. Starting with the service, it was good. Our water cups were always filled, and they checked in on us a lot. Although, at some points it was a bit incessant. But, if rather have over the top service than no service at all. Plus, we were the only table there for awhile. Our server, Deena, made things a bit awkward. There was just a lot of awkward silences, and it always seemed like she was whispering, but I can look past that. 

As far as the food goes, it felt like there were more appetizers to choose from then there were entrees. Which, probably is a good thing because the appetizers we got were far better than the entrees. 

We started with the Portobello fries and the crispy gnocchi. The fries were thick slices of Portobello that were lightly breaded then fried. They.served it with ranch, and some other sauce that I'm falling to remember. The crispy gnocchi had Italian sausage, pesto, peas, and walnuts. While it was good, unless you get a piece of sausage in every bite, the dish lacks a bit of salt. 

For entrees, we offered the turkey and cranberry sandwich as well as the jambalaya. I don't know what o was expecting out of the turkey and cranberry sandwich, but I was just expecting more. While the cranberry sauce was good, they added quite a bit, so it overpowered everything else. Their version was a little more spruced up, with spinach and brie cheese. However, the cheese wasn't spread at all, just one slice in the middle. So, I only got one or two really good bites out of the sandwich. As far as the jambalaya, it was decent. Had good flavor, but just needed more. It war very mild tasting. Chicken was conned ti perfection though, so moist ! No sausage in the jambalaya thigh. :( 

All in all, would I go back ? Probably. It's the closest place to eat next to my house. I'll probably stick with just ordering more appetizers next time though.

We came here based on yelp reviews and being that its close to the house!
I went here with my sister in law.
We brought our own bottle of wine, but the corkage is a little excessive at $30 so we ended up buying a bottle there for that same price.

Started with the scallops and my oh my they were delightful!!!! omg so effing good..we were excited about our entrees.
we both got the salmon and subbed the rice for mashed potatoes. So good!!

The only thing I have to say about the place and we did end up talking to the manager about this so I do hope they take it into consideration....(reason for the missing star)

The inside with the chandelier is as bright as the sun! not romanic at all.Music was very low and could hear the clanking of the silverware around as everyone is eating...and the low mumbling of conversations.

Ambience is so so important...and being that it's a big room...the lights need to be dimmed and music louder.period.otherwise it can be really awkward.
I dont care if people complain the lights are too dim and they can't read the menu...get your cellphone out and read it that way.

I would feel so awkward going on a date here with the brightness of the restaurant.
It's funny because the sign outside is so dim too...it needs to be switched around!

OK in summary it's a beautiful place and the food was delightful would recommend going!....
just take the lights down a notch! EASY FIX.

We will be back!

Oh yea and service was excellent!

A lovely evening with great good! I was hesitant to put this review up because I wanted to keep this place a little secret. This hidden jewel is amazing from the decor to the food. The decor is simple with crystal shandaliers, flowers and velvet seating. Their appetizer section is huge and you can order multiple to fill your up. We had gnocchi, truffle corn, cheese board, Asian chicken wings, and Shepard pie. Everything was delicious and our waiter Joe was nice and charming. This is also a great place for large parties with their private sections. A must try :)

This place is above average but I do not suggest here if you have a large party. Our poor waiter was serving the entire restaurant himself, and the bussing service was terrible. They left the water pitcher on our table and made my friend feel uncomfortable. I guess they left it there knowing it'd be a while before they came around again. Since it was a large group, they presumed we were all just sitting around mingling except we waiting an hour before getting asked if we wanted entrees. As for food, it was good but not anything I would come back for. We had the bacon date meatballs, Caesar salad, short ribs,  rib eye, Cajun pasta, crispy gnocchi,  seafood pasta, and sweet potato fries. Best was the short ribs.
I eat at the Sparkling's regularly. The staff is the great, and the food is awesome. I haven't been for dinner, but I have heard the bar scene is lively on the weekends and evening.

Five star dining at *The Sparklings*.~

Located in Las Vegas off the strip I came here for dinner and the dinner was for a special occasion and sure made the perfect evening fo the celebration. The server we had offered us fabulous service with a smile. He definitely gave the right impression of this restaurant! 

FOOD: 
-Brown Butter Gnocchi: sage, butternut squash, and grated parmesan cheese
-Meatballs: tomato sauce
-Tomato Basil Soup: onion, garlic and heavy cream
-Choriqueso Dip: beef chorizo and mozarella cheese served with tortilla chips
-Beef Lasagna: with their classic bolognese sauce 

DRINK: *Cucumber French 75*: Gin, fresh cucumber, lemon juice and
champagne

The apps and main entree I had were so filling and flavorful!  I enjoyed my Beef Lasagna which tasted fantastic and fresh. I also loved the drink which paired great for the nice dinner out. This place has decor that was very modern and beautiful all around. . 

Overall, I was pleased with the perfectly made food and drinks along with the awesome service and amazing atmosphere!

My husband and I had a little date night dinner here. It is very close to our home so we decided to give it try. My husband ordered caesars salad and spaghetti and meatballs,  he is not too adventurous. I had a shrimp tempura pasta, the pasta was tasty but the shrimp tempura got a little soggy with the pasta sauce, not sure it's the greatest combo. Overall everything was pretty great, friendly waiter, nice restaurant decor and atmosphere. We'll be back. Oh and The MARGARITA WAS DELICIOUS!

My boyfriend and I dined at this restaurant this evening for the first time, and we loved it! It's a quaint little Victorian style restaurant with amazing service and a great food/drink selection. We ordered the spaghetti bacon and mushroom with cream sauce, and the Cajun pasta which was both so delicious that we couldn't help but share! I also had a raspberry mojito which made me feel like I was on a beach in Tahiti. Yum! This is a must try!

Absolutely incredible. My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and our dining experience was amazing! Firstly, the atmosphere was eccentric and interesting. It seemed that each area/table were decorated a certain way. Since it was a Wednesday evening, it wasn't too busy which made the experience even more incredible because our servers were attentive towards us. It wasn't loud nor was it crowded, everything seemed to be spaced out to give each guest a privacy from others also.

We started our dining experience with truffle parmesan fries. The fries were seasoned perfectly and was just right. We don't know if the ketchup were housemade but the ranch was definitely really good (it had the right herbs and seasoning to go with the fries.) For the food, I ordered the Steak Diane medium rare. It was delicious and perfectly cooked to my liking. I love my mushrooms and wished there were more to go with the gravy (a little bit more gravy as well) and mashed potatoes though  My boyfriend had their lasagna which was pretty good for him. He had a somewhat difficult time eating since the dish was very hot which is understandable for lasagna, but he finished it all. For dessert, our server brought out a slice of cheesecake with a candle for my birthday, and we also ordered the Trio. The cheesecake was pretty good, the sauce gave it a tangy yet delightful taste. But the Trio... that was definitely the spot. The flourless chocolate cake was creamy in texture but not overly sweet. The vanilla ice cream was perfectly paired with the cake and creme brulee. You can even see the tiny vanilla beans! 

I couldn't thank the staff enough with how amazing the food and experience was. They were practically the cherry on top. We were so stuffed and happy!

the first thing that comes to mind when you walk into the sparklings is "what a beautiful establishment!"  from the furnishings to the light fixtures, everything sparkles with modern and classic touches.  the giant chandelier hanging overhead and the beautiful high-back captains chairs at the massive communal table, all belong in a swanky strip hotel but fit perfectly in this locally owned and operated restaurant.

i've been here a couple of times.  the first visit, me and my group of lady friends came in after a fun night of drinking and shopping for toys.  the night wasn't over yet so we decided to hang out in their bar til 3am and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there!  jose was our server/bartender and he was such a dear.
he was extremely patient and recommended many items that we enjoyed throughout the evening.  from what i can remember, we had the octopus, truffle fries, crispy gnocchi, roasted beet and apple salad and the portobello fries.  everything was tasty and i vowed to return.

so, one late evening, the hubby and i were hungry, called up a few friends and met at sparklings again.  this time, we ordered some of the same dishes but also the spicy seafood pasta and the braised short ribs.  the pasta was very good but from what i could gather, the short ribs were the star of the show.  everyone devoured the hubby's dish and still wanted more.  according to everyone, they were some of the best short ribs any of them had ever had.  

the food here is very good and the service has always been kind, quick and helpful.  i only wish we had a similar establishment in the northwest part of town but, for now, i'll settle for driving 20 mins to get my sparklings fix.

Overrated at 4 1/2 stars.

Salmon dish was a 4 all other dishes were a 3 at best.

Crispy gnocchi was too dense but had a good pesto sauce.

Bacon wrapped date meatballs were average

Ribeye steak came rare when ordered medium rare

I made a last-minute reservation here for my mom's birthday over Thanksgiving weekend and was pleasantly surprised with how nice our experience was. Nice location far off the Strip and the interior/ambiance really reflects that. We had a party of 8 (including one toddler) and they gave us a table with a huge booth. 

Our table started off with a calamari dish and some bruschetta (it had lobster in it) as appetizers. I would 200% order that calamari again - super flavorful, and the batter was nice and light. The bruschetta was tasty but hard to split as there were only four pieces for the 8 of us. We ended up breaking off little pieces and sharing those. True family style!

I ordered a Shepherd's Pie which I really liked, and my brother got a chicken/mushroom cream pasta which everyone at our table kept trying. So good... 

Our server offered three different choices of dessert for the birthday celebration: cheesecake (which we picked), chocolate cake, and one other I can't remember right now. They wrote a nice "Happy Birthday!" on the dessert plate, and my mom happily took a photo with it. After dinner, our server was nice enough to take a photo of our group standing together in the restaurant.

We'll be back! I want to order more small plate type dishes next time, since I think that's where their originality really shines.

Love the food and the atmosphere, but the service was very slow. It took 20 minutes for someone to stop at our table and our waiter left us on the patio with our food, no checking up on us, not one glass of water for thirty solid minutes...

Wow. I came here for the first time to find a quiet place to study and to also eat dinner afterwards. I called and spoke with Anthony and he was more welcoming than ever. Once I got there, another friendly staff named Tyler walked me in and took me to a quiet spot so I could do my homework in a more distraction-free area. Not only was I surprised that there was such a thing as a "private area" but Tyler immediately impressed me! The hospitality and quick-eagerness of assisting me to what my needs were is truly really amazing. Thank you Anthony and Tyler for being so accommodating. I can finally say I found a great place to do my homework and to also grab a good meal to eat afterwards.

Did a Friday night birthday dinner at this hidden gem right off rainbow and was definitely impressed by the ambiance. Music, setup, and bar were inviting and comfortable. This place had great food, great dessert, and great service. Our server Timothy sang a happy birthday to my husband and we all chimed in. Great atmosphere and will be back!

Visited a couple other times since my first encounter and the service was a lot better. Maybe it has to do with we actually sat in the restaurant vs the bar. Server Eric today was great. Super friendly and personable. He greeted us right away, got our drink order and was back to take our food order. 

Tried the Tuna tartare but found it a bit bland. Ceviche was served on two pieces of hard tortillas. Generous amounts of shrimp and served with a hot sauce, which does make the ceviche taste better. Truffle fries delicious!

I love this neighborhood restaurant ! Great ambiance good food and good prices! I've been here quite a few times for birthday parties and etc nothing bad to say about this place! I will definitely be back soon

So excited to have this new place in the southwest area.  Really cute inside, fun music.  Everyone was so nice, great service!  The food was good and reasonably priced.  Sounds like they have a great Happy Hour that is available 7 days a week!  Love the fun seating, decor!  Will definitely be enjoying many dinners and happy hours here!

It is also kid-friendly.  We went for dinner and the waiters/hostess, all very talkative and friendly to the kids.  The Kids Menu is simple, the kids enjoyed it.

OK seriously, we've lived up the street from this place for 3 years and never thought about eating here until my wife decided she wanted to go there for her bday.   I can't believe it took us this long to discover.  The food, the service (Landon the waiter) and the price is exceptional.   A hidden gem in Las Vegas.   Totally worth checking out if you have not been already.

Unbelievably horrible service!! The food was good, the drinks were yummy but our wait person (Susan) ignored us most of the night, even turned and walked away when we called her for some service. There were six of us and it took forever to get our drinks! It took forever to get our order placed, there wasn't any salt or pepper on the table and we kept having to ask repeatedly for some. Plus the kitchen forgot to make one of the dinners! By the time it came every one else was finished eating! Won't go back!! If the owner(s) expect this restaurant to stay in business they had better take service seriously!! Otherwise, no one will be repeat customers and they'll be out of business within six months or less!! 

Update: The response from the owner/manager is so ridiculous! Apparently you bailed on your restaurant that evening as we asked for a manager and were told there was none available; that you had left! How convenient! When you say that our order of scallops was late; we were told that the kitchen forgot to make the order! So lies, from either you or your staff! How pathetic! When you say no one in our group knows anything about the restaurant business you are so mistaken! Two to three of us have either owned and or managed restaurants in the past! When you call someone immature for saying that your restaurant may go out of business if the problems are not fixed, you appear to be defensive and pretty damn clueless! Good luck!!
The food was great! The atmosphere nice and quiet. The crispy gnocchi was delish! We will be coming back for sure.

Excellent service. Delicious food. Cool decor. Amazing prices. What else could you ask for? It was mine and my husband's first time there and we will DEFINITELY be back. Love the fact that they are open late as he works until 8:00pm. I will recommend The Sparklings to everyo

This place is a hidden gem. We had brunch a few weekends ago and I had to remind myself (after some bottomless mimosas) to post. It's a must try. Service was great. Refreshing atmosphere and menu with perfect size portions for everyone to get a taste without being overwhelming- tuna tartar, chilaquiles, eggs Benedict, and French toast sticks- all highly recommended. It's on the other side of town from us but we will be back.
Great place to grab a drink and get either a really good entree or stylized bar food. it is a nice change of pace from the typical Vegas Bar/food place

This place is soooo cute! I am in love with the decor! I seriously wanna live here just cause of how pretty it is inside. 

I came here for a birthday celebration. Our party was huge... 17 people! They were prepared for us and had the table set up with water for everyone before we got there. Super organized! The waiter was also really helpful and took his time with us. It can get pretty hectic with so many people. I was very impressed. They were also even able to split the check for us with no complications. No automatic gratuity included either! 

The food was decently priced and amazing. I was expecting to spend a bit more but was very satisfied with their prices. There aren't tooo many options for entrees but they have a lot of appetizers. I decided to make a meal out of the apps cause I couldn't find anything I really wanted from the dinner menu. I got the steak salad and gnocchi. Both were delicious!

I can't wait to come back here!

I just do not know how I feel about this place...
I love it on the inside it soooo pretty and definitely different from anything you really get her in Vegas, on the outside you do not expect much at all and on the inside it looks soo clean, white, bright and spacious!! 
The food just did not really stick out to me much, I went with a group of friends and we literally ordered everything on the appetizer menu (which is huge!!!!!), I remember I hated the crab dip, sooo fishy it killed it for me. But i did like the sliders those were good, tuna tartar was good as well! Yet I do not really know if I liked or disliked the food there. If I had to form an opinion I would say go there for the ambiance and the drinks..... not so much the food.

My sister and I held our niece's bridal shower here a week ago and it was flawless. The staff and management worked hard to accommodate every request. A group of 22 women and not one complaint in the bunch. Our guests were asking if we knew someone at the restaurant personally because they were so friendly and attentive. The food was excellent, the prices reasonable, and the ambiance is gorgeous.
Crispy Gnocchi, bacon date meatballs, Asian chicken salad, calamari and bbq sliders.  All delicious especially the gnocchi. Service was great and decor/ambiance was pleasant.  Will be back!

A girlfriend and I tried this place for the first time together based upon recommendation. The ambience was nice and the furniture choice was good. I will say that this place is painfully quiet and the music is kind of odd. Definitely set some tones to our conversations. Get two girls in there and cocktails..well kinda makes us look bad. With that being said our waiter Tyler was very cute and nice. He was patient, service was great and put up with my jokes. The food was good..I don't know if I ordered the right things though. Calamari, sweet potatoes fries, and the pesto pasta. Fries were...fries but the sauces were good. Calamari...calamari. The pastas was good just very heavy. We also ordered some cocktails which were great. Anywhere with copper MM cups have won me over. All and all I think this place was good...change up the music and I think it will be even better!

Soooooooo, long story short it's average food with a cute cute dining room, good drinks/service but nothing really blew me away.

The meatball appetizer was great. It had a bunch of flavor and I sincerely wanted more. The crab and spinach dip should be renamed to just the spinach dip because I didn't get any crab at all (my husband said he had a bite) and it wasn't as creamy as I personally prefer, it was very cheesy but it was still good. I did like that they give fried and regular pita bread for dipping. Nice touch. The Tuna tartare was also good, the mango was different. Clam chowder was good as well. The filet was larger than I expected and cooked as requested but I was just missing some flavor on the steak itself. I like the char with seasoning or the buttery flavor on my steak. It wasn't bad at all just a little plain for my liking. I did not ask for any steak sauce which is always a good sign.

We will probably come back because I can almost see this place from the third floor of my house but the only thing I'd order again would be the meatballs. They were the 2nd best meatballs I've had in my life. I'd really like to try their pasta or perhaps a sandwich because I believe that there's a lot of effort put into the menu and overall quality.

Absolutely loved it! It's super cute in here. The food is very delicious. The service was great. We we're seated almost immediately. We received great suggestions from our waitress. I highly recommend coming here if you're looking for a cute date spot!

This place was good! Had the grilled veggie sandwich - which was really tasty. GF had a really delicious salad and we both gnoshed on deep fried portobello mushroom "fries". If you're a vegetarian and in the area don't be affraid to stop and try this place. Also very cool A/C and very friendly service. Very nice. Would go here again.

My boyfriend and I had dinner on a Thursday night around 7pm. It was very slow, and yet we still experienced very slow service. The bacon and date meatballs were average tasting.
