I had the shrimp tempura and mushroom pasta, which had an over powering lemon taste. I had 2 bites of my pasta and the waiter didn't even notice or say anything about me not touching my food. Then when the check came I still paid full price for my drinks even though it was supposed to be happy hour with 20% off. I will not be returning here and would not recommend The Sparklings.
Can't beat this food and atmosphere!  Special drinks are outstanding and the service was extremely good.  Definitely will come back here!!
Beautiful new restaurant and amazing food!  Highly recommend the bacon & dates cover meatballs appetizer.  Sorbet taste like real mango :)
This is probably the best short-ribs I've every eaten!!! Very nice & quite place! I recommend this place for sure!
Great place!!!! Andy continues to amaze me. We'll keep coming back!!!! Great service and food.

I really liked the inside of the sparklings, its very comfortable and the staff were pleasant and clean. Parking wasnt too bad, and I also like the way they keep their bar area separate from the restaurant, its interesting. There is a separate lounge room for bar drinks and socializing but its kept apart from the restaurant dining room and can still be viewed via indoor window, i thought this was pretty smart since it keeps the dining areas ambiance more quiet and relaxing if you dont want the loud fuss of the people around the bar scene bothering you. Once you enter the center of the restaurant has a flower arrangement of orchids with seating protruding from this center and a large chandelier hanging from above. Decor has almost a modern mixed with antique feel to it. We ordered the crispy gnocchi, scallops, french onion soup, hamburger steak, and seared salmon. The scallops were good and I liked the sauce on them, the gnocchi was also good and had a pesto cream sauce and the gnocchi itself were lighty crisp out and soft inside. The french onion soup was good but a little on the salty side and the salmon was a little garlicky and also very salty but the flavor was good. Besides them needing to drastically reduce the sodium in their food I couldnt complain too much. The hamburger steak comes on a bed of rice loco moco style but has good flavor as well. Overall i thought this place was okay, but they need to really cut down on the salt before my blood pressure kills me. Be sure to get an extra glass of water to dilute your food if you decide to stop here.

Don't judge a book by it's cover...open the book!  South Las Vegas is growing and one by one new things appear.  Just recently Sparklings opened!  American/Asian influenced.  My husband and I walked in on a beautiful Thursday afternoon and to our surprise we were the only patrons there.  First impression is French Provincial!!! Velvet chairs, Glamorous Chandelier, many hutches of early american design with antique place wear.  They have 3 different pastel colored rooms for up to 10 seating in each off to the side of the main room, a room for private parties 12 or more you can close off to make it more personal and an open area with solid marble tables and Velvet seats and Benches for comfortable seating.  In another section there is a small bar and a door to outside seating if preferred.   The menu has very comfortable pricing for the dishes they serve, The wait staff is pleasant and warm, the owner even walked over to introduce himself and give kudos to their chef.  By the looks of this place and the quality that goes into their dishes I would think it's more an upscale restaurant, but as we left a man in torn jeans and baseball cap and a girl with shredded shorts and tank top came walking in and were seated and treated as if they were dressed accordingly...so I guess it doesn't have to be an elegant night out.  Every bite of every dish we ordered was excellent...even the teriyaki Octopus which was out of this world! The Salmon in lemon sauce and capers was fabulous as was the Cajun Shrimp Pasta!  Next time I'll make room for the chocolate flourless cake or Creme Brulee.  We will definitely go again and again!! Did I mention that we got excellent service from our waiter???  Best we've had in a long long time!!! It;s nice to have a restaurant like this here in our area without having to drive to Greenvalley or Summerlin for the high end experience.

Bottomless Mimosas?? Why, don't mind if I do!! 
Abuelita and I had some serious overdue catching up to do and decided on brunch here. I've been here once before, years ago with Hunnie Bunnie, which was also pre-vegan life. 
So this time was different. I did take a look at their menu online before deciding on this place though and they have a veggie sandwich on the menu. I inquired if the bread was vegan (it is), hold the cheese and no sauces (not sure if any come on there anyway, but I got it dry). And it was good! Abuelita also got a veggie sandwich but she left the cheese on hers, and we both indulged in bottomless mimoas. They bring over little carafes for you so you can refill your own glass and when that's empty, they bring you ANOTHER ONE. 
We were literally there ALL DAY.
After our looooong brunch, we moved into the bar area and ordered a lovely bottle of Justin Cabernet... and when I got the bill... Turns out it was on HAPPY HOUR! Total SCORE. 
Our server was great and attentive and I will definitely be back!

Saw a lot of great reviews and was recommended by my friend to dine here so I went a few days ago. I absolutely love the decor of the restaurant. Very classy & nice. They have few "private" type of seatings available for big groups so that was good.
Service was good too since there weren't too many groups in house- probably like 3 or 4? And a few at the bar.
Our waitress was very sweet and attentive; checked up on us a lot.
The owner/manager came out to chat with us as well & he seemed cool!
They have a good selection of food & drinks.

Now for the food: we started by ordering the  portobello fries. It was good & something different. For my main meal I ordered the spicy seafood pasta.
Now BEWARE it is SUPER SPICY!! The portion was huge with lots of seafood and it looked delicious but once you put it in your mouth, you were on fire! Even my friends who could tolerate spicy foods said it was pretty extreme. And because of this, it messed up my stomach for two days :( So if you're going to order this, I would suggest you to tell them not to make it too spicy. 
My friends ordered the hamburger steak, steak salad, cajun pasta, & ribs.
I didn't get to try any of their food but they all said it was delicious~
Especially the hamburger steak & ribs. 
Unfortunately for the steak salad, my friend's steak had a lot of fatty parts- where she couldn't eat so she told the waitress and they were able to bring out a new one for her.

Tons of parking outside of the restaurant.

I would like to go back next time but definitely will order something else.
Awesome atmosphere & amazing food. Noriega was very nice & recommended the scallops that were amazing. Definitely will be returning.

Decor: 5/5
I just love everything about this place aesthetically. The chairs, the color, the feel something about this place just works in a French industrial kind of way. 

Service: 5/5
I've eaten in the bar as well as the restaurant. While I personally prefer they bar because I like the chat with Angel, the dining room is a solid choice. I've been here on about 5 occasions and have never heard a complaint. 

Cocktails: 5/5 (can I give 7 stars?)
I cannot over emphasize how amazing the cocktails are with Angel. I love classic cocktails and was very spoiled living in NYC with a mixologist roommate that worked in secret members only bars. At Spago there was one fantastic bartender, but he got promoted to oversee cocktails for all Puck restaurants. I catch him when I can. Herbs & Rye is spotty with their drink making. I had an amazing drink once (made by a guy with tattoos) and horrible one same visit (made by the owner, and I sent it back). Angel is consistent and by far my new favorite. Old-fashioned, sazerac, sidecar, mojitos... All fantastic creations. Plus he's down the street, and it doesn't cost me $15-$20 a drink. Score!

Food: 4/5
With the cocktails so far above what I would expect in Vegas (especially off the strip in a non craft cocktail setting), the food is disappointing.  It's very good but nowhere near great. My biggest gripe by far was the lobster bisque without lobster, but even the rue was above average at best. With the exception on the rainbow trout, I felt like the seafood from all of the other dishes (shrimp and clams) weren't the freshest. I could go through a list of things I had there, but honestly, there's nothing memorable.

VERY MISLEADING!  I bought out the restaurant for the entire night, but forgot to get it in writing. Overcharged us. Clearly tried to kick us out early. Succeeded. Food tasted great but AGAIN overcharged us!  $2K for a buffet. Nonsense. Bar was overpriced as well. The atmosphere was great - SANS the manager hounding me to pay the check. I bought the ENTIRE restaurant/bar out from 4PM until 3AM yet i was told i "went over my budget." Only go to this place if you're in the mood to piss away money. Almost $4,600.00 for 6 hours? Nothing like i was promised. EXTREMELY MISLEADING NEGOTIATION!! 0stars.

When my friend said he wanted to go to Sparklings late nite, I thought for sure we were going to a tittie bar and I was in for something dirty.  However, it is the exact opposite... 5 stars in every way.  The decor is elegant, the drink selection is spot on, and the service was tip top.  We chopped the chicken parm and a filet.  The chicken parm was fresh and the steak is easily the best suburban option past midnight.  My wife loved the cheesecake I got to go so it was clearly a success.  I'm sure I will find myself here again soon.

Great location and awesome brunch options! Chicken and waffles were awesome and for dinner, ordered pesto walnut gnocchi, scallops and shrimp mushroom pasta. Everything we ordered were delish! Love the ambiance too!

A must go! We went for brunch on Saturday morning, the food was amazing! Crispy gnocchi, salmon crostini, calamari, and sliders were all perfect! The seafood was fresh, and I am very picky. It's the same owners as Oyshi, another one of our favorites. The staff was friendly and efficient. The atmosphere is beautiful. And the prices are great!! 
Tip to owners:: you need bottomless mimosas at least Sunday's, your place would be so busy!! (It was dead when we were there, for 2 hours). And from the outside, no one has any idea how amazing it is on the inside.
Very nicely decorated, food is always good and they have a great happy hour. This is my go to for dinner when I want to enjoy a nice evening close to home.

I RAVE about this place! From the decor to the decadence of food, it is simply superb. Now for the times I went I stick with a classic pasta and clam dish and the ingredients are always so fresh you end up devouring the whole thing! The appetizers I tried are always delicious and palette pleasing. If I lived closer it would be my go to place and a committed regular in me. I always recommend this place as my favorite restaurant in the city. Truly a hidden gem!
Their whole menu is awesome. I'm getting hungry just thinking about their food. Love it!

"What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what SPARKLES within us" 
- Ralph Waldo Emerson (Paraphrased) 

The Sparklings boasts a unique and aesthetically pleasing interior, complete with a large chandelier that sparkles like a cheesy vampire in the sun. As others have noted, this interior is delightful, but also is one of the better things they have going. If the owners (also see Soyo and Oyshi) were hoping that The Sparklings would be the crown jewel to their south Rainbow eateries, they severely missed the mark here. The food looks great on the menu but doesn't shine in execution.  

If you find yourself sitting in The Sparklings and want to make the most of it try the Brown Butter Gnocchi or one of their seafood based pastas (Note: the Spicy Seafood Pasta was not very spicy.) You could also go with the Rice Au Gratin with Chicken or the Grapes Basil and Ricotta Flat Bread.  Then again, you could also go down the street 2,000 feet to Soyo for better food sans the delightful ambiance. 

It's not that the food is generally bad; it is simply average and not special in any way.  Happy Hour looks like the way to go as well if you're planning on coming in.

Do come here with a large group of people that don't appreciate elevated food. The setting would be wonderful for a group outing, adult birthday, or the like.

What a wonderful, relaxing place with beautiful decor, excellent food, and the best service around. You'd never know from the outside, but once to you set food in the door it's an instant transformation and you feel as though you are in a 5 star restaurant on the strip. Although the food is comparable to that, the prices are very reasonable. Everything here is exceptional and beyond any expectation of a neighborhood restaurant... Top notch!
One of my fave places to eat in vegas and it's close or the house. I love the decor and the feel of it. I gave four stars case the linguini and clams (one of my fave Italian dishes) was a bit watery.

The service is inexperienced still.  They don't know there menu.  We were party of 6, 3 of us has same dish so we got ours together.  We had to wait 5 minutes for the others to get theirs.  Awkward as don't know if we should eat or wait.  They call out dishes as if I was at McDonald to claim my order.  They should know who had order what.  It's not that busy.  Had linguine with clams, didn't offer plate to hold shells so had to put shells on  table. When asked about their wine menu, said don't know and had wine menu in hand.  If u don't know then pass the menu to us to see!  We can read.

My wife and I always wanted to give this place a try since it was close to where we live. First I must say that the place is very clean and beautiful inside. I didn't see any dust. Anyway, I order the spicy seafood paste and my wife got the beet salad. Also, we got the Gnocchi. We wanted to get the grilled octopus that we saw on yelp, but they dont carry it anymore. Bummer. My paste was very good and so was my wife beet salad. The Gnocchi with the meat sauce was delicious. I usually eat paste with garlic bread. I ask for some and was charged 2.50. Not a big deal but I expect bread to be free.
Awesome place to eat and drink!  Great place to pre-game

Terrific...food, service & decor!
Loved the Zucchini Sticks & the Pesto Gnocchi; shared a Caesar Salad with my daughter & my husband had the Lobster Brushetta.
Main dishes were Chicken Parmigiana, Chicken Sandwich & Chicken Marsala 
Yummy!
Lovely decoration and delicious food. Very relaxing atmosphere with bottomless mimosa!

Love love love this place! From the contemporary furnishings to the cuisine! Anthony in the lounge area was very attentive and welcoming. His recommendations were on point and the food was superb. The gnocchi was absolutely wonderful as well as the portobello fries. The chandelier cocktail was just right if you enjoy a sweet treat. My friend enjoyed the Prosecco. The happy hour times of 5-10pm and 12-2 are excellent and will have me back again. Who can beat 30% off?

Really cool addition to the southwest.  There are some excellent items on the menu.  I remember the bacon wrapped meatballs, never had that before in a restaurant.  I've had a lot of things wrapped in bacon, but never a meatball.  It was a nice touch.

Everyone will appreciate the interior of this restaurant.  It's spacious enough where you can have a big party and still feel private.

Very slow service even given a slow Wednesday night, waited 10 minutes for cocktails, another 15 minutes  after we ordered our soups finally came out. Way too many appetizers and barely any entrees (should make some of the appetizers entrees). Had the tortilla soup, the tortilla strips had been in the soup for a while not as a garnish so they were soggy. "Bacon" wrapped meatballs with dates, not bacon, its turkey bacon. Fairly priced for everything, unfortunately will not be returning. Very weird atmosphere as well. Disappointed.

This is a serious hidden gem in Las Vegas. Between the wonderful decor, fantastic customer service and the amazing food - you can't beat this place on the SW side of the Valley.

I've been a couple of times now and ordered something different each time, but my favorites are the crispy gnocchi and the braised short rib. I'm honestly surprised that this place doesn't have a wait every time I go, but it's usually pretty empty. I would definitely recommend this place and plan to visit again soon.

I just love it here! I keep coming back! The food is great especially the Tapas! It's like fine dining with a twist, affordable prices for the servings and presentation,and of course the taste! The ambiance is so cozy, and fancy. I usually sit by the bar, and just get a kick out of the bartender(sorry I forgot his name).

Very welcoming. When we got to the bar we were helped by Angel who gave us amazing service. Not to mention the happy hour goes from 5pm-10pm. All the alcohol is 30% off during happy hour; also open until 3am on weeknights.
The crispy gnocchi, gorgonzola flatbread, and beet salad were great! I can't wait to come back again and try more! Eat at the bar and chat with Jose! He's a sweetheart!

The Sparkling has a great concept and a lot of potential, but not quite there yet. My friend and I came here Saturday night for dinner and our expectations fell short on the ambiance, menu items, and service. Unfortunately the reviews written thus far are very misleading. In fact, I'm a bit disappointed with Yelp for the first time in a long time.

Food:
The food is not bad, but you are definitely getting what you pay for. We decided to do 4-5 of their appetizers to get a taste of the menu.  Not the best choice. The caprese salad had Roma tomatoes that were thin and not quite ripe yet, the brown butter gnocchi were dry and tasted like frozen tater tots that were re-heated. You would think that with an item description of "Brown Butter Gnocchi with Butternut squash"  it would have some time of sauce or butter?  Nope...just dry gnocchi and dried out, over cooked, roasted butternut squash cubes.  Our saving grace was the smoke salmon crostini and meatballs. 

Service:  
We had an issue with one of our courses and the server seemed a bit put out and offended with our feedback and then what made the matter worse is the manager came by after it was fixed and from 5 feet away said "are you better now?" And then walked off. Don't get me wrong he was NICE about it and did his "table touch" as a professional gesture, but a further conversation on what was wrong with our dish seemed more appropriate for a slow night than a shouted conversation across the room. From then on we were ignored by the manager while he laughed and danced his way from every other table in the restaurant.  The whole restaurant had maybe 5 tables total and the server had each course coming out so fast and we felt rushed the whole time.  The server was very nice, but definitely not polished.

Ambience:
Very cute decor concept with the French, Country sheek theme, but the beautiful valour chairs and stunning Chandelier did not pair well with the paper napkins and casual waitstaff attire .  Also, the bar area is distracting with the TV's and loud people.  Perhaps the restaurant could have a curtain/wall up to block the view for people on a romantic date night and a separate entrance for the bar area, so  the drunk people stumbling in don't have to walk by my table acting/dressing like they are at PT's. 
I will try it again once they're on their feet longer maybe for a happy hour, but wouldn't recommend it as of now to a friend. 

Last comment... Can we take down the Xmas tree/decor now? It's January 12th.

Not exactly what I expected. Very large room for very little level of activity. Not the best service for it having been so slow. It wasn't terrible but it was hardly impressive. Don't think I'll be going back.

Visited this place after seeing people give it 4.5 stars. I would say it is just about average. The owner has paid attention to interiors but if it is supposed to be depict fine dining, bar and lounge then they need to do something more than just hanging the chandelier from the top. It is not a nice view when you look up because I have never been to a fine dining and lounge space that has undone ceiling. Looks very cheap.

Service was good. Food could have been better. Their raspberry ginger mojito was very good. Their pan seared scallops which they claim is one of their signature dishes was overcooked. The presentation although was very good. Their zucchini fries were average with no salt. 
Their spicy seafood pasta which again they claim is one of their signature dishes was average. Pasta was overcooked.  They had some mussels and tiny shrimps for the sake of calling it seafood pasta. Restaurants like this should not cut corners in preparing food like this. We didn' t like their cheap cheese grater. I have better ones at home.
Their creme brulee was a disaster. Looks like the chef made no efforts to serve it fresh. It had an overdose of vanilla essence. The caramelized sugar coating was cold, thick and extremely sweet. The caramelization part is supposed to be done just before serving.  Little did we know they serve it pre made. Very disappointing.  
We have been to some of the best food places all over the country. So when it comes to restaurants we pay attention to many details. The place failed to sparkle for us last night.

I would have given 5 out of 5 but my wife insisted on 4 since apparently that girls bathroom wasn't up to her "expectations".

Food was great, fusion Italian food at a very great price. 

On the negative don't order the Mojito!

My husband and I got to try this place on Saturday for our date night. Walking in, oh mygoodness, it is so cute. They have this cute little sign written in flowers, and a beautiful chandelier right in the center of the room surrounded by lavish vases and fresh cut (they looked fresh) flowers. I love the decor of this place! They also had walled off areas that seem perfect for families so they could contain the madness within those little walls (or at least try to). 

Okay, on to the important things! We tried 4 different appetizers & a sandwich to share. We were stuffed by the end of our meal. We had zucchini sticks, dates and meatballs wrapped in bacon, crispy gnocchi, crab spinach dip, and a philly cheese steak. I wasn't blown away by any culinary feats happening over here although I did enjoy the meatballs. They were definitely the best dish out of them all. The crispy gnocchi looked very skimpy compared to the photos others have posted and they weren't very crispy... I wish there were more veggies or something to it. It was very green and kind of boring to eat with those soft peas and the soft gnocchi. The best part were the pecans in it. However, I think the selling points are that they are open very late, and provide a nice alternative to in-n-out. The prices are ridiculously low. We spent $35 on all that food, and it's in a beautiful surrounding. Therefore, we will be back and I want to try the portobello fries!

Always a great experience at Sparklings!  Their blacken octopus is the bomb!  Andy the owner is always very pleasant and inquires with customers about their experience.
I love the chandelier martini!!!!

I always try to keep my meals relatively low carb but woooooow the crispy gnocchi had me making other plans lol. That is a much try. Great texture and taste.

We also shared the shepherds pie which was delicious too! It was like a flaky puffy crust with yummy ingredients underneath it. Although it was a bit salty, I enjoyed it.

The truffle fries were okay. Nothing special. The braised beef was something I did not like. It was tender but I wasn't accustomed to the weird flavor. Definitely not worth $26.

The Asian salad was good but a bit salty as well. My friends and I stayed for a good 3 hours and no one complained of us sitting for too long which I liked!

The food was good but I don't know if I would eat here again.

I came here for the first time with my friend and her family. Have to admit it was extremely delicious. For appetizer, we got calamari, crab and spinach dip and smoked salmon crostini. The crab and spinach dip was and smoked salmon crostini is a must try!! The calamari consisted of small bite sizes in a reasonable portion but I felt that it was a bit bland. Yes, there was sauce but without it, it didn't really taste like much. I got the shrimp and crab ravioli with alfredo sauce and it was so good, not too heavy and not too bland!!! I did ask for Parmesan in it because I love cheese so much. I tried the pesto but I felt like it could've been better. It tastes like any ordinary pesto. For dessert we got the flourless chocolate cake and the creme brûlée. For all you chocolate lovers, this is your go to cake. It's very thick and rich in chocolate. The creme brûlée wasn't overly sweet, which I preferred. The atmosphere was also very nice and welcoming as well. Employees were extremely helpful with great customer service. They always came to our table and checked up on us constantly!

Another amazing time at sparklings!!! Sunday was my surprise bridal shower put on by my mother, future mother in law and bridesmaids along with the fabulous staff here. I cannot thank them enough for being unbelievably accommodating, attentive, and helping my loved ones put on a great shower for me. Everyone who was there raved about the food and beautiful setting. I couldn't have possibly pictured a more beautiful shower with delicious food throughout our stay there Sunday! Thank you sparklings for being so accommodating for our event and one of my favorite spots in town for ANY event from casual drinks at the bar to delicious dinners to special events!!

First time here tonight.  Walked in, were seated fairly quickly, and then waited for about ten minutes before a server came over.  Restaurant was about half full, making me skeptical about our upcoming experience.  Fortunately we were patient, and service improved after that.

I ordered crispy gnocchi to start, and had the stuffed bell pepper appetizer as my meal.  Hubs got Caesar salad and spaghetti with meatballs.  Food tasted great, and we both found other dishes on the menu that we wanted to try.  

Noticed the outdoor seating area as we left, will have to try that before it gets too hot outside as well.  Can't wait to try some of the other dishes - plus 20% off alcohol in the restaurant on Sunday and Monday, and happy hour in the bar EVERY NIGHT 5-10 pm!

I have been wanting to go here for months and I finally went with my bf. It was a Friday night 11:30pm. I was pretty surprised that this place stays open until 3am (its really awesome for a local restaurant) When we walked we were promptly greeted and seated.

Ambience:
The ambience is so cute, very grand and quaint at the same time. I love the mismatch motif. It's nothing I've ever seen before in Vegas. The Sparklings is like Alice in Wonderland meets Breakfast at Tiffany's. They played current EDM at the bar (where we sat at). 

Food:
We ordered the portobello fries and garlic truffle fries for an appetizer then ordered the spaghetti in cream sauce and a cheesesteak sandwich. For dessert we ordered the cheese cake. The pasta was perfectly al dente and the sauce was savory. The sandwich was served with a salad and it was succulent and juicy. 

Service: 
Everyone on staff was very hospitable. Our server was Ray the bartender. I don't know where to begin with how great Ray was. He made sure our drinks were always topped off and always checked up on us. I mentioned that it was my bf's birthday, nonchalantly, when we ordered our drinks at the beginning of dinner and when our dessert came out he put a candle on our cheesecake (little cues like that win me over; attention to detail). When my bf and I finished our lovely meal we sat at the bar and enjoyed a couple drinks. We had a wonderful time conversing with Ray. He is truly a wonderful bartender and a beautiful soul.

Overall:
Came for the experience and stayed for the service. 

The Sparklings is a must for Vegas...Go!

Love Love Love this place. It's super duper low key but so beautiful inside! I love the music cuz it's good pop music that keeps me in my seat moving. It would be great for a dinner party or birthday party. I had the cheese plate which I highly recommend, the French onion soup (meh) the crispy gnocchi soooo yummy (my fav) and the grilled wings were super delicious too! My friend got the shepherds pie ehhhh it's huge though! Oh and the brown butter gnocchi which was spectacular and the truffle corn! Seems like it's always pretty quiet in there but I don't know why it should be packed! I would highly recommend making a visit to The Sparklings you won't regret the decision! Two orders of gnocchi to go please lol!
Amazing food with amazing customer service. The scallops were amazing thanks to the waiters recommendation. We will return:

Ray the bartender was so knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent service. We ordered the tempura shrimp and mushroom pasta and the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta - both were amazing and perfectly cooked. The cucumber salad to start had a great flavor and is a perfect starter. We will definitely be back to try so many more great options on the menu! This is a real review and I'm sorry if I'm overly excited about a great local spot and a great bartender!

Food was OK, but if you are picky about ingredients make sure to ask your waiter.  We ordered the scallops from the appetizer menu and when we received the order it looked like 6 scallops were on the plate.  Turns out 3 of them were deep fried rice balls which were not listed on the menu.  We can't eat these due to our particular diet.  When we pointed this out to the manager she did nothing.  This place is right around the corner from home, so was hoping for better service.

My friend and I had heard great things about this place, so we decided to give it a try since we both live near by. Once you step in you feel like your in a fancy little house! The decor is very cute and a great place to bring your family or a first date. We sat at the bar and ordered Meomi (pinot nior) which is fantastic! The seafood linguine is a must and so is the beet salad! Since my visit 4 weeks ago I've been here 3 times already! Definitely more visits to come and Jose (bartender) is such a sweetheart!

We found this place from yelp and I was really impressed. We had two different gnocchi appetizer and the jambalaya. They are all really flavorful and I like the chicken and the shrimp in the jambalaya most as they are very tender and juicy. 

The decor is definitely very nice and our waiter is exceptional. Definitely coming back if I am local.

I choose this place any time over the comparable chains for more interesting menu, higher food quality, more trendy decor and better services.

Came here late for some drinks and apps.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The bartenders were really nice.  The cheeseboard, spinach and crab dip and brussel sprouts were all really awesome.  I definitely recommend here as the great Local late  spot.  I definitely would go back.

What a cute place! I love the shabby chic decor and the friendly service. Went late on a Friday night and were seated right away. Menu isn't too big but we found a sandwich to order. I had the turkey and cranberry and was pleasantly surprised that it had brie cheese on it. It was delicious. Fries did not come with so we had to order on the side. I like that it is a smoke free establishment.

I wish I had known about The Sparklings and that it had been there for a while. The food is good, it is non smoking, there is a nice bar and lounge area with a patio and a dining area. All of which (minus the patio) can be seen from anywhere in the restaurant. I recommend checking it out. Give it a couple chances if you are looking for a crowd, that can be hit or miss, but it seems robe picking up more lately.

I love it here. Food was so yummy and the service was awesome! The waiters were very attentive and sweet (: also one cannot forget about the decor! Amazing ambience and decor, so many sections to sit in. They had separate rooms and an open dining room.

This review is for New Years Eve. We came for dinner, we had no problem getting in at 7:30 (we didn't have a reservation) and we literally made plans that evening for our night (that's another story). 

We see the sign advertising $29 all you can drink at the bar starting after 9:30pm. We decided to give it a shot. 

Well, we pay for our wristband and proceed to the bar area. We see two bartenders working. I get the feeling this isn't a good idea, and it's too late now since we bought our wristband.  

I wait for nearly 20 minutes for a drink, I ask for two since I know it's going to take forever to get another drink. He wouldn't give me two. My friend comes back with two drinks in her hand. Now I'm irritated on top of annoyed. By 10 pm the place is PACKED. It 3-4 deep at the bar and still only 2 bartenders. 

Now I'm no bar manager, but something tells me that if you advertise $29 all you can drink on NYE, you might want to have more than two bartenders on hand. 

I ended up getting two drinks the entire night. On my way out, I almost slipped in vomit and spilled drinks on the floor. Classy. 

Will I go back? Probably not.

Great staff and great unique food at a great price. In my opinion it cost less than what most places would charge for similar dishes they have. The bar lounge area in the back is a definite plus if you want to socialize. I've been here several times which means I highly recommend it if you're looking to try something new.

The ambiance of this place is amazing. Beautiful, modern decor that feels like you're right at home. The food is delicious! I highly recommend the weekend brunch with bottomless mimosas. I tried the club sandwich and my boyfriend had the biscuits and gravy, we were very impressed!

Before I get into the horrible experience I had at sparklings I will rave that there food was amazing and there drink were incredible too!! 
As far as service it was horrible !!!!!!!!! I will never return nor will the 20 guest we had for the bridal Shower we hosted there. The manager left his staff short staffed. Service was slow, like almost non existent If we didn't constantly ask for things we needed. Drinks were so unorganized and could have been done totally differently to make it run smoother but there was not enough help to do it that way. The waitress was really nice and tried her best but was way too overwhelmed and unorganized. Some of this could have been avoided by the management staying to help. Not the best place for a quick meal so prep yourself for hours !!!!

I've heard a lot about this place so I just had to check it out! First off, the set up of the restaurant is amazing! The dining area has a classy feel to it, very clean and organized. They also have a nice bar area if you want to get your drink on. Anyways, I ordered a bunch of appetizers: calamari, bacon wrapped meatballs, pan seared scallops, and the bruschetta. Definitely try the meatballs and scallops! I just wish there were more varieties for entrees even though I was pretty content with the amount of appetizers I had ordered. I mooched some of the truffle fries off my friend and they were pretty good too! The service is on point. Our server was on top of it and the food came out quick. I also love it how they're open till 2 AM. If they had more choices for entrées then it would definitely be 5/5 stars, but I still highly recommend going to this place. It's a safe first date kinda place lol

Our first time visiting Sparklings and consider ourselves lucky to have found it. 
Great menu and it was adjustable to satisfy our different palettes. 
It's a gem

Myself and a group of friends went there because one of our good friends lives near by and goes a lot apparently. The music they play is awful, it's straight house music 24/7 and not the good house with words ~ the bad repetative techno that you have to be on drugs to enjoy... We asked if they could play any other music, hip hop / rock / top 40 didn't matter, anything but the awful techno ( our entire group of diverse friends agreed ), but the bartender said he didn't want to change it.

My husband was a bit hangry ( grumpy and hungry ) as he had just gotten off work late and he hadn't eaten one thing all day. The bartender ( long, spiked black hair ) allowed our friend who's a regular to order food, but wouldn't let my husband order. My husband gave him a little bit of an attitude but nothing crazy ( he didn't even raise his voice, used no cuss words and didn't even move from his seat ), and the bartender got really upset and told our friend that my husband was 86'ed and that if he came back he would "break his face."

What the.. ??!! We all didn't know where the bartender's reaction / anger was coming from. I was a waitress / bartender for over 10 years and never in my life have I seen someone act so unprofessional. Never-the-less threaten a customer! We just moved close by and had we had a better experience we would have come often, and FYI we spend $$ / never ask for hand outs... None of our friends are going back after that experience..

I feel bad for the owner, according to our friend they've lost a lot of business due to this bartender. Apparently he is very sensitive / defensive and has picked drama with many customers who also chose not to return, but the owner won't fire him because he's been there since it opened..

So between the crazy sensitive bartender who threatens customers and the God awful music, this place is a HELL NO for me!!
Friendly not intrusive service in a spacious French country setting.  My husband enjoyed his generous club sandwich while I inhaled the linguini with clams (pasta perfectly AL dente).

Cute and Classy! 
The name half makes me think of a scary movie...(like the shining or something) and I was half expecting to be afraid because I was driving down Rainbow's dark street for a while...BUT NOPE WE'RE GOOD! Good, lit plaza with a sign very easy to see and Ample amounts of parking. 

The decor inside reminds me of a beautiful, very classy living space, which currently is decorated festively for December. We went here for my cousin's masters graduation in which she reserved a long table for all of us, and the place did not disappoint! 

My cousins said the drinks were tasty, and we all agreed that the dishes we ordered were DELICIOUS. Very well seasoned, juicy meats, beautiful to look at, and great portions that left us full after devouring our entrees. 

Looks like this place is good for large groups (you can reserve tables as well as bigger the bar area) and smaller intimate groups. (Ran into my coworker just having a good dinner and drinks with his old friend on our way out!) Looks like a good hangout, celebration, and dinner spot! 

My only suggestion for this place would be to make sure the food comes out together. My food as well as my brothers food came out last and most of our family was waiting for ours before they started eating. My brother even got the same dish as my cousin and it came out way later. (When we joke that they're still trying to catch the chicken and breed it, you know it's been too long and we're hungry!)

The Sparklings has a pretty high-end ambience for a restaurant in a strip mall. Lovely decor and the friendly staff are the highlights of this place. They offer some creative appetizers like bacon & dates wrapped meatballs and the crispy gnocchi. The name is a bit misleading because the gnocchi itself isn't crispy, but the dish is still good. The braised short rib came highly recommended but I found it way too salty. The flourless chocolate was surprisingly my favorite item to try. Most of the appetizers and entrees don't really spur any excitement for me but overall, The Sparklings is a nice place to spend happy hour or a quiet date night without breaking the bank.

We attended a little get together and as I walked into this restaurant, it reminded me of a New York City lounge/restaurant place. its very trendy and the atmosphere was nice. Great place to have a bridal shower, baby shower, small type venues. 

The food was really good. They made it family style and it worked out great with everyone in the table. There were like 7 different dishes =chicken and shrimp jumbalaya, mussels, carbonara, chicken wings, scallops , garlic fries, arugula flat bread and they were all good. impressive. The owner and the waitress were really nice.

We had little kids with us and the waitress put them in their own table and entertained them with paper and crayons so the adults can enjoy.
Very cute resturant. Yummy food. Our server was very sweet and funny. Best part is they are open late!!!!
Very cute place, the decor is beautiful here, food was amazing as well I will def be back

Hubs and I went here in the mid afternoon, in between his daughter's volleyball games at Desert Oasis.  We decided to sit at the bar and have some apps, and catch up on some Sportscenter.  What a great find!  We ordered the bacon and date wrapped meatballs, with tomato sauce and OH MY GOODNESS they were awesome!  And the sauce had a little zing to it, full of spice and heat.  Yummo!  We also got the portobello fries, which were perfectly seasoned and cooked and served with two different dipping sauces, one was ranch and the other seemed to be a roasted red pepper sauce.  Both were good and you could tell homemade.  We also split the blackened fish tacos, and again yum!  It was like a lovely little unexpected tapas journey and we are so glad we stumbled on this place.  Next time we are in that neck of the woods, we'll definitely go back.

Beautiful atmosphere and attentive staff. Overall, I think the food was just okay. The pesto risotto was really good and definitely left me wanting more, but my entree of cheesy rice and chicken was too rich for my taste. I tried some of my friend's entrees too and nothing really impressed me. In general, it's a bit expensive for the portion sizes, but I'd recommend it if you are looking for a nice place to get a drink and a snack.

This is a late appreciation review, but it's a must. The night before my graduation from UNLV, I was worried about a place to take my family (who flew in from Guam) for dinner that was both fitting for a graduation night & welcome to Vegas. Sparklings obviously came to mind. Even though it was last minute, they fit me in. Unfortunately there was no seating inside (already reserved for graduates who are not procrastinators), but the seating out on the patio was great. The awning made it cool, the lights made it cute, the privacy made it personal, & the food and service was just the cherry on top. Everything we ate was flavorful and rich, without being overbearing. Zucchini sticks, roasted beet & apple salad, and Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta were my favorites!

I had been wanting to try this place since moving into the area about 6 months ago. Today was the day I finally got to check out the Sparklings. 

Located near the southwest corner of  Windmill(Shelbourne, actually) and Rainbow, you will find the Sparklings in the same area as Pho Annie and Cheeburger Cheeburger.

- I ordered a Ribeye steak, cooked medium rare with sides of fried veggies and mashed potatoes ($25). The portion size of the steak was healthy and it was cooked very well. My only complaint was there was quite a bit of fat on there. Also the portion size of the mashed potatoes was pretty puny. They tasted good, but I only had a few spoonfuls and then they were gone!
- We split an order of wings as an appetizer($8). They were ok. They were covered in a sweet sauce (teriyaki?) and very tender. 
- The ribs portion was also fairly substantial and the meat was fall-off-the-bone tender. The taste of the meat just wasn't doing it for me. I felt like I was eating a pot roast. It wasn't bad at all, just not what I was expecting.
- Service was good. Drinks were refilled promptly and the waiter was friendly and engaging.

The room is beautifully decorated, including that impressive chandelier. Lots of open air and space to accommodate many people. I didn't get a chance to check it out, but the bar area actually looked very cozy and inviting. Maybe one of these days we'll all swing by here for drinks.

As for the food, it was okay, but honestly lacked the "wow" factor that will have me returning any time soon. Maybe one of these days I'll give it another shot, but for now the 3 star rating feels very appropriate. Its A-Ok..

3 stars.

After a slow start to a busy brunch for the restaurant...we ended up with the best biscuits and gravy, brisket hash and tuna tartare. It was seriously amazing! Bottomless mimosas were on revolve! The decor is cute but I feel like the restaurant is so new overall that all of the kinks aren't quite worked out yet. Servers were so sweet and apologetic for a few things that went awry but the food and drinks are definitely worth the patience. Go into the bathroom and be instantly transported into an 80s time warp like Willy Wanka where the room gets smaller and seemingly smaller because of the walls. Can't wait to come back here!!!
Love this place great atmosphere!  I love the family vibes.  Super friendly staff excellent food reasonably priced.  I love local spots close to my home!  We will definitely be back.
Pleasant decor. Very kind server, but he was also servicing the bar and obviously busy. Not his fault. Nice place overall. Hopefully management hires another person for the bar area on busy nights :)
Loved the atmosphere and the staff was pleasant. So far everything I have tried tastes great. Love the bacon mushroom spaghetti!
It is expensive but the food was good. I enjoyed the atmosphere. I got the seafood pasta and really liked it.

I dont know. There are a lot of great reviews on this place this is why I have a 3 instead of a 2. Everyones comments on how great the decor is, in my opinion, I felt it was cheap looking. I had one of the pasta dishes and it was bland. The service was ehhh ok. This is why I say "ehhh ok". I ordered cocktail and started to drink it. I was about a quarter of the way through and notice a bug (appeared to be a tiny spider) in it. The next time the waiter came over I showed him. All he did was lift up the glass and said yeah there's a spider. Now, I did not expect anything in return except an apology. I figured he would tell his manager about it but no. Obviously, I was not charged for the drink. I do have a photo of it but will not post it on here. I am just not a fan.

The Sparklings really filled a void for sit down dining in Mountains Edge. It's not "upscale" but beats many of the quick service places in strip malls. I would rate this as a great place to go on a date because of the atmosphere and prices. 

The menu is Italian mostly but offers sandwiches, steak and sea food. Most menu items are below $18 and are of a decent portion. 

I had a shrimp and chicken pasta my last visit and a plan spaghetti the first time. Both were really tasty, not the best I've had but a good value for the price. 

I haven't gone wrong with any of the appetizers especially the steak salad which has perfectly cooled steak along with sweet apples sliced into the mix. 

So many people who live in the southwest come here time and time again. Don't expect the flavors of Honeysalt, but you'll have a great meal!

Ended up here with some friends around 10PM. Was thrilled to see that they serve food late. I have been wanting to try it, since the reviews were so great.

We ended up in the bar, and a cozy little sitting area. The smiling server brought menus right over! One of the friends that we were with has a serious wheat allergy. No not some annoying hipster "gluten allergy" but a serious face swells up like a ball allergy. I have seen photos, it is not pretty!

So...we asked our server what he could have on the menu, and the server cheerfully boasted "Honey, 99% of that menu has wheat in it! You can have a salad and that is about it" Then told us most restaurants don't have gluten free items here in Las Vegas....OK, we will agree to disagree. And wish there were more gluten free options on this menu.

Once we got over that moment, we ordered some food. (Yes my friend had a salad, no dressing because we were told they make salad dressing with wheat as well) 

He had a steak salad and tuna tartar, hold the soy sauce on the tartar. I had the sausage pesto pasta and it was awesome! 

Overall we had a great time, now I really want to go back and sit in the dining room. Which is beautiful BTW! Still holding out hope that the next time will live up to the hype! It was almost there the first time!

What do you say when you can't even scoop the spinach dip on to the chip? 

Do you still eat the fried calamari even though they look like the weren't even cooked "why are they white instead of brown" 

Oh well at least the wine was served at the correct temperature.

Dusting off and old bookmark. Time to Sparkle

The saying, "never judge a book by its cover" has never been truer when it comes to The Sparkling. The outside has the look of every other terrible twenty-four hour local gambling hall. The PT's, the Dotty's, and the Distills of the Valley, but once you walk-in it's completely different. 

A giant chandelier is hanging in center of the main room with brown vintage booths directly underneath. This seating is then surrounded by freestanding tables and private booth areas, I would say the style and vibe of the place is Southern, but the food is a mix of American/Italian? 

We sat in the center booth and promptly ordered drinks and apps. Moscow mules all around and for the apps we got Bacon & Date Wrapped Meatball and Crispy Gnocchi. These were both very good, the Crispy Gnocchi had incredible flavor and the pesto sauce was drinkable. The Gnocchi itself was perfectly cooked, but wasn't crispy. I'm not sure how that factors in in the description. OK, Bacon & Date Wrapped Meatballs. Stay with me here... You take a date, then you stuff it with delicious spicy meats, and then wrap it in bacon. Nuff said. The mules were overly sweet and didn't seem to have much ginger, but they were still tasty and refreshing. 

The main course - The only Italian thing about this plate was the word "pasta" in the title... Cajun Chicken and Shrimp Pasta. Normally, I stay away from this type of Chili's or Applebee's style of food, but I wasn't really feeling much else on the menu, plus the server swore by it. Thank you server guy. This plate of food was delicious, the sauce was spicy, and the pasta was cooked perfect. The chicken and shrimp complimented each other nicely. They seasoned the proteins prior to adding them to the sauce, great touch. 

The server we had was stellar, so good in fact that we didn't want to leave after dining and ended up sipping a few drinks. We moved to the bar so we didn't keep a table busy. The bar was pretty empty, but the service very slow. Bummer. 

The ambiance and food were great; I would definitely come back here in the future. If I could a 4.5 star rating, I would.
Sparklings features: tasty intriguing meals, a traditional yet fun atmosphere, and surprisingly reasonable prices!

This place is chic and edgy. All the food and drinks we tried were delicious. I went during happy hour and my drinks were $6 a piece which is great for Vegas standards! And happy hour goes on until 10! The drink I ordered was called "Pretty in Pink" and it was delicious and of course in true happy hour fashion I ordered two at the same time but this was before I knew happy hour was until 10pm. The restaurant was not packed at all which was great because I was hosting a "Welcome to Motherhood" dinner for my best friend so it kept it pretty intimate even with our seating being out in the open. I took one star off though because 2 things that we wanted to order and had been hoping to try were not on the available which sucked because we had visitors from California hoping to try this. Also, it was hard to get hold of our waitress because she was catering to another table of 20 but we told her we would have patience with her because she let us know a head of time. She was a good waitress just busy. Other than that the experience was great, the food was great, the appetizers were beyond fabulous (especially the truffle fries and the fried zucchini) and the desserts (specifically the creme brûlée) was perfect. I recommend that if you want to host a small intimate get together (baby shower, bridal shower, birthday dinner) then you consider this place. They even let us put up our own decorations.

Like most people have said, the location of this place is a little tricky and so is the look from the outside. If you're visiting from the 215, it'll be on your left on Rainbow right after Shelbourne Ave. You'll see this tavern/PT's looking building but once you get inside, it has a really Chic/French Country style! The tables and seats are so comfy, they also have many large booths and family style tables. My favorite part is the large crystal Chandelier in the middle surrounded by flowers and decor :)

HOURS: Open at 11am everyday and closes at 2 am but on Fridays & Saturdays = 3 am!

HAPPY HOUR: @ Bar from 5pm-10pm Everyday! 30% off drink specials!

MENU: 
-Tons of cool sounding appetizers like Brown Butter Gnocchi, Bacon & Date Wrapped Meatballs

-20 SPECIALTY COCKTAILS! Wow! Some that grabbed my eye: 
Orgasm: Horchata Cream Liquor + Fireball
Pink Tourmaline: Sparkling Berry Blast w/ Lemon Barcardi Razz, Cranberry, Lemonade, Sprite
A Day In Maui: Prarie Cucumber Vodka, Melon Liqueur, Mint Leaves
Amethyst: Purple twist on Pina Colada ft. Acai Berry, Bubble Vodka, Hypnotic, Malibu, Pineapple & Cranberry Juice

-Sandwiches, Pastas & Entrees such as Braised Short Rib, Atlantic Salmon, Shrimp Tempura & Mushroom Pasta, even Daily Specials & Desserts 

-Kid's Menu: 5 options for $6.50 

ORDERED:
-Roederer Estate & Cucumber French 75: Both tasty and refreshing champagne cocktails
-Langosta Bruschetta: Lots of big chunks of Langostine mixed in with Mango, Avocado, Green Onion & a Cream Cheese Aioli. Also very fresh and flavorful, would definitely order these again
-Bacon & Cream Pasta + Shrimp: Basically their take on Carbonara. Creamy, rich sauce, maybe a little too runny for my taste but the flavor was definitely there. Lots of shrimp and mushrooms
-Turkey Sandwich: Reminded me of the Turkey Sandwich at Presto. Lots of turkey, super big chunks of gooey Brie mixed with Cranberry.

I loved everything we ordered! I really want to visit this place again with some of my girlfriends for happy hour since they have a great mix of Cocktails and Appetizers. Can't wait to come back! :)
Tasty drinks are even better at happy hour prices!!! Ray, our bartender, was super nice and very attentive.

Loved this place! It's been open at this location for over 2 years but have always stopped by other places in the same area. Didn't even know it existed! 
First impression: decor is awesome indoors. Thought we'd be walking into a gaming bar but it's a really beautiful place. Smoke-free!!!
Spicy seafood pasta, YUM. 
Also enjoyed Manuscript Red Blend wine, delicious! 
Happy hour on Sundays-Thursdays(I think) 6pm-10pm 12am-2am is 20% off all alcohol in restaurant area and 30% in bar area. There is a different happy hour on Friday and Saturdays. Not too pricy and good service. Will now frequent this place!

To find a neighborhood gem that serves lovely food and great cocktails is always a plus in my book, and Sparklings is now a favorite stop for a few martinis and some great appetizers.  I have yet to try a main entree, which I assume is excellent, but their plethora of appetizers keeps me craving smaller plates over a nice, big steak.  The menu is simple--appetizers, soups, sandwiches, pasta and rice, and then entrees and desserts.  On our first visit, my husband and I went through four cocktails and about 6 appetizers.  Our bill remained well under $90 and we left happy.

My first suggestion is to try their apple & beet salad with candied walnuts along with their crispy gnocchi.  The gnocchi is rich and pillowy, while the salad provides that light contrast.  Move on to the scallops and brown butter gnocchi (if you don't mind doubling up on the gnocchi), then some grilled wings and meatballs.  Those bacon-wrapped meatballs with dates provides a salty and sweet dish with a side of grilled, sweet chicken wings.  We washed it all down with a few Chandelier martinis, a French 75, and a bourbon mule.  Hit it up with some creme brulee or cheesecake if you have room to spare, and your meal will be complete.

I love Sparklings and will forever be a regular at this joint.  If you have yet to try this place, hop in your car any time before 1am to get there before closing.  It's worth the drive.

This place was so great!! The atmosphere was wonderful! I loves the seating that was there, very classy.  And the food was great... I have no complaints about the entire experience.  The service was wonderful, food was hot, etc.  Definitely check this place out if you're looking for something different and romantic.

Lovely restaurant.  Food is excellent, we've been back several times and it's consistently good.  Thank goodness NOT one of those trendy restaurants that are so loud you can't have a conversation.  Service has always been spot on, very helpful wait staff.  You don't need a reservation, we always make one so we get our favorite table.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

The restaurant has a very unique decor and fun atmosphere. We had the club, chicken sandwich, and caprese salad. It wasn't the most impressive food, however better than most places in town.  If you are looking for a life changing meal I would say look elsewhere. For drinks, appetizers, and a nice social outing it is hard to beat this place.

I love love love this place.

I can't get enough of the grape & arugula flat bread.

The tuna tartare could use a bit more tuna but it's still amazing! 

The crispy Gnocchi is delicious 

If you love mushrooms- get the portobello fries. Lightly breaded portobello fries!

The chicken skewers are perfectly seasoned and juicy!

The blackened fish tacos are my current fave. Spicy salsa. so yummy.

The whole place is beautiful and the staff is so friendly and happy!

*update*
Tried to come in one evening. more then ten tables available in dining room, host said to give them a min waited for 15min then left giving up in starvation. Don't insult me with your empty dining tables starting at me  :p


Had a great meal the crispy gnocchi defiantly saved this review!!

The host was great got us seated earlier then our reservation on a sat night, but on the other hand it was DEAD in there for a sat night. The wait staff was not on it that night either, it seemed like no one was sure what section they were serving.... took for ever to get one over and get our drinks.

I had a Moscow bourbon in a copper cup mmmmmm! And started with the crispy gnocchi which I will say again was my favorite! My meal was the rice au gratin with chicken very good but very rich! 

To finish they gave us a free flourless chocolate cake for my and my friends birthday! very good but, dense and rich , order a side of ice cream to go with defiantly needed . 

All and all I want to give this place another chance to get five stars I know they have it in them I just need that stellar service.

Excellency first visit. All our food was delicious. We had quite a variety of items. Octopus, French onion soup, scallops, sliders, Brussels sprouts, corned beef sandwich. Throw in a nice cocktail selection and it was a really terrific meal. Great place to try if you don't know what you feel like as there are so many choices. Very reasonable prices to boot.

Great restaurant with a modern decor located about 15-20 min away from the strip. We came here during the day time and it was surprisingly quiet and almost empty (a few patrons were in the restaurant). We were greeted by an awesome waiter named Jason and his service was superb.

Tasted the prime rib which was by far the best prime rib I've ever had. It was very tender and almost melted like butter in my mouth. Their crab spinach cheese dip which was also delicious. As far as their Jumbalaya, it was a bit too salty.

Moderately priced. Overall great, I'd like to come to this restaurant again and try more of what they have on their menu.

The Oyshi and Soyo ownership group have struck gold once again putting out a modern, strip like quality restaurant/bar in a suburb-ian neighborhood.  

The Happy Hour is the best value where all drink INCLUDING bottles are 30% off.  I recommend going in a group and sampling their entire appeteizer menu where most items are 7-8 bucks.  

You can't go wrong with the bacon and date wrapped meatballs, crispy gnochhi, grilled chicken wings, spinach/crab dip, seafood pasta, and the list goes on.

I would put this happy hour close to Yonaka territory - it is that good.   Be sure to check it out!

We would technically give this restaurant a 3.5, if possible. It began as a 5 and wouldn't have had a hard time keeping it, if it weren't for a few key things at the end of our meal. 

We were charged $8 to swap out the pan seared atlantic salmon's rice for penne pasta. We were not told about this difference in price. If we were told about it, we would have passed on the "upgrade", as there's not enough of a difference between rice and pasta to warrant $28 vs. $20. 

My girlfriend and I went here in part for her birthday, and we ordered dessert in the form of creme brulee and cheesecake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The creme brulee was for her, and this was mentioned when I called in advance to see if we had to make reservations and what they had for birthday girls :) I was served her creme brulee, and she was served my cheesecake with "Happy Birthday" written in sauce, minus the scoop of ice cream! We were charged for that scoop of ice cream. 

The food was very good! The lemon cream sauce w/the salmon was especially fantastic, but being charged an extra $11 is relatively significant, and is what kept this place from being a 5 in our book.

amazing services and foods!!
very good price and fantastic interior, I liked it!!

I live fairly close to this place.  Finally decided to try it out so the wife and I went there on Saturday night.  The decor is awesome, wife and I agree we want our house to look like this!

The menu is decent, nice mix of appetizers and sandwiches and entrees.  We had a beet and apple pizza which was ok, not great and not bad.

I had the club sandwich on the recommendation of the server and it was pretty good.  Wife had a brie and ham sandwich (i think that is what was in it) and she said it was also good.  

There were a lot of families with young kids in there dining which was great, but the place was half empty on a Saturday at 7 pm.   I hope it was an anamoly and that it stays busy.  It is nice to have this place in the neighborhood and i hope it is around for many years to come.  Also, Lagunitas IPA on tap which is nice!

This place is different.  When you walk in you expect it to be ultra fancy but it really isn't.  The food was okay, really bland.  I expected it to all taste better.  And unfortunately it took forever for us to receive our food. 

I won't be returning.

Very good food, nice atmosphere, service is awesome. Definitely more on the pricy side though. I ordered the beef ravioli with vodka sauce and it was to die for. It was very filling & the taste was outstanding. I also ordered the Parmesan truffle fries. They tasted so good, but I probably wouldn't get it again for $6 because it was a very small serving. Overall, will definitely return,... especially for the Italian food!! The one thing I DID NOT LIKE.... it was my friend's birthday and someone bought her a cake. They tried to tell us it would be $1 a person, per plate to split THE CAKE WE BOUGHT. That's absolutely ridiculous and I've never heard of such a thing. Regardless, I will go back... just not for a birthday occasion.

This place is adorable! They've definitely done well with the decor. The service is ok. We had several people constantly checking on us and they were fast and efficient. However, everyone that came to our table was lacking personality. Food was good, not great. I'm glad we came here to try it, but it wasn't so amazing that I'd come back.

What a shame... I wanted to love The Sparklings primarily because the decor is beautiful and it's a stylish restaurant in the Southwest. That being said, the food was atrocious. This was like one of those Hell's Kitchen episodes where Gordon Ramsay attempts to tell the owner how horrible his food is, and the owner is consistently in denial. We found the jambalaya particularly awful- soggy, bland, and without inspiration. The menu was unfocused and we will, unfortunately, not return.
The staff was very friendly and courteous.  The food however was subpar and vey average.

This place was great! Food was delicious. 
We ordered calamari, bacon wrapped meatballs and truffle fries. For desert we had the Trio. Staff was super friendly. The place has a great atmosphere, we will definitely return!!

This place is beyond cute! But service is very limited here. We are celebrating a birthday party and only half of the table go to order their food :( I decided on the crab & spinach dip as an appetizer and it was okay. For my entree I got the Jambalaya and the rice was way too watery. My friend had the zucchini and those were delicious. Their happy hour was great and overall it was a good experience. Just wished the food was amazing.

This place is a little hidden gem, not far from the house! I hosted a bridal shower at this restaurant and guests couldn't stop raving about the decor and food. Definitely a great place for a birthday, small event or gathering. 

We also drop in from time to time for lunch or dinner when we don't want to venture too far. The service is always top notch and the atmosphere is amazing! The bartenders and servers are extremely personable. Food is consistent, I wouldn't call any of the dishes the best I've ever had but I've also never been dissatisfied! My favorites are the portobello fries, the filet, the pork and beef sliders, grilled chicken wings, and atlantic salmon. This is definitely a local regular spot, as they tend to have a little bit of a crowd on the weekend evenings, especially in the bar area.

By the look of the restaurant you think you are going to get a good meal but by the time we tasted our appetizer we knew the quality would not be there. 

We started off with the grapes, arugula and ricotta flat bread. The flat bread was barely warm which made it hard to eat because the ingredients kept rolling off. It was over dressed with balsamic vinaigrette and needed a drizzle instead of a pour. The ingredients in this dish had the ability to work well together but the dish just ended up tasting unsophisticated. For our mains we ordered the chicken Parmesan and the Philly cheesesteak. 

Once again, both dishes were unrefined. 

Chicken Parmesan-  dish was under seasoned, breading was soggy at the bottom and crispy on the top making me think the chicken was not freshly breaded,it was dry

Philly cheesesteak- the low quality of meat and bread was evident. It came with a spring salad that had no dressing and a pickle spear sitting on top. Even if you like pickles I don't think anyone wants it seeping into their salad. 

It's too bad that the food does not deliver because they did a great job on the theme.

I'm on the fence to select 4 or 5 stars. I wish there was a 4.5 stars option. The service was decent and the food definitely above average. Our service was very nice, but I felt it was a bit too casual considering how nice the food and interior looked.

There was a slight mess up on one order where they brought two of the same dish out. It was funny how the second dish "looked" better than the first dish. But the first dish tasted good so no complaints.

You definitely get your money's worth. A very nice establishment with very good food.

We love this restaurant! Jason is a phenomenal server and the food never disappoints. Our 4 year old asks for this place by name, the pasta is her favorite. Atmosphere is lovely and the music is great.

Late review: visited Vegas for a work conference that happened to be on my birthday week, so I met my local girlfriends here for dinner. Beautiful and fun decor! We decided on ordering a bunch of things and shared family style, most of the options we chose were done well. A few misses: our table was kind of private, set back between two walls which was cool, but we didn't realize we were in Antarctica until the AC kicked on and blew directly at our table, making most of the party uncomfortably cold. Secondly, we saw the food runner more than our waiter; it wasn't until we commented on that fact that the waiter finally reappeared! Reminder to all those who work in the service industry in Vegas (especially off-strip), 80% of you customers work in the industry too and will be holding you at a high standard!

This place was surprisingly so delicious! I thought from the outside that it would be a bar but when I walked in I was stunned it's so pretty inside! I came with a few girlfriends and we ordered a bunch of food and shared it among us! The zucchini and portobello fries were to die far! We also tried the crab dip and it was okay a little too fishy for me though. We also ordered the shrimp po boy and omg it was AMAZING. The bread was so soft and the sauce on it was delicious! We ordered the Rice Au Gratin with Chicken and it was alright! I would definitely come back because this place is so cute and for a very reasonable price! There was only two waiters so I would probably go at another time when there was more because the service was a little slower than what I normally like.

So, we decided to forget about watching what we eat and ate 4 appetizers, tapas style, and topped it off with the dessert trio.... out of all 7 items I must say that they deserve 10 stars out of 5. Amazing food, well prepared and presented..... and the servers are up to par to the food.... the ambiance is perfect.... I highly recommend this place....

My husband brought me here for our 2nd year anniversary and I love the ambience of this place.  That includes the music and environment.  The food was amazing.  We ordered the truffle fries and it was great!!!  I ordered the spicy seafood pasta and my husband ordered the amazing chicken and rice au gratin.  The cocktails were awesome and we had a great night.  The service was fast and the waiter was very pleasant to talk to.  It wasn't pricey either which was a surprise given the amazing service there.  This is a definite go!

I was so very looking forward to eating here.  got a takeout order, ordered the spaghetti with mushroom and bacon cream sauce, bacon date meatballs, and spicy seafood pasta.  the meatballs were quite good.  the date added a nice sweetness and anything wrapped in bacon is delicious.  the sauce was a little on the tangy side.  little bit too acidic if you ask me.  spaghetti with mushroom and bacon cream sauce was really good.  a very simple dish with few ingredients done very well.  highly recommend this dish.  the spicy seafood pasta was good and bad.  I would say the dish as a whole was great.  sauce was good, lots of seafood and large scallops.  only problem was the mussels were horrific.  they were spoiled rotten or something.  they smelled like poop.  I could not eat it.  the mussels pretty much ruined the entire dish for me.  not sure what was going on with the mussels, but they all smelled bad.  I'm iffy about going back after my experience.

Decided last minute on our anniversary we wanted to go out to dinner. Tonight is the first game of the championship games so I knew anywhere we would go would be packed. I called to see if the bar had TVs to watch the game and Tyler answered the phone. He told me that they had a big party coming in but because it was our anniversary he would save us a seats at the bar. When we arrived there were two seats with menus waiting for us. Tyler remembered us and also remembered to wish us a happy anniversary! He was awesome. Our bartender Anthony was great too. Awesome customer service. Now to the food! We had the spinach and crab dip which came out hot and cheesy! We ordered a bottle of wine as well with their 30% off at the bar. What a gem to find here in Vegas. I had the crispy  gnocchi as a meal and my boyfriend had the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta which both were amazing! We finished off our dinner with a flourless chocolate cake dessert. Overall I would highly recommend this place!

First of all, after reading many of the reviews, I would like to say "kudos" the manager, Andy for his customer service excellence in responding to some of these with an opportunity to make it right for these folks! As I teach, customer service and sales for a living, I use Andy as an example often of a WOW customer experience! I have been to Sparklings several times for events and dinner, and EVERY TIME was as good as the first. Consistency is tough, but Sparklings pulls it off. It is super difficult to find ANY business with the level of service that this place has. This last time, my husband and I went in for a glass of wine and dessert. We were seated, and treated just like any customer buying a full fledged dinner. The service was prompt, professional, and the wine is great! the flourless chocolate cake was also "melt in your mouth" good! Andy checked on us also, which is always a nice treat and says a lot about his dedication to the service. I highly recommend this place to anyone who takes great pleasure in paying their dollars to a business who understands the needs and takes care of their customer!
Food was good, not great.   We tried 4 appetizers and a few meals.   All were again good, but just lacked something.   Staff however was very personable and great to deal with.
Just a real nice, chill place to eat, drink and hang out with friends. Nice vibes going on here!!

I've come here several times and have had amazing experiences at the bar.  My parents are in town and I thought this was a nice place to take them after a long flight.  

The food was still top notch but the service was awful.  We were promptly sat in the main area and the guy who sat us started us with waters.

Then we sat and waited for over 10 minutes and a server came over and asked if we had been taken care of and we said no and he said he would.  We then ordered our meal and there was another substantial delay.  My tuna tartar came out first and then nothing for a while then my dads app the fish tacos came out then nothing.

I made eye contact with the manager as he probably saw me looking around and that is when all of our food came out.  While all of the food was great, the service didn't compare to what it has been before.  Not to mention the manager clearly could tell I was impatient and while he intervened to deliver our meal he didn't apologize for the obvious delay.

The bathrooms definitely need some attention.  They were out of paper towels and the toilet didn't flush easily. We could even hear other guests complaining at the host stand to the manager about the bathroom being sub par.  

We were then forgotten about again and as my family was tired we went up to the host stand ourself to pay our bill.

This place has the food down to a tee but if they don't turn their guest experience around ASAP I can't see anything good for the future.  I truly hope this was a one off.

So updating my original review. I'm sure the food is still excellent but I wouldn't know since the last two times I've tried to dine here it's been closed for a private event. 

Normally this wouldn't have bothered me, the first time they were polite enough to have posted a sign saying they were closed for the afternoon which was perfectly acceptable. 

The second time I made sure to call in advance because I didn't want to make the drive all the way over there to be turned away again. The gentleman on the phone said they were open for normal business hours. Great! I said and almost hung up but then he mentioned the dining area was closed for a private event but we could still sit at the bar and we could still eat there. That option was fine with us so we left to eat there. 

When we arrived we were told that there was a private event and they were closed. I said I just called and that the person on the phone said we could eat at the bar. However to get to the bar we had to walk through the private event which was very awkward. No one else was there aside from the private party so we ended up leaving. 

I get it... Places get bought out. It's a cute atmosphere... But this type of miscommunication shouldn't be happening. If a place is bought out, it's bought out. I guess we *could* have sat at the bar but it was extremely awkward and clearly the entire place was supposed to be only for that party. 

Maybe one day I'll actually get to eat there again.... Maybe.

My friends and I love coming to this place. Always have a great time here. I crave aglio e olio every now and then, and love the fact that Sparklings is close by. The interior of the place is chic yet cozy.  Wine selection is pretty good. And their bartenders are funny and friendly. They have an extended happy hour from 5pm to 10pm and is certainly worth a visit.

When we walked in to a half empty restaurant, there was no host at the front, so we waited about 10 minutes for a waiter to finally seat us. We were excited about the decor in the dining room. They gave use a table in a nice secluded area with a bench seat on one side and overly large comfortable seats on the other. The menu looked impressive with very reasonable prices. I couldn't believe it wasn't packed with people. The waiter was very friendly. We placed our order for drinks, appetizers and entrees.  When my wife went to pick up the menu, there was a bug on the table under the menu. She jumped from her seat. The waiter looked for the bug under the table. I used the light on my phone, and we found and killed it. Ok. Everything ok. Let's get back to dinner. About 2 minutes later, my youngest jumped out of her seat and said there was a bug on her leg. I looked on her seat, and the bug was running around on the cushion (see picture). Who I think was the owner (tall Asian guy) came over to talk to the waiter. The waiter moved us to another table. We decided to stay because it wasn't roaches, and it was too late to find another place to eat as the kids were hungry. 
Out comes one of the appetizers - bacon/date meatballs. As we took our first bite of the meatballs, out comes my wife's ribeye entree order. The owner comes over and asks how's everything. I said the entree is a bit early. He says, "Oh, I will try to get the other entrees out faster."  What?  How about giving us time to eat the appetizers first.
