Then the next appetizer comes out - the octopus. Then the kids baby back ribs. Finally my chicken parmigiana. So all entrees were on the table before we even finished our appetizers. Geez. Not a huge issue for us because the apps were a couple of bites each, but why doesn't the owner or waiter know how to time the food coming out???  Also, the owner never even apologized about the bugs. 
Now the food (see pictures). My chicken parmigiana came with spaghetti. The spaghetti was cooked right al debate and sauce tastes good. The chicken had a weird texture. I flipped it over and noticed that it looked like chicken had either panini grill or George Foreman grill marks. It was not a breaded chicken breast. Chicken parm is my favorite dish, and they do not do it justice. The chicken filet itself tasted liked a previously frozen breast that gets injected with solution kind of like a breast from one of those family sized bags of frozen breasts you find at Costco. 
My wife got a rib-eye steak and ordered it medium. Although it came out earlier than any other entree, it was well done. It also had a strange color to it. Although there were grill marks, it did not have any kind of crusting like a char-broiled or flame-broiled steak. It looks like they put it on a grill pan but there was too much liquid in the pan causing a boiling of the meat instead of a sear. We waited for about 15 minted before we even saw the waiter again, and told him about the steak. He apologized and went back to get another steak. My wife ate what should could but about 50% of the steak was fat (see picture). Yes the rib-eye looks like a large portion when it comes out, but you can't eat most of it. 
Two of the kids split the ribs. It came with cornbread and mashed potatoes. The cornbread was extremely dry and tasteless. My kids love cornbread, and we each only tasted a small bite to see how bad it really was. Although the ribs were fall off the bone, they still tastes dry to me. The bbq sauce on the ribs was overpowering and not very good. 
My other kid ordered the kid's menu fish and chips. Typical crap food on a kids menu using a frozen fish filet that's deep fried. Kid's meal comes with a drink, but apparently the waiter doesn't know that because he tried to charge me for the drink. 
In the end, I think the bugs were trying to warn us to get out of there. They even sent two, so we would get the point. I wish we walked out after the second warning. I was so disappointed as we were hoping this could be a cool place to stop whenever we are in Vegas. My kids didn't even want to stay for dessert. At one point we were looking for our waiter. I noticed he was near the bar talking to someone.  He was there for about five minutes. Next thing you know he is doing shots with the guy. Then instead of checking on his tables, he wanders in to the back for another 10 mins. The owner never checked on us again even though he passed our table about 10 times when he went to/from the kitchen. 

Bottom line - the food pretty much sucks, the service sucks, the owner doesn't care. It is reflected in the food they serve, the service they provide, and the apathy they display.   As we left the restaurant, you would think someone would give a final word of apology. The owner was too busy in the bar area BSing. Bill $103. No comp for the horrible experience, and overcharged for a soda. No wonder it was pretty empty on a Friday night. One star for ambiance.

I read the reviews and had to try it.  I had to try the crispy gnocchi. Omg, it was so good. Had the bowl of clam chowder. Only thing bad was it was it was too big (for me), so it made me kind of full before dinner. I had the cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. It was so good. Creamy, lots of different colored bell peppers. I didnt drink wine that night, but I looked over the selection and they had a nice variety of everything. Our server was great. Jason I think his name was? My only thing was I couldn't quite pin point the atmosphere.  It's nice, but like trying to hard to be upscale. The music was very jazzy and at times elevator music. I think if the music was a little more upbeat and the lights lowered a bit, it would change the atmosphere drastically. Overall great food... great prices for the excellent dishes they offered.

Yummo!  Why have more people not discovered this place on a Sunday when all the usual brunch suspects are packed??  The menu is chick full of fun treats like blackened trout, bacon wrapped date meatballs, crispy gnocchi. We sat at the bar and Jason was attentive and a great conversationalist. Plus he pours a mean custom Bloody Mary. I almost didn't want to write this review because I don't want others to find this place and have it get hellah crowded.

The Sparklings is great!  They were able to accommodate us with a large party last minute.  The food is delicious and their service is awesome. Will definitely come back to enjoy the amazing atmosphere and deliciousness food.

Thanks to The manager Andy and the awesome staff who worked our party!!!

Beautiful venue, nothing amazing from the menus and service was so-so. Tried the meatballs which were a rave and I wasn't too fond. Everything was very average and the presentation was low key. Prices didn't reflect what the venue lacked. There are better places that deserve the rating this place has that are way better!

I was in there a week and a half ago on a Friday night with three other friends to have dinner and drinks. Made reservations and got seated right a way. The server was bad. She brought out the mixed drinks right a way but she totally forgot about the beers after about 15 minutes I said something. Also the all four of our dinners were bad. Nobody finished their meals. I used to love this place but quality and service has gone down hill. Won't b back any time soon

I have been to The Sparklings 4 times and each experience was 5 star.  The food is delicious (great variety) and the ambiance and staff is superb.  I'm thrilled that we have a restaurant like this in the SW!

The food was solid and had some creative choices. I think I would eat most items on the menu. We got the portobello mushroom fries, bacon-wrapped date meatballs, sliders, and 1/2 slab of ribs. Everything looked like the pictures and tasted really good, though not the best I've ever had. Would give 4.5 stars overall, but it's excellent for the mid-priced range, so I gave it 5 stars. It gets a bonus for the decor and chandelier too.

Why isn't this place busy....it is gorgeous!!  Food was good and service was too....wish they had a brunch but I hear it is in the works.....word of advise for the owner...ADVERTISE and use social media!!!
This review is for the service. One word, slow. Had to ask 5 times to get extra small plates. Water had to ask mutuel time before refill. Need more staff.

First time attendee, my date and I definitely had a blast. The ambiance you see in the pictures are exactly how it is inside. The booths, seating areas and tables are spaced out well. As my partner says, it was like being in a SIMS game. 

Food: Bruschetta and Tuna Tartare for the appetizer. Full of flavor with every little bite. 
My date had filet mignon as I had the rib eye. She describes hers as "melts in your mouth" type of ordeal. I tried to savor my rib eye as much as I could, 12oz of medium rare goodness. The portions were really huge, judging off the other tables. We also had a bottle of wine to go with our meals. Ended the night with a Creme Brûlée, each. Too good to share. 

I will definitely be coming back to Sparklings. Waiters were very prompt and catering. It's not too casual nor too formal of a place to dine and wine. 

PS:
The last star represents the piano covers of popular songs they play on a low tone throughout the restaurant.  Nothing beats good food and good music!

I really enjoyed my meal at the Sparklings.  Based on its location, you would never expect the quality or the atmosphere of this place.  Their Happy Hour is great (lasts pretty much all night at the bar area) and the bartender was great as well.  I had a salad to start and a steak that was very fairly priced and cooked great.  The person I was dining with had a calamari and pasta that also looked lovely.  

This restaurant seems like a nice date spot off the beaten path that will neither break the bank or underwhelm.  It looked like a very niche place that I would bring people on a regular basis.  I recommend the Sparklings regularly as many would never know it existed based on its locale.

This was our first time at the restaurant and the decor and vibe was pretty cool and eclectic.

We sat and waited about 5-8 minutes to be greeted and get our drink orders taken which also gave us time to have our whole order placed appetizers and entrees.

We order the crispy pesto gnocchi which was pretty good but rich to eat alone. We also had the langosta bruschetta which had a beautiful display but underwhelming taste.

Our meals came out and we were not impressed. I had the shrimp tempura pasta with mushrooms. Looked nice, the pasta had a pretty good flavor but I could have gone without the breaded shrimp. It was soggy and I couldn't eat it at all cause the thought alone made me gag. My brother had the cheesesteak and they had kraft cheese on it and it was pretty bland. My friend had the clam pasta and it had so many shells in it but we weren't sure why.

We tried to pay for our bill and after waiting for 10 minutes we decided to just go to the host stand to pay. We literally could have dined and dashed and they would have never known (I would never btw but it was tempting at the level of disappointment we had)

Well, I'm kinda mixed on this place.  
The atmosphere is pretty cool and shabby chic. There's a cool huge crystal chandelier in the dining area and several small, fun touches - like the hot pink door leading to the kitchen
The servers are friendly and prompt (although I did have to ask for a water refill - which, in my opinion, should be automatic).

The men's bathroom is in desperate need of a deep cleaning though. There's thick hard water deposits on the fixtures and dirt stains on the mirrors and towel dispenser. While the main dining area looks very well maintained, the men's restroom appears utterly neglected.  Wife said women's room looked good.

Thought it discomfiting that the server did his side work in the main dining area during lunch. There was lots of silverware clanging around while we were trying to eat.

The price was good, the food: excellent!

Will most likely return at a happy hour in the future.  Just hope they clean the men's room.  If not for the few things I dislike I would have given 4 stars.

First time checking this place out. Its far from me (summerlin) but my friend suggested it for brunch and bottomless mimosas starting Friday-- which I LOVE WITH ALL MY HEART. the place looks great. Very chic and clean. Wait staff is great, the food was tastey and portions were perfect. Very good for groups of people wanting to have conversations. We stayed here for more than 2 hours, and they were fine with us hanging out there. I would definitely come back, they had me at BOTTOMLESS.

SUPER darling interior and ambiance in the restaurant.  Menu is amazing too, some of the food didn't quite live up to my hopes but overall still very good.  Highly recommend for an affordable but nice night out. 

Also attended a baby shower here and it was wonderful!

I love this bar! My husband and I come here all of the time! The food is delicious and the service is great! We usually sit at the bar when Angel is working and service is always amazing! The decor is also awesome! My husband and I highly recommend The Sparklings :)
Beautiful decor, good service.  Clean and neat.  Decent fresh food with reasonable pricing.

I would really go for a 4.5 star on this one but I did not genuinely have an issue. The only semi-negative thing was that our server was a little "over the top." Meaning, this person kept referring to us as "loves." It was just a little out of the ordinary. But as far as water refills were concerned, they were on top of it and we also ordered a bottle of wine that was refilled for us promptly. 

So! Here are the good things: 

LOTS of different options and variety. It is a little mix of modern American and Italian. Between the three of us we ordered: 
Caprese Salad
Crispy Gnocchi 
Shrimp Po Boy 
Fish Tacos 
Beet and Apple Salad

All of which were excellent and had no issues. You can tell the ingredients are fresh and delicious. The price was less than $10 for each dish which was great. Keep in mind that these items are all "appetizer" size compared to other restaurants. 

Anywho, I am all for supporting local businesses that aren't a chain. Definitely give this place a shot. We will definitely be back.

From the outside, this place looks like a Tavern.  From the inside, you feel as if you're in a fancy pants place on the strip.  It's very chic and boutique-e with their chandeliers, flowers, and modern furniture.  

I came here today (for Mother's Day), but I've been here one other time for drinks and food.  Today we had our own room/area since we were a party of 6.

The servers were very nice and the service was fast.  It was pretty busy today since there was an event happening, but they were on top of it!

I had the lobster bisque, spicy seafood pasta, and creme brulee. 

Good lobster bisque is hard to find.  The lobster bisque here was on point.  Tortilla chips and sour cream (optional) made it better.  

The spicy seafood  pasta was just as advertised: SPICY.  This has a generous amount and array of seafood such as mussels, clams, scallops, squid, and shrimp.  I would get this again!

The vanilla creme brulee was fantastic too!  It's big enough to share with 2 people.

I really enjoyed the food and ambiance here.  I would recommend this place for special occasions.

Great addition to SW LV

Ambiance: 5/5 surprisingly lovely inside! Beautiful center chandelier and flower arrangement. Sure the flowers are fake, but they're still some good looking fake flowers

Service: 3/5 Friendly but rather slow, especially considering the fact that there were really only like two other tables there

Food: We ordered the most recommended dishes...all good but none great...and aside from the gnocchi, I felt I could make the rest of what I had pretty easily at home. And no, I'm not a good cook.
-Crispy gnocchi: 4/5 good pesto, good gnocchi. but not exceptional
-meatball wrapped in date and bacon: 4/5 also just solid. 
-spicy seafood pasta: 3.5/5 good, but nothing special. I mean honestly, is spicy seafood pasta ever not good?
-dessert trio: 2/5 this fell pretty flat for me. The chocolate cake was meh. the creme brulee was meh. brulee was thick and hard, not light and crunchy. and creme was not super creamy...more eggy. ice cream utterly ordinary.

I still think it's a great restaurant for the area but unfortunately if these three things are the best dishes the Sparklings has to offer, I'm not that interested in coming back.

I've been coming here for the past 4 years. Been throwing events for baby showers and birthdays. Great service and the manager, Andy has been accommodating. As far as food, delicious!! I have never eaten here and was not satisfied!! If you're looking for a place to accommodate a large party that some restaurants can't then this is the place.

My husband and I came for my anniversary and what a great place.  Food was amazing and Jason and Tyler were working there butts off.  One thing I could suggest was damn u guys need a hostess.  Btw the manager and these guys were running there ass off.  Def coming back.....this is a late review thought i sent it but never did.  We came to this place in sept and then again in nov.  Second visit was just as good.

This little gem of a place is so cute we had the best time going to dinner the manager was just so sweet and incredible helping us decide what we wanted to eat the food has so much flavor and the price is really good the staff is just very attentive and very sweet and I just can't get over how cute the Decour of the restaurant is

Beautiful restaurant ! Great for birthdays , gatherings , dates , or just a quiet evening out. Open and spacious with intimate decor . Food is good and price is very reasonable. Our server was very nice . He explained the menu and recommended a few good dishes . I'm definitely coming back .

If you were to take the industrial ceiling of a New York City apartment, combined with touches of decor that would make a typical Pinterest fangirl squeal with glee, mixed with your mother's tea cabinetry, and throw in an elegant chandelier in the center, you would get The Sparklings restaurant.

My family and I stopped in here for dinner. We wanted to try something new. There weren't very many people there on a Sunday night. The ambience is definitely not your run-of-the-mill. It's a wonderful combination of modern meets classic. An open, airy, yet sophisticated vibe.

With only a couple tables aside from ourselves, the service was pretty good. We were immediately brought waters by an employee, and our waitress was overall friendly. The drinks were great, too - very presentable. I had the BLUEBERRY MOJITO and it looked beautiful! My dad got a MOSCOW MULE and my sister a CHOCOLATE STOUT.

The only reason why I docked a star was because of the food. Don't get me wrong, it's good - as well as surprisingly affordable - but it's not the best I've ever had. For appetizers, we had the PARMESAN TRUFFLE FRIES and the BACON & DATES WRAPPED MEATBALLS. The latter were a bit on the lacking end. They were just okay, the tomato sauce seemed like it needed more kick. As for entrees, my dad and I both got the CAJUN CHICKEN AND SHRIMP PASTA, my brother opted for the SPAGHETTI WITH MUSHROOM & BACON CREAM SAUCE, and my sister ordered the RIB-EYE STEAK, which she said she loved. She and my brother both finished their entrees; my dad and I took our leftover pasta to-go. I wasn't really feeling it. It just didn't have a congruent overall taste. 

We didn't have much room for dessert, so I can't comment on that. Overall though, we had a pleasant experience. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere made it worth it.

Great service! Awesome food! I go there  4 Takeout. They are always accommodating and have my order ready when I arrived. I plan on dining in next week. I cannot wait! I highly recommend this restaurant!! They also do not allow smoking!!! Awesome!

I've been coming here for years but have just recently became active on yelp so here I am showing the very deserved love for this place. 
I've come here for my 21st and 22nd birthday and it's such a great place to hang out with a lil group o' friends or to have a classy date night. The appetizers are great, I love the crab dip, langosta bruschetta, and the different gnocchis. 

As far as service, I have had some of the best from the guys here. Jory, Landon, Dean, Rey, and the other crazy haired bartender have taken amazing care of me the many times I've been here.

Service was excellent and food was delicious! Fun place to grab a drink at the bar with the girls or have dinner with the family! Happy hour 5pm-12am! Can't pass that up! May have to make this a weekly hang out spot! Def will be back again soon :)

First time here and it we loved it. Angel was our server and he was fantastic! He helped us pick out some delicious sweet wine and made sure to take care of us the whole time we were there. 110% recommend their shrimp scampi!

This place is a new favorite for date night. GREAT and personable owner. Love the posh decor and vibe of the place. The fiancé and I want to have our rehearsal dinner here. Still loving the food and the short ribs are still my favorite. Tried the honey flatbread appetizer, meatballs, and creme brûlée last time I visited. I have yet to be disappointed by anything I try.

Great food and great service! Really enjoyed our meal. Took my mom here
For her birthday and she enjoyed it too. Will definitely come back. Love the steak salad, clam chowder, clam
Pasta and portobello fries!

This place is out of this world! First off, the vibes and the feel of this place are instantly elegant and chic! From the pink roses to the beautiful chandelier, this place was definitely made for a romantic experience. Don't let the outside fool you! It looks like any other restaurant surrounding it. 

I ordered a raspberry lemon drop and my boyfriend ordered the bourbon mule. Let me just say, my martini was made with fresh muddled raspberries and tasted perfect. The equal parts alcohol and equal parts raspberries and pink sugar around the glass rim were on point. 

We ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce and the chicken parmesan. Both were extremely delicious! I highly recommend both dishes. Each meal was enough food for 2 people. They didn't serve only Italian. The menu ranges from different cuts of meat and fish, cheeses, pastas and soups. 

Definitely excited to come back to this local place! For being off the strip, fairly priced and one of the best meals I have had in a while this place is definitely going on the top of my list.

First impression when you first walk into this place is, "wow, very beautiful!"  This place is definitely a hidden gem for the southwest area.  Best part is that it's open late, with bar and kitchen open till 2am.

I wish I could've given this place 5 stars!  The only mess up was the rib eye steak was over cooked and looked like it belonged in a $2.99 steak and egg special.

The wife and I shared truffle fries, meatballs, scallops, rib eye steak (which we sent back to the kitchen, and braised pork ribs.

The Truffles Fries were my favorite, plenty of garlic! Definitely tasted Asian fusion.

Meatballs were very good, could've been a little softer.  The marinara sauce was on the sweeter side, but I didn't mind it.

Scallops are a must!  Perfection indeed.  The seasoning and the way it was cooked was on point.

Ribeye was the worst part of our meal, and we had to send it back to the kitchen because it was cooked well done (we asked for medium).  There was no flavor and the look of the steak was ugly.

We replaced the steak with the braised pork.  The pork and sauce was amazing, and a huge rebound from the rib eye steak.

So overall, we will be coming back and recommending this place to everyone we know!  We will just let everyone know, not to order the rib eye steak!

The ambience here is just beautiful, real Victorian. I can't express the relaxing and sophisticated feel of this place. Food was great as well, another favorite spot away from the strip. I recommend the spicy seafood pasta, seared scallops, bacon wrapped date meatballs. Once again, this place is a quiet hidden beauty!!!

I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. I usually go with the higher star, but I think I only want to give it 4 because I love champagne. I wasnt that impressed with the food. It was OK enough for me to want to return, but nothing was great. Wait, I take that back. I liked the grape, ricotta toasts. Everything else was mediocre. The company, Cathy and Anthony, was lovely. So that also makes the experience nice.
Cathy and I shared a bottle of sparking wine. We ordered about 7 different appetizers and they were just OK. But, the place is cute and the prices were good, so I will return.

The Sparklings is one of my top ten favorite restaurants in Vegas! The service is so amazing, everyone that works there works hard and always keeps such a positive attitude. The food is delicious!!! My favorite appetizer is the grapes and arugula flatbread...mmmm!!! The jambalaya is good as well as the cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. The decor is beautiful and it's never crowded no matter what time or day I go, which is a great thing because that means there's never a wait.

I always take my friends here and it's a great place to take a date as well!

Talk about an extreme makeover... they did an amazing job renovating the spot formerly occupied by Nagoya. What once was dark and dingy is now open, airy, and elegant. 

The food was hit or miss. The light and fluffy crispy gnocchi had great flavor and a nice variety of textures. Unfortunately, that was the highlight of the meal. The tuna tartare was dominated by an acidic and fruity flavor. The meatballs stuffed with dates and bacon were ok but the sauce lacked depth. Then there was the octopus... I like eating octopus when it's slices or chunks of large tentacles. The version here is presented as 3 tiny, whole octopi. I can't say I was a fan. Too chewy even for normal octopus standards.

They do have a kid's menu, so that's a plus for anyone with a family. Service was great, but then again there was only one other party there.

The food is fantastic, the atmosphere is wonderful, the happy is amazing. My family and I had some mixed signals and didn't reserve a table big enough for Mother's Day dinner. It was no problem, they made it work! The Trio for dessert can make any day better!

I've been here a couple times for dinner and I've never been disappointed. The food is amazing and the drinks are on point! I've tried the shrimp po boy, bacon wrapped meatballs, spicy seafood pasta, and the creamy pesto sausage pasta. All thumbs up! Their draft beer selection isn't the best but they make up for it with their signature cocktails. However, I'm docking one star for service. It's never consistent. Sometimes it's really good and sometimes I feel like I'm bothering the waitstaff. It's a day to day thing.

This place is a jewel in the southwest area.  I love the selection of small plates at a great price.  The crispy gnocchi dish is my fav gnocchi dish ever.  This place has a lovely atmosphere and incredible, charming, welcoming staff.

Food is amazing.  I have eaten here several times but find it disconcerting that their menu isn't available online.  It's 2014 sparklings, get with the times.  Sometimes I want to get food after a long day of work but have to get it elsewhere because they don't have an online menu where I can order and pick up to take home.  Btw, I miss the short rib they used to have.  Gnocchi is killer though

The atmosphere in this place is classy and modern without seeming overdone. The high ceilings are accessorized with low-hanging chandeliers, and the interior is sort of divided into a bar section and a restaurant section. The tables are placed far enough from one another to allow for plenty of privacy even without curtains or dividers between them. 

The service is great. Our servers were on top of their game throughout our stay, refilling our waters and coming by regularly to check on us. Stars for attentive and friendly service!  
My friends ordered the honey bread appetizer and the walnut appetizer along with some pasta dishes. I ordered the Steak Diane for a main dish. 

I loved the appetizers! The honey bread, which I would not have ordered myself, came out a pleasant surprise, as its crispiness was accentuated with thick honey. On the other hand, the crunchy walnuts contrasted very nicely with their sauce. The appetizers made me expect the best from my main dish. Unfortunately, I was let down, as my Steak Diane came out way too salty. Bummer. 

Overall, the atmosphere and the service here were lovely. The food would have been as well, if it hadn't been for the ocean water-marinated steak.

if we could give this no stars we would...overpriced worse food ever, terrible service, cold atmosphere.  We had fettucini alredo that was so hard you couldn't even cut it, sitting in a pool of sauce.  The chicken was not cooked well and when we did finally get the attention of our waiter and told him, his reply was 'that's a first' and he walked away.  They brought the bill and could have cared less.  We live nearby in NV Trails and though we were hopeful it was a good place to eat out with friends, won't be back!  I doubt they will last long with that attitude and bad food

Chose this place for my Mom's 60th Birthday dinner and it was a great choice! I loved the decor so elegant, but comfortable. It was also kid friendly and had a lot of open space. It was a Sunday night the place only had a few other people at the bar and restaurant so it felt like we had the place to ourselves which was nice. The service was excellent and the food was great! It wasn't crazy over priced like restaurants on "the strip" and it was just as good or better. Definitely a great hidden spot just 10 minutes for the strip. We will be coming back :)

I had a delicious vegetable lasagna at this restaurant last night.  I was with a group of about twelve.  I also had a couple of beverages.  When it was time to pay, I used a crisp $100.00 bill.  My server, who had been very pleasant, knew what bill I was paying with asked if I needed change.  I replied were you expecting an almost $80.00 tip?  When he left, my friends told me the tip was INCLUDED with the tab because we were a large party.  Once they informed me of this, I could not believe that my server had the audacity to try and SWINDLE me out of more money by using deceptive tactics that would lead a customer to assume that the tip was not included.  I am wondering if this deception is restaurant policy or just one server trying to make big bucks off of unsuspecting customers.
I for one will not return to this restaurant because I do not approve of doing business dishonestly and I will be spreading the word.
Lobster bisque is sooo good! And the divers scallops are my favorite! I will come back...great date place!

Great ambiance and very nice decor brought me and my wife in on Valentine's Day. The food was a big bonus. Nice portions and great taste. Great bar area to mingle and get a drink as well. Eric, our server, was a very nice guy. We will be back to try new things.

Although this is not a gourmet restaurant, everything they served was a well-prepared and savory example of the item. We started with appetizers of meatballs wrapped in bacon and crunchy gnocchi, both delicious and unique. For entrees there was spaghetti with bacon served with chicken, a Philly cheesesteak sandwich and brie with turkey, again spot-on and flavorful. The location interior was a bit quirky, but in a compelling way-a cross between factory loft and grand ballroom. You'll see what I mean when you go inside. Server was attentive and friendly, owner came by to see about our experience, this restaurant is worth a try!
First time here, did take out. Super easy and great service. Loving the vibe! Definitely worth coming back !!

Sparkling is almost a week old and it stands to be a great restaurant.

The decor is a modern chic and very nicely done.  Whether you are coming in as a couple, a group of friends or even a large party, they have diferent size tables.  They also have a private dining area for up to 14.

Servers haven't had much training yet.  Rather a bit of ojt. Everyone was very friendly and helpful though.

The food was also pretty good.  To start,  appetizers: Definitely try the meatballs.  They are the bomb.  The pan seared gnocci was also good, but I would have preferred it with pancetta vs sausage.  On to entrees: my wife is very fond of braised ribs and these were good, but not as good as Roy's.   I had the jambalaya and it was ok, but was missing cayenne and andoille sausage.  It was a bit salty and and very tomatoish.  Nonetheless, I cleaned my plate.  Finally dessert:  The cheesecake is a must and the chocolate cake is good but rather heavy.

Overall, it was a very good meal and considering they are a week old, its safe to reason that they will continue to improve.

From the owners of. Oyshi Sushi,  this is a very different concept, but I do like it and I'm glad we have it in our southwest neighborhood.  We will be back!!!

The staff was friendly, service was good.  I found the decor to be different yet relaxing.  The bar/ lounge area was really cool however the dining room seem to be a little detached from the food being served.  Upon entering the restaurant it appears to be a fine dinning restaurant but as I walk through the dinning room I noticed that all the tables we undecorated except a few that had small plates with flatware rolled up in paper napkins.  It would have been nice to see some sort of decoration on the tables to follow the theme.  The food was decent I order the Spicy Linguine Seafood Pasta. The seafood was fresh however I felt the dish was unbalance in flavor.  I will return at a later date to try some of the other menu items in hope of finding dishes that are more balanced in flavor. Give it a try!!

What had the makings of an unpleasant evening turned into a very pleasurable dining experience.

First, the positives: 
1) gnocchi in pesto appetizer was awesome
2) food came out piping hot (and not the plate), love it
3) staff/manager came by multiple times after receiving our dinners to check on us
4) really like the well lit dining room including decor
5) wife had spaghetti w/meat sauce - appeared to have dissected a meatball or 2 for the sauce

The negatives:
1) took almost 10 minutes from being seated to having someone stop by the table to take a drink order (I understand busy, but my rule is if someone doesn't at least acknowledge your presence within first 10, roll out, was very close)
2) I had the jambalaya, and while shrimp/chicken were well represented, sausage was non-existent

Overall, will certainly return, too many appetizers to attempt and too little stomach availability on this visit.

Love this place! We've always had good service and love the food. The decor is very eclectic and atmosphere is perfect. I need to come for dinner sometime to try the food but everything we've had from the lunch menu has been great!

My twin and I went there for lunch to try it for the first time. We were really impressed with everything. The place looks really nice n clean n our server, Crystal, was very helpful with the menu. She was very friendly and very efficient. We ordered the beet salad and the famous crispy gnocchi that Crystal recommended and we loved them both. For our entrees I ordered short rib and my twin ordered a rib eye steak. Everything was cooked to perfection. We will definitely be back. We are both in the restaurant industry so we will absolutely tell our friends at work to come check this place out. We were so surprised they weren't busy but maybe because they are new. We will definitely make The Sparklings  our new place to hang out! Thanks Crystal. U rock!!

I came here with girl friends for Sunday lunch. I very was impressed with its chic interior. I love the big chandelier and flowers in middle of dinning room. It really brights up the whole restaurant. Price here is very reasonable! Food is pretty decent. Our waitress was super friendly and helpful. They also have lots selections of wine and beer. The lavender ice tea I ordered was very floral and not sweeten. We had seared scallop, clam linguini, jambalaya, spicy seafood pasta, beet salad. Everything was decent. There was nothing really wowed me, but I am very satisfied with the price I was paying. Sparklings offers happy hours from 5-10pm everyday with 30% off on alcohols. Will I come back? Of course, how can I miss the good deals!

I tried this place a couple days ago thinking it was new, but when I asked to waiter they've been open since last year. The decor was beautiful, the atmosphere was chill, and the food was amazing. The waiter was nice and friendly, but pretty average service. The place was quite empty when we arrived, so we got seated right away.

Me and my friends ordered beers, the sweet potato fries, fried zucchini, bruschetta, and caesar salad as our appetizers. I was a bit irritated that the bruschetta on the menu did not state that it had seafood in it, as one of my friends is severely allergic to seafood. Good thing I tried it before he did, and immediately tasted the crab meat. I suggest they change the menu and put stars next to their seafood products as an indicator, because it only says "cream cheese, avocado, and onion" as the toppings. It was still quite delicious, but my friend was the one who ordered it and couldn't even enjoy it or try it.

As our main course selections I ordered the spicy seafood pasta. It was the perfect amount of spice and the seafood tasted fresh! And I'm usually very picky with how I like my seafood. Two of my friends both ordered the bacon and mushroom pasta, which I tasted. It was also delicious. My other friend had the clam linguini, which he thought was delicious as well, although I didn't try any. 

Overall, I gave 4 stars because the atmosphere and food was really good. I enjoyed it and would come back again. The only reason I docked 1 star was because of the lack of labeling of which appetizers have seafood. If he took a bite of it before I did, we would have ditch that place and make a trip to the ER fast!! Luckily that didn't happen!

Have been here a few times since I live so close! Food is just okay, and prices are a little high. I really enjoy the ambiance and there aren't many people there since it's pretty far out from other places! Their drinks are good and unique!

Went to sparklings again the other day.Their staff is consistently awesome.They are friendly and provide outstanding customer service every time.owner is always there and very friendly and makes it a point to greet everyone as well as wait staff.food is always on point consistently great never any issues.i highly recommend SPARKLINGS!!!!

Chic restaurant + off the strip = Awesome! 

I really like it here. The decor is chic, food is DELICIOUS, service is great, and did I say that the decor was really nice?!

I've had the short rib benedict, portobello fries, & queso dip w/ chips.. all were delicious. 

The prices are a little higher & portion sizes are a little smaller, but the quality of food you get + the ambiance is totally worth it.

I also heard that their happy hour is pretty good, so I plan to check it out one day.

I'll definitely be back =)

Big thanks to Andy and our server/bartender Jason for making my bridal shower so wonderful.  I had a lot of personal items that I wanted to set up and they said no problem.  We had a mimosa bar , rented linens and brought in flower arrangements and the staff even helped us set up.  The food was equally amazing and very reasonable...thanks again !!

-Emily Ren

Ate at the bar solo  . Bar Service was ok not super attentive but i was at the bar which is expected Got the steak Diane special . 5 small filet medallions were pretty good on a bed of mashed potatoes with some green beans . Overall a 3 out of 5 on this specific dish. Heard of this place via friends and on this side of rainbow although I love asian food it's a welcome restaurant among all asian food basically . There was a smell of cleaning supplies or light sewage at the bar area which was not too appeasing . I'll be back to try the Italian dishes on the menu .

The interior and ambiance was amazing. Cozy place to hangout. The menu was very fairly priced with a lot of options. I ordered the chicken caesar and a shrimp pasta, both I was really happy with. Tempura ice cream was great. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 was the timeliness of service. They had a big table with about 20 people so it was understandable that the food took awhile. But even as everyone cleared out and I was waiting for my bill, and then change, I had to ask twice for someone to help me. There were 4 guys cleaning up and no one really knew who was serving my table. They did comp my drink and ice cream for my patience which was unexpected. Over all I am happy with my experience and will be going back.
Great spot! Darnell is wonderful at the bar. Phenomenal place for great food and drinks at a reasonable price and great upscale ambiance!!

Fun fact: owners of Soyo and Oyshi own this joint =) 
which makes the food/experience here even more amazing.....to think that restaurants known for Asian food could make American/Italian inspired food THIS good.


Again, this is spot caught my eyes and stomach once I saw it on Instagram. Came here after a night of shopping and movies with the boyfriend; and since it's right by his house, we stopped in to use up the GCs his family gave us.

You would never expect a shabby chic décorated restaurant in this log cabin exterior. So cute with open space, rustic furniture, romantic lighting, and a chandelier. This restaurant would be great for a first date or date night =)

We got there little past 10pm and the hostess said there was happy hour at the bar/lounge til closing = PERFECT!

We sat at the bar and our bartender, Anthony, was so friendly and great from the start. BF ordered beer and I ordered one (maybe 3 more) of the specialty cocktails that Anthony had recommended.

I can never say no to grilled octopus so that was the immediate choice for me; BF is a sucker for scallops; and our third app, crispy gnocchi, was chosen from its popularity on Yelp reviews. 
Octopus kind of shocked me because it was whole baby octopus. It didn't shock me because of the head or anything (I'm Asian, I've seen that before) but, only cuz I've only seen them served like that at Asian buffets...not nice/cute restaurants like this.
Anyways, the octopus was ok; scallops were superb but, the crispy gnocchi was my fave! Despite my dislike for pesto, this pesto sauce was pretty good...not to pesto(y) and very creamy!

I was quite full from all the apps but, we had to order the spicy seafood pasta and shrimp po'boy. The shrimp from the shrimp po'boy was crispy and had a good batter on it. Spicy seafood pasta was the hit of the night...Just enough kick and spice to my liking. Wish I could bathe in that sauce!

I can not rave enough about this place. Great local business with amazing food and even better workers.
Hoping this local business stays open and I'll be there as often as I can to help it so.

Great restaurant!  Beautiful ambiance and friendly, attentive staff. The turkey cranberry sandwich was incredible, with the savory Brie offset wonderfully by tart cranberries-- absolutely perfect. And their cheesecake was deliciously smooth and creamy.  I will definitely be coming back.

The Sparklings manages a perfect balance between great food, well-crafted (strong) cocktails, fantastic service every time I've been there, and very reasonable prices for what you get. Both the daytime staff and the night time chef and bartenders (thanks Angel!) make the visit special. If you want a memorable lunch, intimate dinner, or fun night drinking, you should go to The Sparklings.

Holy shite!!! We love this place! Crispy gnocchi with Italian sausage and basil pesto, seared scallop with crispy potato ball and light creme sauce and micro greens, Caesar salad, baby back ribs, jambalaya... Refreshingly kick ass. Stellar environment... Relaxed, though somehow sophisticated!  Our new local 2x a month date night. Cheers!
Great food, weird lighting. Servers were friendly. Good place to take a date for 5 star food at a great price point.

First time I saw this place on yelp, I though wow this place has some great ratings. I've been here twice and I can say this place lived up to the hype. The prices on the menu are reasonable and actually on the lower side. I enjoyed the zucchini sticks and also the pulled pork sliders. I had a glass of scotch on the rocks during happy our and it was only around 6bux. The place can get a little awkward because it's just way to quiet. The lighting is a little bright. Make sure that you let your waiter know your gonna be splitting checks because the waiters don't really expect to do it. If your in a large groups make sure to let them know in advance. Other than that, great place for an odd location.

I generally really like this place, so leaving a 3 star review is painful. I came on a Sunday for brunch with 6 other people. We waited about 20 minutes for a table. The restaurant was severely understaffed. Once we were seated, we waited another 15 minutes for any attention. We were not offered brunch menus and had to look them up online. Then we waited another 15 minutes for our drinks to arrive. Overall the food was pretty good, but not stellar. It's been better at this location before.

Great food at unbeatable prices and open until 2am on the weekdays and 4am on the weekends.  Sometimes we go for dinner, sometimes just drinks at the bar. Either way, this is one of my favorite places to go!
Really nice and fun decor. Waiter was great. Gnocchi appetizers was delicious. Had lunch sandwich and it's was very filling. Looking forward to going back!

This place is pretty great. I've loved all their food so far, except for the clam linguini (the sauce was a bit bland) but other than that, can't speak highly enough of this place. The waitstaff is friendly and attentive and you can tell they want you to keep coming back. Their flour-less chocolate cake is super rich and decadent and tastes GREAT with their espresso. Best dessert ever. The atmosphere is really interesting but difficult to describe. The ornate chandelier in the middle of the room turned us off at first, because we assumed it meant the food would be really expensive. Not so! The appetizers, sandwiches and pasta entrees are very reasonably priced. They do have more expensive steaks and things but I'm sure they're top grade and worth the money. (I haven't had their steak yet.) 

It does feel like they haven't quite found their "niche" yet (the type of music they play has changed a few times, the atmosphere is really neat but you can't quite tell what theme they're going for etc.), and while the waitstaff is friendly and attentive, they do feel short-staffed a lot of the time. I think as business continues to pick up, they'll hire more people and it will improve the service. All in all, I will keep coming here and I hope more people discover this place and decide they love it.
Friendly and attentive service! Food was good and cocktails were even better! Try the cucumber French!

1-10-15 - After having a pleasant late afternoon experience with Anthony at the bar, I decided to give it a try at 9:30 on a Saturday night.  The dining room was sparsely populated but the bar was a bit more active.

This is the kind of place you REALLY want to like.  It's beautiful. Great ambiance with the soft jazz music, lively but not loud but this is also the kind of place you expect to see on Gordon Ramsey's show with him yelling at the owners!

The problem... The Sparkings needs to decide what it wants to be and go at it whole hearted!  Why spend the money making something look nice and unique and then have mediocre to bad food?

Tonight i had the scallops. Perfectly cooked again although room temp.  I didn't mind but wished they were hotter.  I also had the truffle fries... truly THE WORST FRIES I have ever had in my life.  They were super dry like freezer burn and thank God the bartender suggested I get all the toppings on the side because they were disgusting.  The normal topping would have been the powdered, green can kind of parmasean, mayo with truffle oil and garlic (all garlic), ranch dressing and ketchup.  Nothing sent together and with bad fries at the base, it was just horrible.

My dining partner had chinese chicken salad, picked at it and said it was really bad.

I was going to order the cheesecake which I know is good (but it is not made on site) but at 11:30Pm they went from Jazz to Techno and that was it for me... and all the other people in the bar except for the six seemingly young gay men in the corner.

They are open until 3am so I asked about that. I was told a lot of service workers stop in to have "great food" and relax after work.  I'm not really sure what "service workers" want after a day of hard work but I'm pretty sure this is not it.

Oh yes... there was still a large table in the dining room at the same time there was a yellow mop bucket on wheels and a mop.  I got a shot of that.
Gordon Ramsey... where are you??? Help this place live up to it's potential!

If it's in business in 3 months I will be a surprise.

If you go, make sure you sit at the bar and ask for Anthony... he's the only real asset.

Owners... take yelp reviews seriously.  It's free advice and you don't have to hire a consultant to figure it out.  Cut your menu in half.  Use fresh ingredients.  have a few signature things.  Raise the prices if you half to.  Just do a few good things right and the crowds will follow.

BTW, a bucket and mop in the dining area during service?  Yuck.

Decided to try this place out after a few friends decided they wanted a late night bite. Wish we hadn't!! To start out, the service was lack luster. The bar was the only part of the restaurant open so I'll cut the bartender some slack considering he was taking care of a lot of people but we had to go to the bar several times to get things like extra lemon or place a food order because he never came back to our table. Onto the food, probably the worst part. I ordered the French onion soup and the calamari. The soup literally looked like someone took a slice of square kraft cheese and melted it onto of a bowl full of salty water. The cheese was barely melted, when it should have had a slightly crispy brownish tint like all normal French onion soups. The calamari was equally as bad, it was soggy and tasted like someone defrosted it in the back and popped it into a microwave. Finally, I ordered the creme brûlée which was awful. The top sugar coat wasn't torched enough so there were a ton of parts that were not crunchy and just sugar sitting on the creme. The creme itself was bland and gross. Overall, I would never recommend this place to anyone. The bad service and disgusting food is plenty reason to avoid his place at all costs.

This is definitely a hidden gem off of the strip.  Finally something hip and upscale and you don't have to deal with tourist.  I would have never expected a place like this from the owners of Oyshi and Soyo. Totally different aura and atmosphere from the others. There's a vintage hipster feel with a nice twist on the music.  Definitely a great place to bring a date or to celebrate a birthday with a group of friends. 

Now on to the important stuff. Food :)
We had an array of appetizers to start and ended up sharing a meal. We started with the langosta bruschetta which was to die for. Bread was perfectly crisp and didn't break into pieces when you bit into it. The added mango was a perfect addition to the topping.  We also had the sea scallops which had a little twist to them. Originally, I thought the entire plate was made up of only scallops but was soon to find out that they added crispy rice which when eaten with the scallop was amazing!   We also had the crispy gnocchi with pesto and walnuts which was also good and the fried zucchini. After trying all of the appetizers we could have skipped the zucchini. It wasn't bad but compared to the others it didn't compare. 

Lastly, we had the spicy seafood spaghetti. I am super picky with Italian food because I grew up with an Italian stepfather who could cook up a storm.  But I was so happy with this dish.  The spicy tomato sauce had a great kick and the taste was perfect to what I am used to. Spaghetti was al dente but I actually like it a little harder (if you know what I mean :). We ended this delicious meal with a perfect ending of creme brûlée. Equally as good as the rest.  

Once the word gets out this place is gonna be crazy! Enjoy it while you can. It's only been open for 5 months.  A must try!
We've heard about this place.. So we thought to try it.. N it was good.. Our server was good .. Appetizers was great....drinks n  all.. Will be back that's for sure...
The best customer service in all of Las Vegas. Be sure to try their spicy spaghetti! Family friendly yet elegant dining experience. I would recommend this place!!! Will be visiting again.

I wish I would've known about this place before!!
We went in for my friends birthday on Wednesday, it was a group of 15. We took the big table at the bar and bartender Rey and Angel took care of us. We were all having a good time, from our initial greeting when we walked in to us leaving out the door, perfect service! The food is delicious, we all did buffet style so we all had a lil bit of everything and not one of us was disssapointed. I mean, when u have great service and great food, u automatically have a great time!! Our bartenders were friendly, on top of everything, making sure we didn't need anything, they were super attentive! I will be telling all my friends about this restaurant! It's a must that u go check it out! Amazing experience!!
Grate plays the is grate totally recommend that plays to anyone that likes to celebrate there birthday or Other things there bar is awesome...................

I cannot remember the last time I've had such terrible service and been in such a dirty restaurant. Had I nut been with a large group, I would have walked out. To begin, it took 45 minutes to receive a glass of water. It look 3 hours for dinner. Then to my horror, I visited the restroom. Disgusting!  The floor had obviously not been cleaned in a long time.

Had the brown sugar gnocchi and chicken parm and it was amazing!! The restaurant is super cute and great place for date night or a lot of friends. Great service as well. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because 1. Wasn't overly impressed with my house special cocktail or the drink selection (especially for a "barstraunt" 2. My bf has wasn't impressed with his dinner (i believe he got shrimp alfredo?).  He said it wasn't the worst he had but hes def had better.  He also was disappointed that they didn't serve bread.

We came here to meet up with our Vegas peeps who are regulars here. Right when we entered through the door, we were greeted by the staff. We made our way to the bar and ordered the Moscow Mule. It was delicious and came in a cute copper mug. The bartender was attentive. We also ordered meatball marinara, fried portobello mushrooms, and flatbread with grapes and cheese from the happy hour menu; all were delicious. I would come back for drinks, food, and service.

Service is excellent 

Ambiance is excellent 

Food is mediocre 

I ordered the filet mignon, it was a very poor cut of meat. Lots of fat and veins throughout. It wasn't seasoned well and the veggies that came with the steak were soggy and salty. 

I would go for happy hour drinks and appetizers but stay away from the entrees. At least the filet.

The atmosphere was inviting and sophisticated. We were greeted by Jason and he truly was an entertaining and kind waiter. He brought a lively vibe to our dining experience and was eager to help us celebrate a big event for our group. He guided us through the menu with expertise and thoughtful descriptions that held true to taste. 
The drinks we enjoyed was 1)Amethyst 2) Emerald 3) Sparkling
They were each delicious but our favorite was the emerald. 
For the appetizer we enjoyed the scallops and the crispy gnocchi. Both were delightful and will be ordered again. 
For entrées we ordered the spicy seafood pasta, the clam linguini and the mushroom bacon cream sauce pasta with chicken. 
The spicy seafood pasta was indeed spicy but not overwhelmingly so. I am sensitive to very spicy things. 6/10 for spicy but it was very flavorful and will be ordered again. 
The clam linguini was Good but not spectacular as the other dishes. 
The mushroom bacon cream pasta was delicious.  

The most enjoyable item we ordered was the crispy gnocchi but the whole meal was a delight.

Finally gave this place another chance and it was good. 

Came in around noon so it wasn't busy at all. The waiters were all very friendly. 

We ordered the Truffle Parmesan Garlic Fries (3/5). I have had better truffle parm garlic fries and there was nothing too special about these ones. The lemon dipping sauce was yummy though. 

My hubby ordered the Spaghetti Aglio E Olio (3/5). I give it a 3 only because it was something different for me and I just wasn't used to only having olive oil and garlic on my spaghetti. I like my pastas with a lot of saucy tomato-y or creamy flavor. But I would give it a try again. 

I ordered the Clam Linguine (4/5). I liked how they used real clams and not canned clams, it tastes so much better of course. The white wine sauce was really yummy and they gave a portion that was just right. 

Overall I think this place is really cute especially for big groups. The prices are reasonable and the service was good. Definitely coming back here again.

I'm sorry but this was not even close to my favorite. Today was the first time my family being there and was very disappointing. My daughter ordered kids meal chicken fingers with fries and the chicken was tough & dry. She didn't even finished both of the chicken. I ordered Philly cheese sandwich which barely any meat inside & just too thick of bread. My son ordered 4 sliders that cost us $15. My husband said with his meal was OK but nothing special about it. Although the service was alright.  Paid too much money for unsatisfied meal.

I have been wanting to try this place definitely a hidden gem. Such a cute date spot with wonderful food and service. We had our date night here and tried a variety of appetizers and seafood pasta and everything we ordered had a lot of flavor I will definitely come again

Sparkling's is a fancy shmancy place.  I went here with a few friends for happy hour and we felt out of place right away.  We ordered a few appetizers and drinks so this review is not for any dinner items.  For a place to go to and have a few drinks and good cheap food, Sparkling's is not the spot.  The appetizers were just okay and nothing to rave about.  They were also quite expensive because appetizers were not discounted during happy hour - just drinks.  However, it definitely seems like it is the spot to take your date to - an intimate and fancy setting.
Love this place. We end up going a few times a month. Good food, good and friendly Servace

We came here for a birthday and I was honestly really disappointed with their food and customer service. When we were at the bar it took a solid 15 minutes to get the servers attention for our order. When he finally came over to help they were out of what my BF tried to order and when I went to order they informed me they couldn't make my drink either because they don't make drinks with egg whites (no problem) but he just walked away instead of offering an alternative. When it came to trying to order again after figuring out what they did have that I wanted it took another few minutes to get his attention. We left the bar to a table and when the whole party was ready to order we started with a few appetizers. My BF and his friend ordered the Irish nachos, they were terrible! Imagine stale corn chips with cheese sauce and dry small slices of corned beef. The worst part was that there was barely any cheese sauce to cover the chips. They sat practically untouched until our main course came. The half chicken came with a wing, drumstick and thigh. Hardly a half chicken in my eyes but after digging in that was not the worst part. The chicken was extremely dry and hard to eat because the bones were still in it but it was drenched in a very salty sauce. When it's drenched in sauce and super dry there a problem. I would have sent it back but it took long enough as it was to get our food and it was a big party. I suggest not offering bones in your meals if you're serving it like a typical dish in a bowl drenched in sauce. We won't be back.

The bar teander\waiter was great. Funny and knowledgable. I orderd a cucumber french and was really pleased. It reminded me of this great cocktail at The Westin. We ate bacon date meatballs, capresse salad, sea diver scallops and crispy gnocchi. Every thing we ate was awesome!!!

I've heard nothing but good things about this place so I finally decided to try it for myself. Can't believe I haven't been here sooner since my friend lives literally down the street

Let's start with the food. For appetizers I had the truffle fries, crab spinach dip with pita bread (fried and grilled), and the pesto gnocchi-- all appetizers are a 5/5 rating because they were super delicious! For my meal- my sister and I got the spicy seafood pasta (5/5 rating) with average spice level and it was the perfect spice-- not too light of a spice and it wasn't over the top spice. My sisters boyfriend got the ribeye steak which looked delicious but he said it may have been a little too "fatty" for him.. I didn't taste it so I'm not going to rate it but it looked good to me!

The decor in the restaurant was nice and not what I expected. I almost felt under-dressed walking into here with my leggings and slippers.

The customer service was on point! She was on it with recommendations and checked up on us regularly. 

I will DEFINITELY be back because there was so much more I wanted to try.... like the crab and shrimp ravioli. OH and they do brunch EVERYDAY until 3PM. I gotta try their brunch for sure!! This restaurant definitely did not disappoint me.

This place is like a hidden gem on the SW part of town. I mostly come here at night and sit at the bar. The place is classy fancy but you can still come in casual clothes and not feel out of place. Great place for a fancy night out too. And the happy hour is great 5-10 30% off ALL alcohol and then starts back at midnight till close. 

The food is fancy and very good, kind of pricey but totally worth it! I am eating lunch here for the first time right now and so far so good. I actually discovered they have a more reasonably priced brunch menu (sat-sun) and lunch menu Monday through Friday. 

They also have a patio area with a lot of space and half of the bar is outside too. 

They have a very wide selection of liquor and wines. I will say that the portions could be bigger for the price of the food and the service can be a bit slow but it is worth it when you get a delicious drink and wonderful food!

Quality of ambience and food for this price point??!!! A win-win for the Southwest part of LV! Phenomenal! I had a few appetizers- all incredible, and happy hour beverages. Prices are super reasonable, service was excellent, and the atmosphere/vibe in this restaurant are exquisite! I'll definitely be back!

Went there on date night with the wifey place is nicely set up & clean. We were seated immediately and the waitress came right away. We ordered the tuna tartar which tasted really good but the avocados were hard. Also had the fries which we both didn't taste the truffle.
Entrees I had the steak Diane menu says its fillet but it's not! At least what I got wasn't fillet. The sauce/gravy was a salty as per the other reviews. I don't think I would order that if I were to go here again. Also had the salmon which was really good the rice it came with was really good. I asked for the lemon sauce on the side which was a smart idea. We then got the trio dessert the flourless cake was hard and looked & tasted like a brownie. The creme burle was pretty good not the best I've had but not the worst. Ice cream was good. The service was good and prompt except for our app dishes weren't removed before the main courses came out.

Great local spot. Happy hour in the bar from 5-10pm everyday, so that is a plus. The food is very good, the menu is not too large, but diverse, and the prices are great for the quality. I love their clam chowder, and the turkey, cranberry and brie sandwich is absolutely delicious.  It is great to see places like this opening up in the Mountain's Edge area.

I can't trust Yelp anymore, it's profound how this establishment received 4 stars for their disgusting dishes and glacial-paced service. We ordered scallops which were overcooked and served with this bland fried rice cake. Next was the brown butter gnocchi which tasted almost bland with a hint of bathroom freshener and had the texture of a semi-softened laffytaffy with a crunch in the beginning. The truffle fries were decent, nothing impressive. Tasted like store bought frozen fries. The spaghetti aglio e olio tasted like a cardboard with a hint of garlic. The rice au gratin with chicken tasted like trash. Disgusting. Honestly, I would've been better off making myself some pasta roni and rice a roni. Super slow service, there were barely any people there. If I could give it negative stars I would. I don't know what's wrong with all of your tastebuds lol

I feel sort of obligated to give them 5 stars, why... because they're just that awesome! Upon walking in, you will notice the amazing decor. Ambiance really made me give this place 5 stars, it is so beautiful I think they may have even hired a design team. White furniture, with pistachio green cushions. The chandelier is the focal point of the restaurant and gives it the restaurant's name sake "The Sparklings."  I came on a Wednesday during lunch and it was totally empty. I guess this is more of a dinner spot, but surprisingly the server said they are kind of busy on the weekends, but not so much. Sort of surprising considering how amazing this place is. So definitely people give them your business! Now on to the food, to start our meal we ordered the seafood bruschetta, so delicious! Loved it and the drizzle of pesto sauce made the dish look even more appetizing. For my main entree I had the jambalaya, something I've never had before. It was pretty good, but I was expecting a little bit more spice and flavor to it. To me it just tasted like chicken, seafood and tomato paste mixed with white rice.  I think it was definitely missing something but I can't exactly put my finger on since it was my first time having it. I think maybe it needed a garnish of scallions on top and the dish itself could of used more garlic? It was only $13 which is very reasonable for me because it was the perfect portion size. All the prices here are very affordable, the most expensive thing is the filet mignon at $25, which I consider almost robbery. My friend had the beat salad which he enjoyed very much. We shared the cheesecake as our dessert, this was totally store bought cheesecake and the server even admitted it not being made on site. I wish they had more dessert options, but the flour-less cake sounded good, I might have to order that next time. As Daniel T. mentioned it might be better to order 2 or 3 appetizers rather than an entree because the appetizers are all mouth watering.

My family decided to come here for my birthday dinner. The atmosphere was charming and unique, and the food was all really delicious. We shared the truffle fries for the appetizer, which were absolutely perfect. I've had truffle fries at a few other places, but these were by far the best. For the main course, I had the Steak Diane... wow! The brandy demi-glace was incredible. Perfectly arranged flavors. My partner had the jambalaya, which was very good, but according to him, the flavors seemed to settle to the bottom of the plate, so it was a bit bland until he got to the saucy bits at the bottom. He still enjoyed it. We had the dessert sampler at the end, and enjoyed everything. The standout was the in-season fruit sorbet, however, which was mango that day. It was perfect. I am looking forward to coming back to try some of the other tantalizing dishes here. I give it five stars because the quality of the food and the experience we had was remarkable for the price point. Skip the big familiar "high-end" chains and come here instead. It's worth it!

What an amazing experience! I got the honors in hosting my cousins Gender Reveal Dinner here and the staff was fabulous! From waking into the door... From leaving. 

Customer services was on point. I felt like our party (16 adults & 12 kids) was the only one in the restaurant. They were on top of everything. 

The food was amazing!!! Omg soooo yummy!!!! Everyone enjoyed them-self. 

It was a perfect place to announce that she was having a baby girl! 

This restaurant is great for all events. From taking someone out to dinner or a group of Buddy's drinking at the bar. 

The owner was very nice. My severs were amazing!!!! I totally recommend this restaurant!

We had the bacon wrapped meatballs, portabella french fries, and club sandwich. We would rate all items a 4 out of 5...and our waiter was great. We Came based off the Yelp review and we agree with the overall rating of this restaurant.
Good food, great ambiance and service, bit hard to find but worth the trip

Really disappointing experience at this restaurant. I visited recently with a group of my girlfriends for brunch, and we were a large group of 20 girls. As soon as I walked into the restaurant I was super excited, the ambiance was fantastic and the menu looked amazing. However I was quickly disappointed by the service and the lack of cleanliness of the bathrooms. 

We started our really good and quickly got water, but I soon found myself out of water and stealing other waters from empty seats. I went through three water glasses and not once did anyone refill or even offer to refer my glass. We had pitchers on our tables but they quickly ran out of water too. 

On top of that, it took them an hour to get my food either because the waitress forgot to put in the order or the chef forgot to make it, I'm not sure which one it was. I ordered chicken and waffles and a pineapple juice as soon as I sat down, and with the rest of the group as they ordered, and it wasn't until the rest of my group had had their food and basically finished it that the waitress asked me what I ordered. I never got my pineapple juice but I did get my chicken and waffles. I had to get it to go because I was on a time crunch, and the waitress was nice enough to comp it, but it really didn't make up for it. 

On top of that the bathrooms were disgusting. Water and liquids everywhere, soggy paper towels on the ground and rags sitting around in the stalls and on the sink. I started gagging as soon as I walked in and I held my breath the entire time I was in there. I honestly could not believe how horrible it was, especially for a restaurant that is more upscale than most. 

Overall it was a horrible experience. I will not be back and I will not recommend this spot for any future brunches going forward. Avoid at all costs!

Ive been here quite a few times, I want to love it but I just feel like it's too expensive for what you get. I've ordered so many things off the menu, I like their drinks, but food wise...MEH. I love their indoor decor, but every single time I've gone, there are only 1 or 2 tables with other customers, I feel there is a lack of ambiance, too quiet, too empty

My dad took me to this place and I have to say I was super freaked out as we pulled up to the building! The name made me think of a strip club and it's by no other real business. I was extremely surprised when I walked inside. The decor is amazing and a great place to take large groups of people. The drinks are super cheap and so is the food! I ordered the shrimp fettuccini and it was good. They don't seem to get a lot of business but It's solely because they're new, poor choice of names and the location doesn't get much traffic. But it's definitely a place I'd recommend going. The service is also really good!
a beautiful place to have brunch lunch and dinner* :) lil far but it worth?priz r ok too*

Gorgeous and comfortable with a clean look. Good craft beer selection. The bacon wrapped date meatballs were delicious! For dinner we got the cajun shrimp and chicken pasta, shrimp po boy, braised short ribs, and rice au gratin with chicken. It was all soooo good! For dessert we had the flourless chocolate cake and the cheesecake. The flourless chocolate cake was rich and decadent, my only complaint is I wish there was more. The cheesecake was a good size slice but a little soft for our preference. We will definitely go back again and again.
Best hidden secret!! Great food & prices!! Nice relaxing atmosphere. Staff is awesome!!!

I came here a few days ago with my boyfriend around 9pm. We had to wait a little to be seated, as there was no staff on the floor when we walked in. Our server was so nice, but the pace and order of our meal wasn't the greatest. Our apps came out promptly followed by our mains almost immediately. The only problem was we ordered drinks that weren't delivered until all of our food had come. There was a large birthday party going on, so maybe that's why service was off. The food was good, it may be a nice place to grab drinks and small plates. Am glad I tried it, but will probably not go back.

I ordered solely based on the pictures posted here so wound up ordering the truffle Parmesan fries and spicy seafood pasta. It was a lot of starch and carbs, but I don't regret it. 
The waitstaff was amazing- very friendly and accommodating. I was warned when I ordered the spicy seafood pasta that the heat is about a 6 or 7 out of 10, but they can make a milder version. I'm really happy I was warned in advance- I think the mild version had the perfect amount of spice. 
The food was really good- I think there's room for improvement (I wasn't the biggest fan of the calamari in the pasta) however the friendly staff, price point and solid dishes make it worth trying out.

I will definitely be back to try more of the menu (maybe I'll be able to work in a vegetable next time).
Cute spot and beautiful Decor. Wish there were some better entrees on the menu but great for tapas/small plates. Always easy to get a table. Much-needed spot in the Southwest.

Another great restaurant by this group! Had the bacon wrapped date meatballs, truffle oil fries, Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta, and rice au gratin with chicken. Usually get an order of the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta to go. Everything was so delicious! Love Oyshi, Soyo, and now this place. The decor feels so elegant and the location is very convenient. Have had a few birthday dinners here and this restaurant was an accommodating perfect setting. Staff is great and very helpful. The manager is engaging and really does his job well. Always a pleasure eating here! There are a few new dishes added to the menu and I can't wait to try! 

Tried a few of the new dishes. Tried the smoke salmon crostini and the langosta bruschetta for appetizers. Both were pleasant. For the main courses I had BBQ baby back ribs and the basil sausage linguini. The meat on the ribs just fell off the bone, so tender. The basil linguini has great flavors, but also has a rich heavy cream kick that is dense. Was happy to see this place was packed! As always, a great dinning experience.

I love love love Italian and I love love love seafood. So this place combines the two things I enjoy the most. The bar also has a great Moscow mule, which I highly recommend you get right away as you wait for your party to arrive or the rest of the table to determine what they want to eat. 

To start, we ordered the scallops and bruschetta. Both were tasty.  However, I would say the scallops were a bit small from what I am used to. But, the price was fair. It is a decent amount to share between two people. I got the clam chowder. It is not the best, but not the worst. it was an okay bowl of chowder. The soup was creamy and had a decent amount of clams in it. However, nothing beats the chowder you get in San Francisco! But it was worth a taste. 

My friend and I shared a pasta carbonara with the noodles cooked well and extra sauce on the side. It was a big plate that was more than enough to share. It was so big, we still had some leftover! The pasta was cooked well. The bacon on top was delicious. The sauce was creamy and rich like it should be. I recommend getting this for sure if you plan on going. 

This is a classier place that is just off the strip. The drive is a bit far since it is deep in the southwest area of Las Vegas just 8 minutes before you actually hit Blue Diamond. The servers were nice, but it's hard to find a place that does not treat you well in Las Vegas.The drinks are reasonable for the type of dining experience. The seafood tasted fresh and was cooked well. The noise level was okay. When we went it was not busy at all, but I would still make a reservation, especially on the weekends. 

Overall, I give the experience a four and will for sure come back again.

I stopped in with a small group of friends to order a variety of small items, including drinks, for our pre-dinner activity. I was craving wings, so I ordered their Grilled Ginger Soy wings, in addition to the fried calamari, bacon wrapped meatballs, zucchini sticks, and steak salad my friends ordered. 

When you order a variety of items, there is bound to be some hit and misses, as I experience here. For example, the ginger soy wings tasted quite good, but I could not get over the fact how tiny them wings were. I had to struggle to find chewable meat on them bones. I am not kidding, I worked those bones substance, but good thing the flavor was there. 

The fried calamari was good. It was lightly fried and breaded. The calamari inside was tender and sweet as it should be. Well done. The bacon wrapped meatballs were okay. I liked the marinara they came in because it had a good balance between acidity and sweetness, but the meatball itself was to, how would I put it, mushy I guess. It needed texture and density. The flavor was good, and so was the bacon it came wrapped in but, it was almost as if it had to much moisture in it. 

The fried zucchini stick were pretty good, although they did exhibit a water inside of them, which leads me to believe they "may" have been previously frozen. They tasted good and had a nice crunch, but I could literally squeeze them and watch the water drain from them. 

Service was very good and quite attentive. This place no doubt has potential, and perhaps it's already there, but I would refine some of the items I had on this visit. More importantly, some plumper wings would be much appreciated.
This place is right by my daughter dance studio so we've stopped in a couple times for dinner. We Love the atmosphere and the great service. The Salmon entree is a must! Very delicious

I hope the owner reads the good reviews too, and not just the bad ones lol.
I don't understand why this place isn't busier. I've only eaten here once, but my fiance and I frequent the pho restaurant next door and the parking lot seems to always be empty here..

Myself, my fiance, and a friend strolled in around 5pm one a weekday and were literally the only people in the place. (At first I thought they were only open for dinner and had just opened, but then noticed they are actually open for lunch as well.)

We sat in the dining room, which is beautiful!! Very classy and inviting. Our server (who was also the bartender) was very attentive and accommodating. After we came in, she had 5 other tables consecutively come in (sitting in the dining room and bar area) and she handled it beautifully, without neglecting us in the process. I'm a bartender also, and for her to handle all that on her own without being in the weeds is pretty impressive. Especially since there was no food runner. 

Our friend ordered ribs with mashed potatoes, corn bread (I think) and veggies. Fiance had spicy seafood pasta. They both loved what they had. 

I love this place because the menu is huge!! I'm a vegetarian, so I'm used to maybe having 3 options to choose from, one of which is a salad, and the other two being a meat dish that I have to modify. Not the case here!!
