SOOO many options it was hard to decide. I went with the cucumber salad and a vegetable quesadilla without the tortilla. Salad was fresh and delicious. Since I ordered the veggie quesadilla without the tortilla, I just expected a bowl of vegetables with some shredded cheese thrown in (which would have been fine), but the chef loaded it with cheese, I guarantee gave me more veggies than would have come in it the regular way, and baked the whole dish. It was AMAZING. The fact that it was automatically made that way without me asking was even better. And... IT'S CHEAP!! You wouldn't guess it based on the decor, but it is very reasonably priced. We live down the street and will DEFINITELY be returning to try more stuff. I have recommended it to all my industry people to hopefully get them some more business!

Great service , great food, great people.
Try the meatballs, they are great.
The design of the place is orginal and very pleasant.
Best service I've ever had in any restaurant maybe ever, and more importantly most of the food is really really good

The restaurant is very unique which was pretty interesting. 

To start of the BF and I ordered the seared scallop which was very crispy and tender. For our entree I ordered the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta and the BF ordered the spicy seafood pasta. As the waiter suggested, he ordered it mild spicy because the level of spice is between 6-10. (If you're not that into spicy food I suggest to have it mild spicy). 

Over all my experience was great and so was the food!

Back again this time with my friend gabe our servicer was angel, angel is by far the best servicer I have ever had in my life he goes beyond my expectations,  for an appetizer I had Irish nacho every bite was overwhelmingly delicious , then for the main course I had shepherd's pie the taste of the pie was fabulous!!! probably the best shepherd's pie I have ever had if I could I would give this place 10 stats
I can't say enough good about this place!  Just shut up and go!  Everything you want is here... From service, to quality, to ambiance, to price.  You can't lose.

What a diamond in the rough. You would not suspect the beauty of this dining room from the exterior. The velvet chairs, beautiful chandelier, and swanky atmosphere are lovely. 

The service was excellent. We got everything we needed without missing a beat. This was impressive with 3 toddlers in the group. 

Aside from a lovely room and great service, the food delightful and quite a value! Hubby and I shared clam chowder, scallops with crispy rice cakes and lemon buerre blanc, linguini and clams, and crispy gnocchi. We also got a side of fries and a beer. All for under $50! The gnocchi was creamy and delicious. A healthy portion for the $9 price. The scallops were good but nothing special. The sauce lacked the citrusy zing I was hoping for. Chowder was good with light airy crispy bread to dip. Linguini and clams was a winner. Flavorful and al dente. There was so much more I wanted to try! We will definitely go back. 

This would be a great place to entertain guests. Impressive and affordable.

Opposite of its exterior which sort of looks like a deserted ranch house, The Sparklings encompasses a beautiful interior with velvet blue tufted seats, pristine tables, and a beautiful chandelier hanging from the ceiling. The restaurant also exhibits a bunch of vibrant, pink and fuchsia flowers in the center of the restaurant, where we were lucky enough to sit near.

Food was solid. 

Great restaurant off the strip.

This place had a really nice casual feel from the moment I walked in the restaurant.  Our server was really nice and friendly and there were a variety of food and drinks avaliable on the menu to satisfy anyone's cravings.

I went with the rib-eye steak and truffle fries and it did not dissapoint.

Highly recommend for anyone in the Vegas area, or even tourists like me to try out during their trip.

I came across this restaurants by looking up under rated Las Vegas restaurants because I was tired of waiting in long lines for over priced food. The Sparklings is a great restaurant if you are willing to get away from the strip for some reasonably priced good food. They are an American bistro that makes a mean pasta and a delicious cocktail. My family really enjoyed this restaurant especially compared to our previous dining experiences in Vegas. Appetizers were a little small hard to share with 11 unless you order 2 of each. The crispy gnocchi had great flavor in the sauce but I felt like the texture was just like normal gnooci nothing crispy about it. Portions of entrees are fairly large. I had a hard time finishing my spicy seafood pasta which was delicious. The Cajun pasta and bacon mushroom cream pasta were also great. In the end they gave me and my family complementary cheese cake to help celebrate me and my cousins birthday! Once again super glad we got to escape the chaos that is the Vegas strip and got to celebrate in a more intimate place with good food that didn't break the bank! Will recommend all friends who go to Vegas to come here in the future!

Their food, desserts, drinks, everything is so good. The place is set up nice and comfortable. There's a bar. Their prices are reasonable but I feel like their menu could expand. I still love this place!

Went here last year with our neighbor friend so when we got to the house from OC, we decided to go here so friends could try it.
For drinks we ordered chandelier, margarita and some drink I forgot the name lol.  Everything was excellent.
For appetizers, the portobello mushrooms (good but a little salty) and calamari (very bland).  
For entrées sausage pesto linguine, clam pasta, steak Diane and lasagna.  Tasted all the dishes and everything was very good.
This restaurant is very close to the house, I'm sure we will be back here.

Came during Happy Hour, which is 30% off alcohol only. Wished they had it on appetizers as well.

I had the calamari, crunchy gnocchi, and portobello fries. Out of all three I have to say that the portobello fries was the clear winner. The calamari was good but was just your plain ol' calamari. I was expecting the crunchy gnocchi to be a little more crunchy but I didn't know what gnocchi was to begin with. I guess the crunchy part was the walnuts but I may be mistaken. 

The service was good and they made our food pretty fast. The ambiance was extremely nice especially the bar. Bathroom was a bit dirty. Comfy chairs and a lot of space. Overall 3/5.

Hide something with meat in it and I wasn't sure if it was donkey or dog. That may be an interesting delicacy in certain countries not in America. I was a palled at the service there wasn't any kindness shown and it was very hard to tip the waitress but I knew she needed the money because she wasn't being paid well

Intresting experience last night at the Sparkling. Join a group of 5 people and seat at the both next to the bar. Ordered a negroni. The carte was extensive and after saying, i am looking for something VEGAN. The servet bartender point me at couple suggestions, no main dishes but I went for the pasta with olive oil and garlic. Food arrived to the table. Evetything look good, mothing special and exciting but fresh and everybody was happy. My pasta was absolutly delicious and i even say " that wasv he best pasta I ever ate.". The sauce was pretty thick and i had hard time to believe it was not butter. One of my friend said: if this is good, its because of the butter. Then I adked the server who vonfirm it was no butter, just olive oil, but went to check with the chef to make sure. Came back to the table and redescribe tge pasta : they are made with Extra virgin oil, garlic, white wine, and CHIKEN STOCK.  You must see my face and the good laught of my friends. To be honest I was not even angry, it was so big and laughable... I said, thats good, at least there is no butter.  Price are good to. When we went out, everybody had the same reflection about the lighting. The lighting is Horible ! Please hire a professionel to adap the apropriate watts dosage for your restaurant.
Overhall, the food was descent, service ok and modetate price. Not sure if I will come back since there is nothing special who will make come back. It deserve a 3 1/2 stars.

5 stars for the service itself! Joey was a phenomenal waiter. We had a party of 18 and he was able to take our order & serve us in a timely manner! I ordered the crab spinach dip & chicken wings as appetizers then the chicken Marsala for the main dish. I wasn't blown away by the food, however being that it was happy hour definitely made up for it. Cute decor, dim lighting. Good for date nights! I'd definitely come back again for brunch!

This place is really good! Like others have said, the decor is awesome. The chandelier is beautiful. Went tonight with my parents and husband. The restaurant wasn't full at all. Our waiter, Jason, was great. He was very personable and attentive. The food was good. We got the bacon & dates wrapped meatballs, gorgonzola flatbread with honey, and seared diver scallops appetizers. The flatbread was not crispy, it was chewy, and a little on the oily side. It wasn't bad, just not what we were expecting. Our entrees were the cajun chicken and shrimp pasta, jambalaya, spicy seafood pasta, and pan-seared atlantic salmon. They were all very tasty. No complaints. Definitely coming back.

This place was amazing! I came to Vegas for a work trip and to say I was ballin' on a budget would be an understatement! I came here with a couple of friends who had been here before. This place was amazing! I'm staying at the MGM and so I was spending a ton of money on food prior to this restaurant. It's a bit further from the strip but totally worth it! I started off the Zucchini sticks -- amazing!! For my meal I got the turkey and cranberry sandwich, also amazing! Even took half home for lunch tomorrow and for dessert I got the creme brûlée it hit the spot! I also had the Voo doo cocktail. Deep Eddy Grapefruit Vodka and muddle raspberries -- so good! I was extremely satisfied with this! It had a quite little ambiance, you felt fancy but you weren't breaking the bank! I didn't catch our server but he was amazing as well!! If I'm ever back in Vegas, I will definitely go back to the Sparkling!!

Wow! First visit was great so we had friends in from Oklahoma and decided to take them to a late lunch. I ordered the salmon entree and it was Amazing!!!! My husband went for pasta again but opted for the bacon cream sauce spaghetti this time. He loved every bite! Our friends ordered a chicken rice au gratin and a turkey cranberry sandwich!  The loved their choices as well and are lamenting the fact they can't eat here all the time. They even asked if we'd bring them here for every mesl until they leave! Thanks again Clayton for great service. Thank you kitchen staff and the chef for delivering such great food!

Atmosphere is AMAZING, food is even more amazing! Absolutely loved it and are so happy we came to try it being there's not many great options in the southwest! We had the crab and spinach dip, Italian sausage and pesto linguini, and my husbanded opted for the pork chops, all which were so good I could have licked the plate had we made it at home! My only complaint and the only thing lacking was the service. Our server was extremely nice however we hardly saw him and the restaurant wasn't that busy. I felt like we spent more time waiting for our check than we did actually eating our appetizers and meals, and while we were eating no one ever came and asked if we were okay or needing anything. And for that we had to waste half of our crab and spinach dip due to not being able to ask for chips or more bread to dip in it. All in all we will definitely be back, but will definitely hope for more table attention!

This place was really nice. I went for my birthday and it was well worth it. They keep late hours til 3am. The bacon & date wrapped meatballs were heaven. I also enjoyed my house salad it was the perfect blend of sweet and tangy. My chicken Marsala was good it was moist and very flavorful. Also if u get a chance try their Truffle fries.

The Sparklings can be a great after work upscale bar or a great place to meet friends for dinner and drinks.   There dishes are both elevated and comfortable.  Extremely well priced and friendly place to visit.  Highly recommended.
Reply great food at very reasonable prices.  Pretty much everything on the menu is tasty. Absolutely one of the best places to eat in southwest.

This a great place for brunch.  Lots of interesting options from comfort foods to fancier dishes.  The bottomless mimosas are always a good choice. They had a big long table for our large group readily available which was nice.  I'd been here before and while it isn't yet one of my favorite spots in town it is climbing the list.

We were craving American and this was the highest reviewed restaurant around the area. The decor seems nice: lots of lighting, modern, clean, nice and roomy. Service was actually superb despite what the negative review said. We were constantly checked and the staff were extremely cordial. I ordered the spicy seafood pasta and my friend ordered the herb roasted chicken, as appetizers we also got the plate of cheese and fried zucchini. The menu looked delicious, but it's one of those restaurants that the food looked better than it tastes. I'm not sure why, but it definitely lacked that "umami" better tasting places offer. I don't want to give a such bad review, but while the food wasn't complete garbage, it was mediocre at best.

To top it off, my friend also had SEVERE food poisoning about 12 hours afterwards. I'm in the medical field and checked my resources with all facts pointing in the direction of food poisoning. We ate around 10 and the symptoms started the next morning around 10, with multiple bouts of diarrhea and vomiting. Actually, it reminded me of this family guy episode where they were trying to see who can drink the most ipecac, which of course resulted in everyone throwing up on top of each other. The episode was hilarious, but unfortunately it cannot be said for real life. Nothing was consumed hours before or after the meal, and there were no other culprits. We're not entirely sure but it seems all signs point to the chicken, which was possibly badly handled during the cooking.

In the end, we were both pretty disappointed at our visit. We should have stuck with one of our regulars. Needless to say, we definitely won't be coming back.

Everything about this place was amazing! The ambience was really cute and it's perfect for huge groups. But the food was so good!! The quality was just as good as the restaurants in the strip. Definitely will come back!

The first time i went here was for my birthday. Although the restaurant was quiet empty the host gave us an option to sit in the bar area since we had a party of 14 people and he said it would be faster service if we sat there. Reluctantly we agreed to sit there.  The ambience was amazing, i loved the decor. However the food was nothing but average and the service was still terrible even though there were barely any people. 
The second time was more recently. I solely decided to go back because i love the ambience. upon entering we saw the restaurant was completely empty on a friday night. We sat in the dinning area. With just one server managing the bar area and the dining area needless to say the service yet again was terrible. 
My boyfriend ordered a quesadilla without the chicken ( we confirmed the order to ensure there were no errors due to him being a strict vegetarian)  and I ordered mashed potatoes and club sandwich. The mashed potatoes were good but just a bit dry. The club sandwich was just terrible and to top it off they gave us chicken in the quesadilla . Unknowingly my boyfriend who is a vegetarian ate a whole piece before we saw a piece of chicken in the quesadilla. We waited a good 10 minuets before we went upto the owner who was fixing the door and asked him to send the server. The server was busy at the bar area and came over 10 minuets later, by this time we were just sitting waiting and the food was completely cold. The server apologized and rushed to the kitchen and said they messed it up. He then brought out a veggie quesadilla and that was it. No apologies by the owner, nothing was taken off our check, no words were exchanged we just paid and left. I was highly disappointed that they did not even understand the extent of disappointment they caused for someone who has been a vegetarian their whole life.
Never going back again.

Very interesting and unique restaurant. It was not at all what I expected from the decor and style, in a great way! The restaurant boasts an interesting menu with a wide variety of choices for the epicurean connoisseur, while also appeasing those who prefer a more basic plate.

We visited twice since finding this hidden gem, and both times the food was fantastic, fresh, and flavorful. The staff was very attentive and helped to explain some of the more unique dishes on their menu. 

Go here, eat things, you are going to love it.

I agree with some of the other comments.  Food was pretty good, but they go overboard on the service.  Our waiter and management made too many visits to our table.  Kind of annoying.  Its a tad stuffy in there for a neighborhood joint.  I think the décor and the low noise level will do that.  Oh and add a burger to the menu.  What's an American eatery without a great burger?  Overall its a great place.  Will def go back.

Sat at the bar, the bartender was awesome. They also had 30% off drinks for happy hour. We had wine before our meal. I had the salmon, he had the steak diane. Both meals were really good. Wasn't as crowded for being a Friday night, which was cool. And the atmosphere was really relaxing, cute place.
Have been here twice and the food did not disappoint.  The service is pretty slow (even though no one was in there) but they were super friendly and accommodating. Highly suggest!

Love this place! Can't say enough great things about it. My friends and I had excellent service, drinks, food, and fun! The decor is gorgeous. Can't wait to come back and enjoy their happy hour. The bar looks like a great place to relax and converse with friends. 

I highly recommend the emerald drink. Yum!

I love this place! Good good at a reasonable price! Nice atmosphere. They menu is pretty big and lots to choose from. It is a nice, cozy neighborhood place for hangout and try some good food at the same time.

Ate here last night and it was great! My brother in law had the octopus appetizer and said he loved it. My sister had the French onion soup and she liked it and I had the filet mignon and it was absolutely perfect. Especially for a price of $25, which isn't bad for a good piece of steak. It could easily be compared to Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse.

3.5/5. Great atmosphere and beautiful shabby chic deco. Would definitely book for a bridal party / baby shower, whatever. Super cheap food menu although if you have been back a few times the menu is very limited. I think they should add more to it. Be careful because the food is VERY oily. I've had every pasta here and it's always extremely oily. Also ordered the shepherds pie and it was drowning in butter/oil to the point where I had to run to the bathroom because the food just went right through me. The cornbread is NOT good.
Had dinner there tonight, the food was incredible, service was great, Very cozy atmosphere, fantastic Decore and very affordable menu with lots of options. Definitely will come back

I came here yesterday for a baby shower and I will say that the server gave very excellent and attentive service.  I got to try Caesar salad, a smoked salmon appetizer that I loved, a kind of flatbread with arugala, balsalmic dressing and red grapes, garlic parmesean fries, and a chicken sandwich with mayonnaise, tomato and avocado.  The food was pretty decent but the salmon and caper appetizer was my favorite.  Inside the Sparklings was very cute and exactly how I like my home to be- lots of grey walls with white trim, a huge sparkly Chandelier in the middle and large glass hurricanes filled with pink orchids.  The only real shame was the restroom.  The ladies restroom was a complete travesty and disgusting.  I went to walk in the large stall since I am pregnant and I had to walk directly out.  It looked like there was white powder all over the toilet that someone must have thrown up in.  I don't know how long that throw up had been there but the bathroom was so rank I could only imagine how long.  It was a turnoff to the rest of the place unfortunately.  I don't think I would be back because the restroom was THAT bad.  No matter how cute the place was and how decent the food was I'm sorry that was an image breaker.

First time here for my husband and I. I read the reviews a few months ago and kept telling myself that I eventually want to check this place out. Plus I drive past it all the time because I live right down the road. Finally my husband and I had a free night to check it out. Its a pretty small place. Not very intimate. From some of the other reviews I read people have said its 'beautiful'. If you look up there are fans and almost like a warehouse ceiling. A huge chandelier hangs in the middle that pretty much looks out of place. Between the fans and warehouse looking ceiling the chandelier doesnt look like it belongs there. The bar area looked decent it was more busy than the actual restaurant. Seems to me this place would make a better bar lounge possibly local dance place instead of a wanna be classy bar/restaurant. The middle could possibly be a big dance floor. But thats just my opinion. 

The food was decent. My husband had a Club sandwitch which he said was tasty. We both had clam chowder which was really good minus he fact the waiter never offered crushed pepper for my husband soup. Waiters should always offer crushed pepper for soup. My husbands soupspoon had dried up food on the one side of it. Which was pretty disgusting. I called over the waiter and he apologized and replaced it with a 'tea spoon' I'm guessing all of the soup spoons were gone.We also ordered the calamari off the appetizers. It wasn't very good...possibly not cooked enough and the marinara sauce that came with it had zero flavor. I wasn't impressed by the calamari at all. I ordered a Caesar salad which was very dry needed more dressing but the waiter took too long to come by so I just ate it that way. This place was ok. I wont recommend it to any of my friends due to the fact that there are better places around town with much better calamari and atmosphere. It will be one of those place I go to if I want to be close to home so I dont need to drive far but its not my favorite. It wasnt horrible but it wasnt as great as I expected. Sometimes you dont know how places are just by reading yelp reviews you need to go there and see for yourself. Beautiful and amazing to one person might be just Ok and decent for another.

Went here for the first time. Spontaneous date night. The ambience is original and pleasant. My love and I decided to go "tapas" style with their appetizers, which we were happy we did. The crispy gnocchi is must try. Also our server Tyler was excellent, very attentive without being too much. Overall an excellent night out. We will be returning again very soon.

Great service (thanks Ray!), great atmosphere and great food. This non-assuming location had convenient parking, coming in you instantly feel welcomed.

The food was great, from the fantastic calamari to Diane's steak (order it medium rare). The deserts were so good I couldn't stop eating. I thought I was going to split a seam on the way out. We had a party if 7 and the server kept up with our every need. The price is very reasonable, stop in if you happen to be in the area. You'll be glad you did.

I'm glad I finally came to this place. A friend told me how good this place was but he never mentioned how nice this place was. I felt like I was at a tea party. The ambiance is great. Perfect for a date or even a big group. 

My bf and tried a few appetizers, the flourless cake and a few beers. The gnocchi was my favorite and the meatballs were my bf's favorite. The pesto sauce in the gnocchi was so so good. I dipped everything else in it. I can't wait to try the salmon and a few other items on my next trip back, 

I saw the bar on my way out and am for sure going to try some of the cocktails too. It looked so relaxing and chill. Everyone was so nice and I loved the fact that it's down the street from me.

Great meal and very attentive service.  Menu seemed a little too all over the place.  The reason for the three stars really is the distance of the place, it's a $40 cab ride from the strip.  If you don't mind, worth the visit.

My new go-to place for Happy Hour drinks! Very affordable especially for my Midori Sour!! 

I ordered the Tuna Tartare, Pork&Beef Sliders, Jambalaya, and the Ribeye in medium. Very delicious and fresh! Despite it being Happy Hour we were escorted to a nice Vip-looking table that had curtains for privacy-- not bad since it was only in the afternoon!! Our bartender/waiter was very accommodating and he looks like a taller, cleanly shaven version of Iron Man lol! Also, it was a nice touch when their chef personally served our main dishes and told me good luck on eating my steak thinking I couldn't finish it... But I did! Overall, the barstaurant gave off a fancy schmancy dining experience but for an affordable price.

This local restaurant with great ambiance ..wonderful food and service is my new best friend.
We eat with our eyes and this place has simple beauty added as a bonus. The food was tasty the ceasar salad huge for 5 bucks 3 bucks more with chicken? outrageous!  Had the crispy gnocchi  app and with a salad it was a meal throw in a glass of house red and I was a happy woman.  No need to get all gussied up. The sparkles are in the decor and the food ...not you!  So pop in for a lunch or dinner..you will really like it.  A big shout out to Mnts Edge peeps!  We are just down the street. Also have private rooms and big dining areas for groups and a full bar area you can have a drink at if there is a wait. Honestly though...this place is,my new go to for lunch when I am out and about.  And dinner with the hubby
Anthony waited on me and was informed. . .kind..and a  pleasure .
Check it out

I came here once about a year ago and things changed and not for the good. The staff is immature and not responsive. No one asked if we needed drink refills and the food was room temperature. The women's bathroom was a cross between Walmart and a truck stop gas station. If I come back a year from now, wouldn't be surprised to find its turned into a rodent hangout.

What an amazing remodel from the previous restaurant!  The food is as amazing as the restaurant it's self.  My girlfriend and I enjoyed multiple apps, entrees and a dessert.  The grilled Octopus and crispy Gnocchi were to die for, her spaghetti with mushroom and bacon cream sauce and my Jambalaya were no less than amazing.  Top that off with a delectable flour-less chocolate dessert with raspberry sauce and you have yourself a full belly!

Food and drinks are priced right, taste great and are bundled into a chic but approachable atmosphere.  You wont be disappointed!

Went here on a weekday and the place was somewhat empty, which worked for us! A very modern-classy looking restaurant with a very long menu (3 pages of appetizers!!!) we were greeted nicely and our server was very nice and attentive. Our food was served with in 10 minuets and every single dish was extremely tasty, I have to say the good portion was very fair compare to the price. This place is absolutely a good date idea! The things I didn't much enjoy about this place were the bathrooms and how they packed our food to go in a cheap plastic bag that says thank you on it, I mean come on, if the restaurant is super nice, then maybe they could have a better presentation at packing our l

Love Love Love. 

The GOOD: 
1. The upscale atmosphere and design. This is so NOT a typical SW restaurant, in the best way possible. 
2. The fact this is the perfect spot for events. I participated in one small gathering that took a place here and it was really nice. 
3. Most food and drinks I tried were great. 
4. Never too crowded, perfect spot for brunch or a date! 

The OK: 
1. food. I mean. Some is awesome but some (the tomato sauce pasta, tomato soup) were just ok for me. 

The BAD: 
Nothing! Give this place a shot, it's awesome.

I LOVE THE SPARKLING! It atmosphere was so cute and cozy. The service was very good. Andy, the manager was super nice and talked to us and checked in a few times to see how we are doing. Our server was a sweet girl, Deena. She was attentive and smiley(: I had the spicy seafood pasta and I thought it was great! There was shrimp, clams, calamari and scallops! Yum! Also, we had the creme brûlée for dessert. Yuuuummy! I love creme brûlée and this lived up to expectations. Overall, great experience. I will definitely be going back!

We have been here multiple times to enjoy dinner. My favorite and go-to is the Gorgonzola Flatbread and Crispy Gnocchi. However I would be remiss if I did not do a review on the amazing private party we had here a couple weeks ago.  I hosted a 60th Birthday/Retirement party here for approx 90 people. Andy, the owner, was amazing to work with and so be very accommodating answering texts, emails and working with me on the day of to ensure the space was everything I had planned it to be! The food turned out great and the staff was on top of all of my guests ensuring they had what they needed! My hats off to The Sparklings for helping to ensure this momentous occasion went off without a glitch! Thank you thank you thank you! Headed there tonight for dinner! :)

The moment you walk in it's very spacious. It has wood floors and accented with white decor. 

My roommate and I ordered truffle fries, seared diver's scallops, the spicy seafood pasta, and creme brûlée!

We shared everything and the food was delicious! I definitely recommend trying this place! 

Only bad thing, is that our server had really bland service..

Great new restaurant in Vegas. Staff was very polite and attentive. The menu has basic items but doubt mistake it for the quality. The food was amazing! Happy hour is from 5-10pm I was informed. Our bartender was Jose who was excellent and took our long order by memory which was highly impressive. This is definitely one of my new casual go to spots.

Service was great! Everyone clearly works together and I was never without any assistance, even on tonight for mother's day! My first time hear and the food is pretty fresh for Vegas standards perfectly priced! My table of three loved everything they had. the entree sauces are not very strong, certainly more of a subtle light taste versus a more distinct flavorful sauce. I tried the white wine, Cajun, and cream. Certainly good entrees, just not super flavorful. Which is fine if you like a lighter tasting dish. BTW, if you're doing keto, chicken piccata is perfect!

I have eaten at The Sparkling twice now.  I want to like this place, and even gave it a second try.  However, the food is not good. And the restrooms were very dirty each time I visited the restaurant.  I always notice if the restrooms of a business are clean or not, and if they are dirty I believe it speaks poorly of the quality of the establishment

I came here for a friend's birthday dinner and I totally did not expect the ambiance that I experienced when I walked in. From the outside, it doesn't really look the way it does on the inside. It's a very relaxed, yet sophisticated setting. Some tables are sectioned off with more privacy. The food is great. I definitely recommend this place.

This was the worst experience possible, from the slow service and attitude from our server to the bus boy spilling crushed pepper all over my lap and my salad (it wasn't his fault but might want to get a new pepper holder.) First things first, I was meeting 3 of my friends and her newborn baby there, yes they were a little bit late but I let the guy know I needed a table for 4 he said no problem so instead of seating me prior to my friends getting there like most places would do he made me wait til they got there and then as soon as they got there we waited another 10 minutes to finally be seated. It was around 1:40 last Sunday March 3rd. Our waiter was the absolute rudest thing and strutted around the restaurant like he was the owner (I would certainly hope not) or some royalty of some sort. He was very dry and kept calling us "babe" or "baby" sorry but I'm not your girlfriend and you shouldn't be addressing customers that way. I was so upset at how slow it was taking them to bring my friend sugar, SUGAR nothing special just SUGAR, her coffee started to get cold and finally the busser advised he would bring some over along with a new coffee for my friend. I literally didn't want to be there anymore after waiting 30 minutes for the waiter to come back and take our older. I ordered the cheapest simplest thing on the menu (mind you we were going to go all out on brunch but not after that experience). Finally after another 30 minutes my Caesar salad made with Tysons brand striped chicken strips you can get in the meat dept arrived. The busser brought over the pepper shaker only for the whole pepper to fall completely all over my lap and salad. I was so ready to leave. The bathroom was disgusting, toilet paper on the floor, water splashed over the sink. I had to track down our "waiter" to get our check, he was up front just gossiping with the girl up there. I was really looking forward to coming to this place after hearing praise about it but not after my experience. I don't care if you guys had a party the night before and had people working the next morning, the manager should know how to schedule to ensure everyone has a nights rest to prepare for work the next day. No excuses!

With all of the bars in Vegas considered, The Sparklings is a diamond in the rough. Led by Rey, an amazing bartender and friend once you get to know him, this barstaurant is definitely a place you can call home!
Everything we had was delicious! This place does not dissappoint. The staff was very attentive & friendly. I most definitely will be coming back!!!
Pretty restaurant. Decent service. The WORST short ribs ever!. More than half fat! Wouldn't feed it to my dogs!

Beautiful place! We had set up a big party of about 30 for my soon to be brother in law to propose to my sister. Andy and the staff were all very helpful. Everything went well. Everyone had fun. And the food was good! 5 stars!
I loved this restaurant, complete different environment at night a lot more chill. The food is bomb and inexpensive!
I've been coming here since they opened including their New Year's Eve party. Great scenery, food and service. The owner always makes sure you're having a good time and I'm a regular.

This place is a hidden gem! Usually empty when we go for lunch.

Wonderful decor.
Excellent food.
Affordable prices.
Good service.

What we've gotten and loved:
Veggie quesadilla $7 
Turkey-cranberry sandwich $10
(The bread is grilled and the dish comes with soup)
Grilled octopus $7 though just 5 small pieces, delicious
Veggie omelette $8
Sweet potato fries $7

Dessert:
Flourless chocolate cake $6 awesome


Ok:
Ceviche (people who like that will like it here)
Blackened fish taco: too sour and spicy
Very good. Great upscale looking atmosphere with affordable food. I had the fillet mignon and it was top-quality.
Love this place, very good and creative amall plates.  Went on a Sunday and we were literally the only ones in the place.  Ordered a bumch of apps.  Every one was perfect.

This is--by far--the coolest-looking place in the area.  The designer deserves five stars because it's a wonderful amalgam of chic and traditional.  It's really fun and a good place for a quiet first date.

The food is fair--slight better than The Sizzler with a wine list to match.  The scallops were over-cooked and the pasta dishes were unremarkable.  Even the chocolate cake was pretty average.  None of it's bad but unless you want to impress someone with the vibe I wouldn't say it's place worth going to more than once.

After reading the food reviews we really wanted to try this place for brunch. Didn't get a chance to try the food. Sat down and waited over 15 minutes for someone to take our drink order. We left.  Disappointed. The bar tender was also the server for the entire restaurant, at 12 on Saturday at a restaurant that promotes their brunch. So dissapo

Definitely one of our favorite restaurants. 

The bacon & date wrapped meat balls should be renamed "amaze-balls."

Their BBQ ribs are also the most meaty, tender, fall-off-the-bone ribs you will ever have. Way better than you would even get at a place that specializes in ribs.

Honestly, I've never had anything bad here.

The only complaint I have is with the BBQ Pork sliders, and even then not with the sliders themselves. They will allow you to order them as a single sandwich for a couple bucks more, which is great, because the sliders are awesome. However, every time I've ordered them as a single sandwich, it has been served completely differently each time. Once stuffed in an interesting kind of hoagie roll, another time on toast... This time they served it as if it was their grilled chicken sandwich, but with the pork instead of the chicken (meaning it had toppings that simply do not belong with BBQ pork). I'll probably go back to ordering them as sliders due to that inconsistency.
Really good service, awesome food and very nice food presentation of food. Highly recommended for formal dining restaurant.

This place is adorable and the menu had lots of wonderful choices.  I went with a large Meetup Group last night.  Our server had his hands full as everyone ordered separately and some of us were late.  He did a great job keeping up and did not act put out at all even though you know we were probably a pain in the you know what.  I ordered the Tempura Shrimp and Mushroom pasta dish.  It was absolutely delicious.  Prices are very reasonable!  I highly recommend this place and will be back!

My best friend & I found this little spot on Yelp.. & it has become one of our favorite places to treat ourselves! We usually order a bunch of different appetizers, or as you call it "tapas style". Everything is so good & unique! The flavors are amazing & the service is always good & attentive. The grilled chicken wings, diver scallops, & pesto gnocchi is a must try! Oh & did I mention reasonable prices?! All apps under $10!

This review is long overdue.

I've been to The Sparklings quite a few times. Their food is subpar but the service I've received at the bar has always been spectacular. Angelo is always our bartender and he is phenomenal! Very personable, friendly, and attentive when it comes to our drinks and requests. 

They have Wasatch on draft, a delicious white IPA. They also have Happy Hour DAILY from 5 PM - 10 PM where drinks are 30% off! This includes bottles of wine... which makes it an excellent idea to enjoy Happy Hour here. 

I enjoy the quiet, inviting ambiance The Sparklings and look forward to coming back.
Beautiful decor and it seems like a good place to eat. However the food is way too salty and the service is average to poor.
Very cozy modern atmosphere. The food is good and staff is prompt. I'll be back. Thank you for the great food and customer service.

Shoutout to Andy for always treating us like family and to Jose and Ray for being the best bartenders of our lives!! I love going to sparklings, not only because it's within walking distance, but because I literally feel at home every time I visit :) thank you for the hospitality and your kindness! 

P.S. The drinks are to die for, and the food is just as amazing. The setting is very classy yet completely casual as well. Perfect for events, business meetings, and social gatherings! 

Sparklings is my all time fave :) we love you guys!!

Went here for a date night couple days back. Presently  surprised with the decor inside, very nice and roomy with comfy seats and a bar area had TV's playing sports.. Ordered nachos (ok, used potato  chips instead of tortilla, pork was meh) and two types of pasta.. Cajun chicken w/shrimp and seafood pasta which were both nice and spicy.. Overall the food was just alright as I wasn't blown away with the food but rather the price, very affordable and solid options. Just wished the food was more tasty but we will be back.  More of a 3.5

Awesome awesome awesome! Food was great, service was friendly, and Andy is the best at keeping his team in line for a  top-notch dining experience! It's a brand new restaurant that I'm sure will be the talk of the town soon. Fantastic!

This place is a hidden gem.  Went there for a late dinner with my daughters.  The outside of the building looked plain, but as you enter thru the double glass doors, something spectacular awaits you.  The young man, Ray, greeted us politely and lead us to the dinning area to be seated.  In the center of the dinning room was a gorgeous crystal chandelier. Underneath were various sizes of glass vases with beautiful pink and white orchids and roses. It was a reminisce of a Paris cafe. They had separate dinning rooms for larger parties. Our  waiter, Jason, was funny and courteous. Our order came in a timely manner. We ordered truffle fries to start with. They were very crunchy on the outside and soft inside, just the way I liked fries. The portion for the truffle fries was not that big. Then our meals were served. Presentation was great.  I must say my favorite was the jambalaya. It was very tasty. The ribeye steak was cooked just right and the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta was delicious as well.  Pricing is reasonable. The manager, Andy, even came up to our table and ask how everything was. Our overall experience was wonderful. Will definitely visit this place again.

Place was amazing. One of the best all-around dining experiences I've had in Las Vegas and there are many good ones. Food is fantastic and great value across the board (favorites: crispy gnocchi, bacon and date meatballs, mussel "soup"). Staff is very friendly, knowledgable, and seems to work hard. Ambiance and decor make the experience unique and memorable. Will be back many times in the future, there were about 20 things that sounded amazing but my girlfriend and I weren't hungry enough to try. Also we were just trying to have a relaxing night and showed up in sweats and gym shorts and were not judged one bit for it nor treated disrespectfully by anybody. Very refreshing and different from some other dining experiences I've had in Vegas (*cough* Wynn *cough*)

:)

My girlfriend and I love coming to The Sparklings when we just want to catch up.  Their happy hour specials are great..we always share a bottle of wine (or two).  The spicy seafood pasta is my favorite dish.  I love the décor, the music does a good job at setting the right atmosphere and the staff has always been friendly and attentive.

I had the pleasure of celebrating my friend's birthday here. When I first walked in the big sparkly chandelier caught  my eye like most things that sparkle. I loved that the decor was elegant and the menu was affordable. This allowed me to try more items on the menu.

I started with the French Onion Soup which was amazing! The broth , the bread and the gooey cheese made the best French Onion soup I've had to date. I was also curious about grape, basil and ricotta flat bread so I definitely had to order that! It was also topped with candied walnuts, arugula (my favorite)  and drizzled with balsamic. It had that sweet and savory taste to it. I folded mine and ate it like a sandwich so nothing would fall off to the side. It's a great appetizer because it's light and leaves room for your entree. Since I just had my wisdom teeth taken out I needed a very soft entree. I chose the Rice Au Gratin with chicken. It was creamy, rich and fit the bill . The portions were big enough for me to take some home for lunch the next day. 

The Sparklings is a wonderful place for a date and special occasions.The dishes are great for sharing so everyone can order something different and you can experience an array of entree's and appetizers.

I went here with a few friends for dinner and drinks after a hike. Our server was Angel, he was absolutely amazing. We had a great bottle of wine and the ambiance was nice. I'm currently on a keto diet and Angel was very helpful in suggesting items for me. I live in Henderson, but I'll definitely be back if I find myself on this side of town.
Beautiful setting, great food, and our waiter (Jason) was so amazing. I would highly recommend trying them out

We were looking for a great drink in an awesome atmosphere.  We found it at The Sparklings. We started with the Amethyst (Violet Colada) and the Citrine (Orange Crush).  This was followed by the Tuna Tartare and Sea Diver Scallops.  These were both excellent choices.  Service was great and food was excellent.

This place is phenomenal! It's very open and has the décor of modern meeting vintage. Colorful but light and appealing to the eyes. If it weren't for the low priced menu, you'd swear your in a upscale restaurant. It's a perfect place to go on a lil date night or to bring the party with their big booths. Appeals to everyone! 
Went with the gf and just ordered a few appetizers, the crispy gnocchi (super delish), the bacon wrapped meatball with dates (my personal favourite), seared crispy scallops (your missing out if you don't order), and the bruschetta with a cream cheese avocado topping. You really can't go wrong with any of those! 
The service was perfect, everything came out at a nice steady pace, the waiter was very friendly and the manager was welcoming, making sure everything was good and to satisfaction (A rare trait in todays restaurant world).
I highly recommend this place to everyone, will definitely be going back, it's a perfect local hangout with some nice class to it! So classy and beautiful, you'd think your on the strip! ;)

Update 5/30/17
We reserved the bar area for our wedding party, and it was awesome. Samantha, Angel, and Eric served us and did a fantastic job. Andy the owner made sure we were doing well the whole night. Food was amazing like always, they served it buffet style. Everyone was happy and it was a wonderful experience. Love Love Love The Sparklings!




This hidden gem. I love the food here, it is amazing! And I love the inside as well. The bar area is super nice and the staff are awesome too. I booked my reception here. Can't say enough about this place. Oh, and they have bottomless mimosas for brunch. You can't beat that! Overall experience, whether it's breakfast, brunch, dinner, or out for drinks and apps, they are the go to spot.

Amazing remodel! Not what you would expect from outside. The service is fantastic. Everyone is so friendly and accommodating. Just had lunch with my daughters. Everything we ordered, apps, salads and the turkey sandwich was great!!! I'd recommend this restaurant and have every intention of visiting again. Just go!

Review is for visit on 4-2-16 around 4pm. Friday afternoon, place was pretty dead. We sat at the bar to have some food, and at the time there was only one other person at the bar. 

The bartender Rey was personable and seemed attentive at first. My friend ordered a spicy pasta dish and gnocchi appetizer (see pics) and I ordered grilled salmon with capers served over rice. It was supposed to come with a cream sauce, but since I wanted a healthy entree I requested no sauce. Bartender acted like oookaaay as if to imply it was not going to be good without sauce.  I thought oh great, it's going to be dry! But when the meal came out, I thought it was perfectly fine without the sauce.

The salmon was tasty and moist. Serving size was maybe around 3 1/2 oz, with a nice presentation on a small bed of rice. I think it is slightly overpriced at $20 though. Not a big enough portion for $20. It didn't need the capers in my opinion, it had enough flavor. 

My friend was satisfied with her app and meal. We were only ordering water as we had been out in the sun all day. Unfortunately my friend had to ask for a water refill, my glass was almost empty and bartender didn't even fill my glass when he refilled hers. Sort of basic to fill both of them at once, isn't it? He didn't have a ton of people to wait on but for whatever reason getting our check and taking our money took a very long time. Sorry that we aren't drinking today...? 

I liked the atmosphere of the place, the food was fine but nothing magical that made me want to come back anytime soon. The restaurant part is beautifully decorated with a gorgeous chandelier. I can see this being a great place to have a small gathering for a special event.

Great late night food! It's so hard to find good food(not bar food) after 11pm, even in Vegas. The food was excellent, the music was good too:) We will definitely return. Oh and Jose was a great bartender, very friendly!

Great contemporary place to visit off the strip. Very attentive service. 

Food was good, but would prefer to come back for appetizers and drinks instead of entrees. 

Great pricing!

Delicious would be the most apt word to describe food at the "The Sparklings". We tried a bunch of appetizers and all of them were good. I would highly recommend the Crispy Gnocchi and Flatbread smeared with ricotta cheese.  The place has a very inviting and pleasing interior and the service is top notch. Also, "The Sparklings" is one of the few places that servers the Moscow Mule in a copper tumbler.  I would highly recommend the "The Sparklings".

This place is not near the strip folks.

I came here for a baby shower for one of my friends.  The 5 stars for the exceptional service.  We had a large group, it was a lunch on a Sunday and they were extremely accommodating, even came out to cut the cake, granted they should have had a knife to cut it not a spatula, but I digress.  Boys.

The food was decent, nothing super spectacular.  Apparently they only have a few tea pots, so a few ladies (including the mom to be) couldn't get tea because they had them all out with the *other* baby shower luncheon that was going on across the dining room.  Seriously?  And there is also no coffee, just espresso or americano.  You can't get a latte or cappuccino either.

However, people were enjoying their special cocktails so I guess at least they have the bar going on for them.

I don't understand how this place has such good reviews! I've been here twice and both times the service was awful! The last time we were here, everything took forever! There was about 13 of us for a birthday. All of our food came out at completely different times, so some people in our party were almost done eating by the time others were just getting their food. We had to ask for basic things like silverware. One of our people arrived late and nobody asked her if she wanted anything to drink or gave her a menu. Members of our party had to request all of these things for her. We also asked to add another table because we were seated very close together and they refused to add one, even though there were plenty empty tables. 

Now the food. Some of the food was great! The appetizers were tasty. The main dishes, however, were not. My friends "roasted" chicken looked like an under-boiled nasty mess. He asked for some Tabasco and was told that the food should already be spicy enough.....another friend ordered truffle fries and never got them and later had to have the server take the charge off the bill. My husband's chicken risotto wasn't good either.

Overall, it seems that this place spent more effort on décor than they did training their staff on service and cooking.  We all have experience working in customer service and are a very easy bunch to please. It's safe to say nobody in our party will be returning.

This was my second time to the Sparklings.  I see the manager Andy,  apologizing for all the other bad comments but obviously not DOING anything to make it better.  We were talking in the car on the way home that the Food is AWESOME, the prices are GREAT,  but the Slooooow and RUDE service makes it almost unbearable.  The restaurant was not even full and it was like pulling teeth to get service.  I finally yelled out "SERVICE" across the room.  and the rude waitress, Susan, who had been ignoring us all night,  looked my way and flipped her head and walked the other way.  If this place could delivery snappy fast drinks and pleasant service they would have a line out the door and not always be half empty.  
Normal wait staff pleasantries were non existent, even from the gal who tried to help our disappearing waitress,  like bringing salt, a glass, a plate, taking away dirty plates, fixing a drink, delivering food and drinks in a timely fashion, making sure everyone got their food at the same time.  We were not expecting anything exceptional in service,  just normal things when you go to a decent restaurant.  
It's Sooooo sad and disappointing to see good potential RUINED by staff who could care less about the guest experience.  On the good side, every bite of food I've had there is very good.  Langostina bruschetta, caprese salad,  chicken marsala, ceviche,  gnocchi, scallops and more.  With the groups I've taken there, we have tasted all that and more,  and its all good. The drinks are excellent too, the Voodoo,  the Chandelier.....    BUT slow drinks, rude service, DIRTY bathrooms, HOT dining room,  and people who just don't care will make me think twice about going again.  Please please please fix your problems and hire people who give a shit, and are knowledgeable and pleasant and get rid of that B Susan who is driving your customers away,  so we can come back again. and please,  CLEAN the bathroom,  like REALLY clean it.  Such a beautiful restaurant and such a dank and gross ladies room.  Sad.

I love trying new spots! Unfortunately, this is not a new spot I would recommend. I arrived super late to a birthday (over an hour) and everyone was still waiting for their food. I too experienced the poor cutomer service when I waited about 30min prior to my friend asking the waitress for a water for me. Another 10-15min pass and another friend asked a waitor for a menu. Thank God my friends have customer service skills. The food was decent for the price. I ordered a salad and it was quite tasty. Their truffle fries were nothing special. I was thankful they were able to split the checks. It is unfortunate when an establishment has so much potential. However, I do not plan on returning. If you're looking for a new hipster joint and like being ignored this is the spot for you.

This place is a very unique place to eat! Very modern style in the restaurant! There food was very delicious! I had the philly cheese steak and a bowl of the French onion soup! Both were really well! Also there's a grilled chicken sandwich my friends had that was very delicious as well! Plus the service was great! And the server we had which I think he was also the bartender was Anthony! He was a very great very nice man with great picking selections for us for being my first time there! Will be definitely coming back and telling my friends about it !

I came here after my husband continuously asking me to go here for our next date night. We rely a lot on Yelp for our date nights. Based the the stars from Yelp, I decided to give this a try.  

We ordered for Gorgonzola flat bread, calamari, chipotle chicken pasta and pesto linguine. 

Presentation - I was disappointed receiving our appetizers. It looked like our flat bread was microwaved however main dishes were ok.

Quality of food - the food was good. I was however disappointed at how watered down the sauce with calamari was. I would dip my calamari in the sauce and it was dripping like it was deluded with water. 

Price - price was fair. It was a nice restaurant and very clean so the food and ambiance was nice.

Service - not the best. I'm not sure if our waiter wasn't serving everyone by himself, service would have been better. The water tastes horrible, the soda was stale and I had to request a refill on my drinks. I also had to ask for a box and someone who was not our waiter came by our table once to see how we were doing. This place was not busy at all, however, there could have been a little more effort. 

I would rate this place a 3.5.

Our waitress was really helpful in giving us recommendations especially being it was our first time there. And almost everything she recommended, we ordered. The appetizers as well as entrees were delicious. We definitely come back again!
They have yet to disappoint & their delicious food & great customer service has been consistent with each visit. I officially give them 5 stars that are well deserved!!!

We moved to the Southwest area of Vegas about 3 months ago and The Sparklings has quickly become our new local hang out. We know we will always get great service (Sam and Angel the bartenders are so nice!), great food, and all at a great price. Our favorites are the diver scallops, parmesan truffle fries, the grilled chicken sandwich, and the Gnochi (either one is fantastic). The decor of the restaurant is so nice too, completely unexpected but just gorgeous!

I think that it's very unprofessional for this manager who sits on Yelp and argues with people about the experience they had. What a joke. And you sir will be the demise of this establishment. We told our server that the food had no taste. Seeing how there was two servers serving us. Maybe you asked the one we said nothing to. It was about half eaten because it was very late and going somewhere else just wasn't going to happen when I had to be up at 6:00am the next morning. You have such a poor way of "fixing the situation". I will never return to this establishment. Ever. And like I said. The way you handle complaints is so unethical. You mistaking my fiancé for joking? That's insane. It was a negative comment and you should have investigated right then and there. I didn't finish the food. And being in the industry. I know that if the customer finished their food and still complained. That their trying to get free food. That sir was not the situation at all. For you to sit there and explain yourself in the matter you did. Like I said. So UNPROFESSIONAL!!!! I wonder if the owners of this establishment knows how their manager handles these yelp situations. You sir should probably find a job where you sit in a room. With 0 interaction with humans. Because you suck at it.

Went here with a large party and wasn't impressed by the service at all. The food was delicious but the service ruined it for me and my friends. I made a reservation in advance, they placed us on the side bench with tables and chairs uncomfortably pushed together. We had about 13 people. The large dining table across from us was empty where they eventually sat a party of 5 later on in the evening. We asked for another table to be added to the end and the blonde server said no they don't have any, even though there were empty tables in the private dining area. Server looked like she didn't want to be there. We had to ask for e-v-e-r-y-t-h-i-n-g! Refills several times --we all had water. Asked for extra place settings where the server returned with just utensils. So we have to be specific and ask for the plates too? Server disappeared from table upon taking our orders.  Sometimes people need more time to decide on what they want to eat--especially that big of a party. A proper excusal such as "Would you like more time to decide?" would be nice.  The timing of the food was a bummer.  Once the last person got their food everyone was pretty much done. Upon paying the check, they gave us 1 pen to share amongst all of us to pay our portion. In the hospitality industry, you're suppose to anticipate needs. We were the biggest party in the restaurant and why we were overlooked behooves me.  Dude, I was so embarrassed I recommended this place because of the great reviews. Such a bummer.

We had a little get together and when you walk in the place the decor is pretty cool We walked to the bar and got a few drinks were greeted with smiles which is always good We ordered some appetizers and entrees the food was overall good but i thought the scallop appetizers was a little on the small side but it was delicious My only concerned about this place it was super dead ?? I mean there was no one in there? I think the time we there There were only 3 more tables that walked in ? Overall the experience was good Just kinda disturbing  and puzzling why theres nobody in there ? it  just needs more people Maybe better marketing? Or some promotions to get the public to walk in

First off this place is very cute. You wouldn't expect that from the appearance on the outside the indoor decor and how they have everything laid out is well done.

Okay now onto why they only get 2 stars. First off service is extremely slow. This place is hardly busy, I've been quite a few times and there was never more than 2-3 tables, that's being generous. I've also gone at different times and days and it's always the same. The host will seat you just fine but service from there isn't the best. Not saying the staff isn't friendly, they are just not responsive, upbeat, and food time to table is slow.

They have a large menu and from pictures I have taken you can see presentation is done well but food is not very flavorful. It's pretty bland. 

Only would go back because it was so close to our house so if we wanted a seat down American food meal we would come here but would not be my first choice.
This is where my boyfriend and I had our first date. Setting is very cozy and you will definitely feel like you're in a cozy home. The food is great and prices are acceptable.

Really big sized portions. Prices are very reasonable.  Decor and inside layout is beautiful designed. Good for romantic night or family night.  spicy pasta was on point..  bruschetta was light and refreshingly tasty.  Spaghetti and meatballs were a huge portion but a little salty.  Service was ok.  4 stars.

Let me start off by saying, Jose is awesome! He was our server and he provided excellent service and an entertaining dining experience, and making us grateful we didn't walk out when we first walked in due to nobody else being in the restaurant (We found out later there was something big happening downtown, and that is why it was as empty as it was). The food was delicious and came out in a timely manner.  
     We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and believes when we say it was one of the best versions of the dish we've had, and we come a seafood town. I had the Atlantic Salmon, which had a crunchy twist making it a delectable treat. My friend had the shrimp salad, which was a good as a shrimp salad can be lol.
     Overall, two thumbs up and another big plus is that it is just far enough away from the strip to make it a perfect Non-Tourist trap.

I loved the decor of this restaurant. It's super cute and chic. I came here for happy hour as they have a great deal on drinks. Every single drink menu is 30% off from
6 PM to 10 PM. That's probably one of the longest happy hours in town. The only inconvenience is that they do not have any happy hour food items. However, their dishes had very reasonable prices. I ordered the Tuna Tartare which was good but not memorable. I think I would like to come back and try their full menu. The service was good, it appears the manager and employees tried to be on top of their duties at all times. Overall, a good restaurant if you are in the area.

Had a great bartender. Great food. The turkey and cranberry blew my mind. I felt underdressed in a t shirt and jeans.  Love that I can get a little bit more dressed up for dinner and not have to break the bank. The happy hour is awesome. We had three drinks and two entrees and our bill was $33! Defiantly will be going back.

My husband and I ate here on a Saturday night around 830pm. There was a very large party, a couple of normal parties, and the bar was about half full. We were seated right away and were given water immediately. My husband and I don't get to go out often so we were taking our time and our server, Eric, never rushed us and kept checking until we decided. As I'm a nursing mother, my son had a dairy allergy so I have to be careful about what I eat. Eric made sure to double check the ingredients before putting my order in. Our food came out fast and hot. The sweet potato fries and calamari were cooked to perfection. My braised beef was so tender than it fell apart using only my fork. My husband got a shrimp and chicken pasta that was so big he had to get a box for half of it. My only complaint is the lighting was very bright...very very bright.

Such a great place! Had my birthday dinner here and was so pleasantly surprised by everything! Yummy food (lots of great seafood choices) and we had an awesome server - Jason is awesome! Totally made the night special! The atmosphere is relaxing and just all around wonderful. Will for sure be back!!

This place is a hidden gem!!!! Wonderful food, drinks and service!! 

Thoroughly enjoyed the experience I received here! The food is amazing and super fast service!!

Overall pretty decent.  While the pricing is good, the portioning is commensurate with that pricing.  Overall it was pretty good, but since the portions were a little on the small side, you were left wanting.  The ribeye looked like a the same size as you would get with steak and eggs, and the file was maybe 5 or 6 oz.  The bar looks worthwhile and they happy hour specials looked to be of good value.

Came in last night for dinner after bookmarking this place awhile back. The atmosphere of the place definitely makes it seem more expensive than it actually is. It's a big main room with a bar and a side room but the room is used sparingly so it gives it a really big and open feel which is pretty nice. Our server was Jason and he was great he was very interested in our little baby and was quick with the order refills and making conversation. We wanted to try some different plates so we got the calamari and scallops for appetizers. The calamari was pretty basic but my gf asked for remoulade which I thought was better then the marinara. The scallops were pretty good but I don't feel you get enough since half the pieces are the rice. For our actual menu I got the chicken wings and she got the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. The chicken wings were alright but like some people have said I think they would be better with some crisp in them. Pasta was quote "soooo good" but since I'm not a fan of spicy I opted out. For dessert we of course got the trio sampler and the creme brûlée was delicious although the flourless cake id really rename "fudge" all in all we will come back eventually. Cheap food, expensive feel, and great service.
Went to Sparklings to eat, very nice decor, clean, good food, very affordable. I had the *salmon* which was delicious.

This is one of the cutest restaurants I have gone to in a while. The interior is so well designed and unique -- spacious, modern and fancy. It's perfect for a date night, or just with a group of friends. It makes a perfect spot for birthday dinners too. Food comes well presented without being overpriced! That's what I always love! Totally recommend.
I was surprised at the quality of the food and service here. Super cute surroundings, and everything was so delicious. Love that cheese platter.

This is the real deal. If you are looking for a great meal prepared with passion and a professional presentation; this is the place for you. Check any pretension at the door; while it may be accepted, it's is not required. Only good taste and respect for great food seem required for entry.

Great restaurant! We ordered 3 appetizers and a few drinks. Our server was super sweet and attentive. The Irish nachos are amazing! We substituted the potato chips for fries and it was SO GOOD! Great flavor. We also ordered the crispy gnocchi with pesto and was so delicious. I will definitely be ordering this again!!! Beautiful establishment and the prices are very reasonable. We will be back!!

Great food and great server. We had the bacon wrapped dates, gnocchi, Caesar salad, clam chowder, and chocolate cake. Caesar could have used more dressing but otherwise everything was delicious. The flourless chocolate cake was the perfect ending. 
Our server was great. Good sense of humor. I think they were short handed though there were a few times we waited for our server and then he brought the check before I got to see the dessert menu. He quickly apologized and brought one right over and good thing he did. Like I said the chocolate good was delicious. Looking forward to having that again.

I don't know, maybe I came in on a off night.  I'm certainly willing to give them another try, but here is what I experienced on my visit. 

On first impression, I love the décor and feel of the restaurant. They got that 100% right. However, there was something missing that I couldn't put my finger on...that night (Wednesday) it wasn't very busy so there was no hustle/bustle to give the place a warm vibe or maybe it was the sound system and how the music didn't really fill the room.  Not sure, but it felt like we were the last table in a restaurant that was about the close for the night. Just a little too quite.

I'd actually give the food 3/4 stars. It was decent. I think my favorite was the crispy gnocchi and would love to see that as a meal...it was darn good. 

Where the night went wrong was partly due to the staff.  It wasn't that they were not friendly, they were, just inexperienced and their "professionalism" seemed forced, which if they are new to serving tables I understand it takes time to get your mo-jo going. Our appetizers came out on time and when I asked the person who delivered them (not our server) what type of bread came with the spinach and crab dip, as there were two different types served, his answer was, "I don't know. I can ask the chef if you want".  I feel like if you work at a restaurant and you are one of the people that brings food to the table, you should be well aware of the menu and what is on it. Maybe it was his first night on the job...who knows. At least he offered to ask the chef, I guess. 

After the appetizers my soup came out and then shortly after he said our entrees would be out shortly.  They then delivered one entrée followed by about a 10 minute wait...there was four of us in the party, so we were waiting on 3 more entrees.  They then delivered one more entrée, still nothing on the other two, just apologies for the wait.  I even asked the waiter what was the hold up on the entrees, to which he answered "I'm not sure, let me ask them".  Hummm...we've been waiting now for 15 minutes + just to get out entrees served and you are apologizing, but you don't know why you are apologizing. When our entrees finally did come out the manager (I assume) finally gave us the reason...our steaks had been over cooked and they had to redo them.  Which, if they would have told us that right from the get go then I would have been understanding to the wait.  Also, while we were waiting during all of this the manager brought out a free appetizer, the spinach and crab dip, which we had already had.  It was a nice gesture, but also shows that there was no communication between the server and manager.  Why bring a table something they've already tried? Why not ask us what we would prefer considering we were the ones inconvenienced. 

I hope it does improve and will go back another time over a weekend, perhaps to see if I can have a better experience.

Party of 30, please! Came here on a Friday night for my friend's birthday dinner. I've only been to this restaurant twice. The first time was okay. I think the second time was better. 

So, we came in around 8. There were a lot of us & im sure we were a confusing group of people to serve lol. But they didn't start taking our orders until 9. We practically sat there for an hour waiting... I'm not sure if it was cos they were waiting for every single person in our party to come or what. At least I wasn't alone waiting for an hour. Anyways, my friend ordered an appetizer & forgive me, idk what it's called but a picture will be posted. The flavor was amazing! I wouldn't have wanted to order it by just looking at the description lol but I'm glad she did. I ordered the spaghetti with bacon & mushroom cream sauce & we shared that. Hugeeee portion & a pretty heavy meal, but definitely a must try. Our other friend ordered the crispy gnocchi since we saw it was a favorite on Yelp. I didn't really care much for it. I guess I had high expectations for it but they weren't met. & for dessert, I got the tempura ice cream (coffee). This was very well fried. Not too much tempura overpowering the ice cream & it was crispy, not floury. 

Overall, it was a good experience! Didn't think I would come back after the first time but I've changed my mind.
Everything is delicious here!! From the drinks to the appetizers to the entrées!! Staff is super friendly and the management really cares about the service being provided

This place has horrendous service. First of all, we had no idea who our server was since each time someone came to the table it was someone different. We had a larger party with a reservation. I think it is common that the servers just automatically give everyone a water and then asks for separate drink orders. They only gave a few people waters, I asked for refills, and some people did not get their drinks they ordered. The cocktails were very diluted and multiple drink orders had to be remade. The servers all seemed very rushed and did not provide a welcoming environment. One person in our party ordered a steak, it wasn't cooked right so it was sent back. Our entrees did not come out at the same time and one guest did not get his entree until about 10 minutes after everyone else got their food. We also brought in a cake for a birthday. No one informed our party of a cake cutting fee and we were charged one. Not only that, the staff lost the box to the cake so it had to be carried home without a box. I do not recommend this place to have a nice dinner.

Such a lovely Secret!!!  food was amazing !!! 
Can't wait for my second visit sorry no pics of the food devoured it!!! The perfect place for a romantic dinner .
Great atmosphere and food the owner and staff are always very helpful and friendly.  I highly recommend this place for a great date night.
Amazing!!!! Cucumber salad is excellent along with tempura shrimp and mushroom pasta!

Upscale and classic. The perfect place for a date or family gathering. The decor is so modern and clean. The happy hour specials are usually quite good.  I like to order the Portabello fries, Ribeye Steak, and Scallops. I have never been disappointed with their food or service. I have even taken their food as takeout and it is still just as delicious!

I've grown to be highly cynical of restaurants on Yelp that have 4+ stars, because I'm usually disappointed. A lot of Yelpers just don't have very good taste in food, so it's very hit or miss. 

After eating yesterday at The Sparklings, I left extremely impressed. I had three dishes there: a Caesar salad, the bacon and date-wrapped meatballs and the crispy gnocchi. All three were excellent! The service was prompt and friendly, and they take a lot of pride in their food. They have a lot of tapas-type offerings and a very pleasant dining atmosphere. 

This is a very exciting addition to the SW Las Vegas restaurant scene and I'm glad they're in my area. I really hope people support this great restaurant, because they truly deserve it. Do yourself a favor and check out The Sparklings!

Came here for a friends birthday dinner! And I loved it! Not only was the food amazing but Tyler our server was great and attentive! I ordered the spicy seafood pasta and the level of spice had a great flavor and wasn't over bearing! Overall great choice for dining!

I came here for a friends birthday celebration.  Upon arrival, you would not expect what you get pulling up to this place.  Exterior looks like it could be a lodge of some sort.  When you walk in, the atmosphere is laid back and very trendy. They have this sweet chandelier hanging in the middle of the place. I loved all of the little pieces they have in there. Totally not expecting that. Plus, the host was pretty good looking, too. Heyy! 

First things ordered were drinks.  My first drink, which, according to the host, was a favorite, tasted like medicine. I don't know, maybe the people like the taste of Benadryl with their dinner, but that was not for me. I then ordered, and sang "Return of the Mack." couldn't help myself.  That was a little better.  

Since I wasn't that hungry, I ordered crab dip which cam with pita chips.  My meal was tasty.  I also ate off other peoples plates.  The truffle fries are really good. So was the pasta.  It had a nice flavor to it.  Wasn't bland at all.  

For such a large group they were very accommodating.  No one came in at the same time, but all of the food came out relatively quick once ordered. And came out together, so the group ate together.  It was a pleasant experience.

Thank you to my fellow Yelpers for reccomending this place. It's great to go on a romantic date, has great dim lighting, beautiful chandelier in the center of the room, makes you feel like if you were in somebody's house.

I wanted to try everything so we mainly got appetizers and one entree. We ordered Lobster bisque, which came with onion crisps and a dollop sour cream, which honestly i think the lobster bisque was fine by itself and didnt need all those extras. My favorite part about the calamari was the marinara sauce. Truffle fries were great but i did think the garlic chunks were kind of big. I couldn't get enough of the Clam Linguini with a light cream sauce, that was definitely my favorite dish.

The drink i ordered was the Cumcumber Frenh, a mix of gin, champagne and cucumber juice, very refreshing.

I definitely would recomend this place to anyone but please make sure you know u are going into a romantic setting, so you can be aware and prepared to look nice for your date.
Okay food. Have gone a few times and it was never busy. And despite not being busy the service was super slow. Kept trying to give it another shot being that it's cute. But not going to go back.

This place was recommended to me by a homie. Took my girl here for a date. Very classy, fancy looking with a ballroom-ish decor. Was greeted by a server and seated right away. The menu is awesome! Food is not that pricey and they have food for the kids. Ordered appetizers and main course. Appetizers came literally 8min after order which was excellent. Not too early not too late. Then the food came, wow. Got the pork chops, and it was the juiciest pork chops I've ever had. Wife got the clam linguine and hers was splendid as well. Definitely coming back and I definitely recommend!!
