I can't believe I live next to this place and have not tried them until recently. Both visits to this restaurant far exceeded expectations. First off the decor is stunning with plush tufted classic furniture and a giant crystal chandelier... Very nice. Both times we arrived late night and were sat in the bar area which is very inviting and open. Both times we got a man with long dark shaggy hair waiting on us, I wish I caught his name because this man truly understands customer service. Polite, courteous, and attentive are just a few ways to describe the service here. The food is excellent. The pastas are mouth watering and I can't leave without getting the salmon crustinis! This place is sure to leave you with a full stomach without breaking the bank. Give them a try!

A friend recommended we try this place because the pasta is amazing and sure enough, it was!

I tried the cheese and spinach ravioli with Alfredo sauce and asked for A LOT of cheese on top. I love cheese. There's 7 huge ravioli and it is filing. I had to take it home, but the ravioli was amazing! My friend got the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta and I just might have to try it next time.

The atmosphere is super cute and aesthetically pleasing. I love the chandeliers the most! It's a huge restaurant and if you're having big parties, they have a lot of room to host.

The Sparklings is conveniently located around the corner from my home.  The decor reminds me of the tiny blue box from Tiffany's signifying class and elegance.  However this restaurant isn't pretentious whatsoever.  Dress up or go business casual. The food is really good...I have ordered the shrimp Po boy sandwich and the Cajun pasta before.  The flour less chocolate cake with raspberry is simply divine!  Oh and Andy is the best! This place is like Cheers where everybody knows your name. :)

My boyfriend & I tried this place for the first time after driving by it so many times! We live around the corner & decided to meet friends from out of town. I got the spaghetti with mushroom & bacon cream sauce, my boyfriend got the chicken parmigiana & our son got chicken fingers with fries.. I love that they had a kids menu as well! 

Everything was delicious & we will def go back soon to try more of the appetizers & dinner options! Tyler was our waiter & he was def a great server to add to our delightful dinner!

Average food, and small portions. Food servers not so inviting and always took a while to get their attention even when trying to pay the bill. 1st time I ate dinner at the bar, the Bartender was absolutely rude to my boyfriend when he asked about military discount. Bartender said why should we honor that (sarcasticaly). My boyfriend was so mad he didn't order a thing and was really offended. Thought I'd try again with my best friend, food was average, small portion again and the clam linguine was very bland. Not sure I'd go back, as I tried twice.

I heard so many great things about this place. The reviews and photos of the food made it "must try" in my Yelp bookmarks. The food definitely did not disappoint. The service, on the other hand, was not the best. Having worked in the service industry in the past, I can understand how a short staff can really hurt service, so I was sympathetic to the fact that they were down a few people. When the crowd finally thinned out, however, we were still left wondering when someone would come and bring the check. As the last patrons in the dining area, we were still somewhat over looked. At one point, we observed the staff sitting at a table doing their side work. Not cool. Nobody was rude, they just didn't match service with atmosphere and food quality. That's a shame too because I'd love to tell people to give this place more business. If they are not staffed well enough to take care of their patrons, I can't safely say the trip would be worth it. Unless you're just a foodie without high expectations for service. 

As far as the food goes, the tartar was tasty. The flatbread was fulfilling. The scallops were scrumptious. The spaghetti with mushroom and bacon cream sauce was sinfully satisfying. So good, in fact, that one of the people I was dining with, after eating her meal, ordered a plate for herself. 

In summary:
Go for the AMAZING food, but be prepared for mediocre service.

We called on Feb 12th to make a reservation for Valentine's Day and were told that thwy wont take our reservation, because they want to allow walk-ins. My boyfriend told them that we want to come for dinner around 5pm and was told that it wont be a problem, we would be seated right away.  However when we got here today at 5pm, we were told that the whole dining room was reserved and there were no more tables.  Thank you for lying to us, we will take our business someplace else.

When you live in Mountain Edge community and you want great nearby restaurant to eat, there are very few choices. One day, I went on Yelp and search for good nearby restaurant to eat, the Sparklings restaurant popped up and here we went.

When I walked in, I met the co-owner who used to manage the Oyshi restaurant located a couple blocks down the road. We went there during peak dinner time on the weekend but the restaurant wasn't crowded, but that could be because the restaurant has only been opened for a few months. There was a lot of people at the bar though.

Anyway, the place was nice and clean and the service was top notch. I looked at the menu and the prices are not cheap, kind of on the mid-tier level. Anyway, we ordered some appetizers and some entrees and here are our takes on it:

All the appetizers we ordered were excellent. The grape flatbread was "da bomb" and so was the grilled octopus and the scallops. We wanted to eat more of them after we devoured all in a very short time. As for the entrees, let just say that we were disappointed after starting out so well with the appetizers.

The steak was overcooked and dried, the spicy seafood pasty was kind of bland and under-seasoned and not spicy at all. 

Overall, it's decent and close to my house and that's why the 3 stars. I will come back but most likely I will just order the appetizers, especially the flatbread, and not the entrees.

We came here one night after ice skating, starving! And we were seated right away and the service was quick and efficient. 

We ordered the scallops as appetizers and they were served in less than 10 minutes. They were DELICIOUS! There were 6 of them, 3 of them being normal scallops but the other 3 had sweet rice in them; it was so different I loved them. 
Our meals arrived shortly after finishing the scallops. I ordered the Jambalaya and my friend ordered the spicy seafood pasta. They were both filling yet super flavorful. I loved them both. 

The Crème brûlée was just blissful. It was just perfect.

The ambiance was very comforting. They have couches and comfy chairs instead of normal chairs and I really liked how the restaurant was set up. Our server Tyler, was kind, quick, efficient and very helpful. 5/5, I will definitely be back and would definitely recommend this place to my friends!

Came here with a buddy one night on a whim, and it turned out to be a great decision.  Though we were a little under dressed just coming from the gym staff was friendly an cordial. Service was great and the food was delicious prices were reasonable and the ambiance of the place was fantastic. I will be frequenting this place quite often.

Decent concept but the food is rather bland, the decor and environment are very "cold" and uninviting. The prices are too high for what you get.

The gnocci was good and the service was good both times I went but the rest of the food was very bland and/or rubbery.

Sucks because we need more restaurants in the SW, especially privately owned ones.

Sparklings the name says it all...The atmosphere is very relaxing, after a long day of work.... The food is outstanding personal favorites the rice au gratin with jalapeños and crispy gnocchi. The waiters, bartenders give off a excellent vibes of customer service

I really like the ambiance of this restaurant. It's so pretty with flowers and a chandelier and the seating is intimate.  

They also have a variety of food to choose from depending on what you are in the mood for.

I started with a drink that had moscato and strawberries in it along with vodka. I thought it would be really sweet and it surprisingly was not. I enjoyed it more on this fact because I don't like when things are too sweet. 

We ordered the cheese platter which was really good. I wish I was more hungry because I would have enjoyed it more. I really want to go back to get this. They had such a variety. My favorite was of course the Brie. They also had honey to go along with it and some fruit. 

I ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce because I was craving Italian and it was really good. I had leftovers so I was given another chance to enjoy it. 

I'd like to come back just for drinks and a appetizer next time. A chance to enjoy the food but not get overly full and enjoy the atmosphere.

GREAT! GREAT! GREAT!!   Awesome hidden gem in LV.  Great food, good service, decently priced, beautiful restaurant, great for groups.  I was surprised when I walked in because I didn't expect it to look like that.

A month ago I called around 430pm to make a reservation for my husband and I for dinner. The gentleman answering the phone assured me that we did not need a reservation, that they could seat us as we arrived (which would only be 15 minutes out). When we arrived, however, we were told there would be a 45 minute wait because a party (without a reservation) came in. Granted we did not have a reservation although when I called the hostess said it was not necessary. We walked out promising never to return. 

We did return. I love the decor of the restaurant and really wanted to love this place. Tonight we arrived and sat in the bar area. We waited 15 minutes for drinks. We waited nearly a half hour for our appetizers and our entrees arrived almost immediately after. Our waiter only returned once throughout our dinner and I had to ask for the check. 

The food was mediocre. We absolutely will not be returning (I promise) and we will not be recommending this place to anyone.

Delicious food, great service. Our only complaint was the menu was very limited. They worked to tailor a house salad. One in my group had the salmon and loved it, would like to try that recipe with chicken. Definitely going back!
Best service & drinks. Jose the bartender & Andy the owner and the sweetest. Come here and you'll understand.  Here 4-7 days a week.  I'm a regular. And  never a regular anywhere.

We came in on Friday night for date night, not really sure what to expect except what we had read on Yelp. It was pretty busy so we couldn't get a seat in the bar area. The dining room was busy too so we grabbed a drink while we waited for a table to open up. It took about 10 minutes to get a drink, and by that time a table had opened up for us. Our server, Clayton, was super nice even though he seemed a bit frantic. 

We ordered crispy gnocchi, bacon-wrapped meatballs, spicy seafood pasta and the short ribs. Everything was fantastic, except the pasta was JUST OK. It was good, it just tasted like something I could easily make at home and there wasn't that much seafood in it. 

The ambiance is a bit strange. It's beautiful inside, but also kind of weird at the same time. The decor doesn't completely mesh, but somehow it's still cozy. I will say though, they should turn the music up a notch and dim the lights a notch as well. 

For our drinks, we ordered the bourbon mule, which I surprisingly liked even more than the vodka version, moscow mule. Clayton never left us hanging and checked on us JUST enough. At the end of the meal, our bill was about $75, which is not bad at all. We will definitely be coming back but we decided this is more of a hang out in the lounge and order a few drinks and food items from the apps list, not so much a romantic dinner type place.

This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  I always take my family/friends here when they visit.  The prices are reasonable and love the food and design of the place.  The staff is awesome too and every time I go I get the same thing (Turkey Cranberry Sandwich) and they remember my order every time.  Go try it and it'll be your new favorite place too.
This is such a nice place with an awesome atmosphere and vibe. Angel the bartender is the best and is such a fun guy make sure to find him!

I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile and glad I finally did. We went a little later so the dining room was fairly empty, but the bar area was busy. We grabbed a few of the appetizers I saw lots of reviews for. The gnocchi was great and the bacon and date wrapped meatballs. Wish the wine list would have had a little more options. Will definitely be back and maybe sit in the dining room area.

A new hidden treasure in the southwest.  It's right next to chee burger chee burger, the quality is outstanding, the decor makes you feel right at home. Their food is fantastic for a very reasonable cost. We had the date, bacon meatball that was out of this world, the sauce was not yoo sweet and not too salty. We also had the seafood pasta which was loaded with seafood unlike a lot of  places, it was pushed with shrimp, scallops, clans, mussels, and had a nice spicy kick to it.

My friend girls and I met last night at this surprisingly casual yet upscale restaurant for dinner and drinks. The decor is super modern with bold vibrant colors. 

Five star worthy, regrettably their restroom needs some serious help. The restroom was filthy not to mention your unable to lock the door. It appeared to be a quiet evening as well.

Aside from the restroom issue the remainder of the evening was relaxing. The service was fast and efficient, the menu is very diverse, the food was amazing lots of delightful flavors and did I mention how inexpensive this restaurant is? #WalletFriendly

Cheese & Spinach Ravioli $11 (The Alfredo sauce is nice and creamy)
Truffle Corn $7 Omg! My absolute fave!
Zucchini Stick $5 Crispy & Hot just how they should be!
Cheese Plate $11 The raspberry sauce is the highlight of the platter. So yummy!
Grapes & Arugula Flatbread $9 Deliciousness 
Calamari $10 The calamari didn't knock my socks like I hoped! Skip it...
Asian Chicken Salad $8
Steak Diane $19 Steak was cook well beyond the medium rare request but my friend enjoyed it.

$115+ Tip Including Sangria & Mojitos! Of course I'll be back.

WOW.
Was my first thought as I walked in.
Atmosphere is amazing. 
Cozy. Warm. 
Anthony helped me, as a first timer, through the menu, and his recommendations were SPOT on.
Food and Service are TOP-NOTCH.
COME HERE.
Great food!! beautiful resturant... Great service/cocktails made the right way very impressed bacon wrapped meatballs were awesome
Such a great place. Really good food! Amazing customer service. Ambiance is top notch! Will be back!

We have been here a few times now and I have to say I think the sparklings could bump it up a notch. The food is good, not excellent. The Bloody Mary beef skewers were good. The half rack of ribs were good, the sides were ok, the steak Diane was good, the grilled vegs were good. And we had the flourless chocolate cake, it was ok, didn't have any fresh berries on it... all too meh.... 
The service was good. Had to wait a bit long for our waiter to take our drink order, the busser seemed to pick up were he was too busy.
The ambience is ok. Too bright for dinner in the dinning room and not cozy. Stale shabby chic. The restroom also not very clean and run down.
They do have a good selection of beer on tap and some decent wines, but dang, way over priced! I guess that's why you just come here for happy hour.
If we do go back it will be just for the bar happy hour and not a special occasion.
Delicious food, great service! Atmosphere is perfect.  A few details away from being gourmet! Highly recommend!

We have been here twice since moving to this side of town and such a cute place. Food both times was great. Today we were hosted as a large group must have been about 40 of us doing a special brunch at the bar and the sat on the patio. What an amazing crew they have. The food was laid out on the bar, delicious selections and I think they are now my favorite place for Bloody Mary's.

The Sparklings is one of the newer restaurants to have opened in the southwest area, courtesy of the owners of Soyo and Oyshi, which are just down the road.  Walking in, it's hard to not be impressed with the dramatic transformation this space has taken.  I almost felt a bit under dressed with the ornate chandelier dominating the open eating area and a bit concerned pushing my stroller in with a crying baby inside. We had our choice of seating and opted for a corner spot to minimize any distractions.  (I noticed the generous amount of high chairs available, which to me encourages a family-friendly restaurant.)

With a quick glance at the menu, we ended up just ordering appetizers.

* Crispy Gnocchi "creamy pesto, Italian sausage, peas, crushed candied walnuts" ($7.50) - This was good, worthy of making this a meal by ordering two. (Update! I actually did this the following week and it was too much for one person. It's pretty rich, and two orders to yourself is quite a bit. And my gnocchi wasn't as 'crispy' this time. In retrospect, 'crispy' may be a bit misleading. It's more 'browned' than 'crispy'. Nonetheless, it wasn't as 'browned' in the to go order.)

* Grilled Octopus "soy marinated" ($7) - Three little octupi sat on the plate along with some greens.  I like grilled octopus in general, so we liked this dish.  It can be a bit daunting for those not wanting to see the head of a baby octopus.

* Seared Diver Scallops "lemon beurre blanc" ($7.50) - I didn't realize this dish had other items on it besides scallops, so was confused by the texture in my mouth when I thought I eating scallop. I guess along with the scallops were tater tot like disks.  The sauce was a bit fruity.

* Truffle Parmesan Fries "sea salt, parsley, lemon garlic sauce" ($6) - It came with two dipping sauces and the chunks of garlic were falling off.

* Portobello Fries "lightly breaded" ($6) - This also came with two dipping sauces.

* Roasted Beet and Apple Salad "arugula, candied walnuts, balsamic vinaigrette" ($8) - We like beet salads, but it seemed like this salad missed a little something.  They did shave some Parmesan cheese on there, but maybe it needed more nuts?

* Clam Linguini "surf clams, roasted garlic, garden herbs, Italian parsley & white wine extra virgin olive oil broth" ($13) - We took this dish to go for my mom.  She's a big fan of clam linguine and the first thing she noticed was the amount of clams.  She gobbled up the dish and even saved the sauce for the next day.  (She said it was good, but there wasn't enough for the price.) (Update! The Husband obviously liked what he saw when we ordered this for my mom. So the following week he got an order to go!)

Service - The staff were attentive, perhaps even too attentive.  I appreciate more than less, so I can't complain too much.  The restaurant wasn't busy, so they were coming around a lot to ask how things were and if we wanted to order more.  The owner (one of the partners) came around to see how we were doing too. I appreciate when the owners take an active part in their new business ventures because it can show a genuine interest in their clientele, especially if they become regulars.  He mentioned that this was a family-friendly restaurant, which we do appreciate (and noticed a kids' menu available too).

Overall, we like The Sparklings but are a bit confused.  It's very upscale in appearance, but a mix of casual in the menu.  I think they can actually expand on the menu a bit more, and perhaps they will with time.  But for the time being, we just couldn't find anything in the entrees that interested us.  (Items ranged from sandwiches like Philly Cheese Steak ($8.50) and Shrimp Po Boy ($8.50) to pastas, salmon and meats, ie. Rib-Eye Steak ($25) and Filet Mignon ($25).

They do offer a happy hour in the lounge/bar area from 5 pm to 10 pm daily, which means discounted drinks.  Only those over 21 years of age allowed into the restaurant after 11 pm.

we went there on a Saturday night for a late night dinner because my daughter got off work late on her birthday. We had the server Tim and he was very nice and helpful. It had a nice amount of people there and nothing took too long either. The food was good and the drinks (my daughter turned 21) were good, too. My daughter isn't a drinker so she didn't know what to order and Tim was spot on and was patient about the whole thing. I think it's great!! Only one disappointment was when I asked about other locations that the owner has, they told me only on that side of town, not on the northwest side where I live. :( but maybe and hopefully they will open one by centennial hills. :)

We finally got the chance to try it out tonight and so glad that we did! This is a hidden gem in the desert and I would highly recommend checking it out.

Atmosphere was classy and relaxing. The waiters menu suggestions and attentiveness to our needs were right on the mark. We ordered their house salad to start and two dinner entrees; short ribs and the cajun shrimp pasta. Mmmmmm,both were so good! We'll definitely be back.

This place would get better ratings if the bartender didn't have such a catty rude attitude. Also, the drinks are not made consistently. Should probably consider having two bartenders before 9pm since the current one can't seem to keep up with everyone, drink wait time is way too long for the lack of bodies in the building.
I absolutely love this place!! It has the cutest decor and an amazing menu! I recon s the cheese platter to share and the raspberry mojito!!

I loved our dining experience here. My husband and I moved here from Chicago and feel like it's truly difficult to find nice restaurants in the neighborhood without having to go downtown. You're left with a lot of chains in the suburbs, but the Sparklings really hit the mark on food quality and service. 

      Now, when we go out, it's typically just the two of us. We also make reservations in advance, and overall try to avoid the peak times. These are all things that are simply common sense if you want to ensure expedient service. 

 If you go in a big party, your food will take longer, because of all the orders from your table being made, this isn't a chain with prepackaged foods, that's why you came here instead of your local Outback or whatever.

       If you didn't make a reservation, and walk in on a Friday night, you're going to have to wait for a table. 

If you come in on Sunday morning for bottomless mimosas like every other Becky in the restaurant, don't expect it to be refilled the instant you  guzzle that bottom of the barrel champagne because "you want to get your moneys worth". 

Now I'll admit, there are places I'll never return to based on repetitive occurrences of poor quality, or just absolutely abysmal service,  but reading some the 1 star reviews, I can not believe the entitlement.

Most of the reviewers that give 1 star I find, basically always give 1 star.

Honestly, you can't take anyone serious who has more than half of their reviews being 1 star. 

Like, if you always have a bad service experience when you go out, look at the common denominator! 
What's the x factor? Find a mirror and see that the problem is you. 

Rant over. 

But really, if you want something delicious and different, try this place for sure.

Jose the bartender is great! Very funny, entertaining and accommodating. I love that this place is open late and has a very solid food selection. I recommend the ahi tuna, crispy gnocchi and flatbread. Everything else looks good as well. They have nice decor and a very chill relaxing vibe in the bar area. Good music!

Food was great! Service was spectacular! We had a birthday dinner here and they set us up in a private room. The decor is quaint and cute.  Loved the steak and Chicken Cajun shrimp, delicious! They made my son feel so special on his bday! We will be back for many more dinners.

Unusual restaurant in a usual location. A place for "locals", and usually very busy late at night. Food's always great. The shepherd pie is a pure pleasure and real delicious. We always sitting at the bar and have a blast with the bar tenders. You will become a regular, just like us :)

Great food but we sat at the bar to take advantage of the 30% off happy hour drinks and I have to say that the service was way below average. There were 3 people in our party and 2 were served our meals with the last person in the party never getting his meal. We waited and waited and waited for the waiter to come back and let us know something about our 3rd persons meal. When he didn't appear, we approached the bar ourselves. He assured us the meal had been ordered and would be out soon. The meal finally shows up, as the rest of the parties empty dishes were being cleared. When requesting other items that should've came with the meal, we waited another 15 minutes. Check out process was another 20 mins.. Probably won't be back. Sad because I had high hopes for this place.

Came in for my birthday and was so surprised by the amazing service and incredible food! This is definitely a hidden gem. The manager was so amazing, he got us free birthday shots and the gourmet food was so underpriced (good for everyone) because the sparklings food is incredible!!!!! Everyone must come here!

A group of us friends were having a epic night but still weren't ready to part and ended up at the bar side of the Sparklings. 

Everytime I hear this name it sounds like I'm going to a Barbie and Ken esque couples house and really, the decor is the right amount of homey chic that I would like to believe it so. 

Despite me being too full to try the amazing looking food, the comments from friends were more than positive. It was happy hour which had drink and food specials from 10pm to close (2am - ish). Our server/bartender, Jose, was also such a personality and was absolutely a sweetheart. 

I wish this was in the NW close to me instead as it's a beautiful spot to hang out late night, and a lovely place to eat during day. It looks like a typical neighborhood lodge bar from the outside, but it totally isn't and doesn't serve plain ole' bar food. 

I will be back very soon, for a full dinner. But for late night, this place is a absolutely great spot.

SUPER chic and modern.. with drive thru prices.  Love this place.  A few items have small portions... but still a great place to throw company events and parties for a reasonable price. Andy hooked us up with special menu services and made sure his staff knew my price range and expectations for my company party of 25 employees.  Although they spent most of the time at the bar lol

The food, atmosphere, service AND owner are truly great!

I have only been here twice.  The first was for my brothers rehearsal dinner before his wedding. And the second was this past weekend for a luncheon following my nephews baptism.

Both times the food, service, and atmosphere were amazing!

Andy, the owner gave my brother and sister-in-law a great meal and reasonably priced for a large group!


The only bummer part is that I live so far or I would come more often.

I went for happy hour and we had dinner at the bar. I had ravioli and a house salad which was fabulous. My friend had some sort of pasta with white sauce and shrimp tempura of which she said was really good. Had some great wine at happy hour prices and it was all fantastic. We also had great service on a Tuesday eve. Can't remember her name but she was great. Will be back very soon. Looking forward to a sit down dinner which was decorated so nicely in that area. If not dinner their wkd breakfast/brunch looked really good too. Nice to eat at a non gaming establishment.

The sparklings is definitely a little gem in south las vegas the food there is just superb!! Ive ordered twice to go and they haven't done me wrong yet cant wait to take my girlfriemds for a girls night!! The atmosphere is a modern feel with big booths and a beautiful chandelier centerpiece to definlty set the mood! Till next tiime ... Cant wait!

My wife and I decided to try this restaurant.  The decor is very contemporary and had a romantic feel. The bar is separated from the dining room. We tried the grape, arugula, and goat cheese flat bread, crispy gnocchi, braised short ribs, and chicken parmigiano.  Everything was delicious. I do recommend the gnocchi and the ribs over all other dishes.

Beautiful atmosphere! Great for date night, girls night, family dinner or a beautiful brunch. The food was delicious and fresh, definitely can't wait to go back on our next trip to Vegas.  It's off the strip, but for sure worth the quick detour, so please don't let the location keep you from trying out this hidden gem.

"I'm not in the mood for a Crystal, Diamond, Amber, or Jade at Sapphire.  No, not my Destiny."  I say to laughs from the guys and one "you're a pig" from the lone female in our group.

"You have to call me that because you're a girl". I giggle.  "Oooh, and I want food".

"Fine" she continues.  "let's go to Sparklings".

"Oooh Sparklings". I coo, more laughter from the guys.

"It's not that kind of place... pig" she concludes.

Contemporary meets country sheik.  With it's strong feminine vibe, it's the perfect place for a local, ladies night out.  Guys, you'll understand the appeal.

The food leans towards sensibly portioned Cali cuisine with just right amount of bad for the health to be Vegas.  The classic bacon wrapped dates becomes a delicious bacon wrapped meatball with dates.  No longer bite size, the ground meat a little dry in texture but the combination with the tomato sauce is very good.

Continuing with starters, a warm flatbread smeared with ricotta cheese and overloaded with arugula, halved seedless grapes, and candied walnuts then drizzled with a balsamic reduction is well executed.  A salad you can hold with the right contrast of sweetness to tangy cheese, crunch to tender, bitter greens.  The other standout is the crispy gnocchi served in a pea pure, creamed pesto with bits of Italian sausage and crushed candied walnuts.  Again, it strikes a great textural balance.  The brown butter sage gnocchi is also worthy.  The fries miss the mark.  The Truffle Parm taste of synthetic truffle oil, the Portobello fries, soggy, and the zucchini sticks overly crisp on the outside, overcooked and wet on the inside.

Small list of mains including a loco moco with demi instead of brown gravy (win!)  Tried all, no real standout, no real complaints.

Good, off Strip service.  Very fair prices.

I left feeling happier than a pig in... you get the idea.

Love it!! First went here for my birthday back in January and have been a fan ever since! The atmosphere and decor is the first thing I noticed! Very intimate setting the provides a great feel. 

The prices are so reasonable along with the healthy portions of food! I love the Chicken Parmesan and my boyfriend first got the short ribs. The meat was so tender it fell of the bone! 

The happy hour is also a must do. Can't beat half off drinks right? I also love the management! He remembered us from the first time we came and genuinely cares about his customers and making sure they have a great experience! I highly recommend coming for any occasion; birthday, graduation, impromptu date night. It's a great spot you'll keep coming back to!

Looking from the outside, it looks like a typical bar food type restaurant. However, the inside is surprisingly spacious and inviting. Coming from an italian family, with amazing cooks, i can say that this is great italian food, with a twist. I had the tempura shrimp mushroom pasta and the sauce was perfect.
Love this place! If you eat here, sit in Jason's section, he's great. Good food, great service, and good price. Definitely recommend this place.

Came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday night. Absolutely amazing! Loved the caprese salad, spaghetti and meatballs and the trio! The creme brûlée is life! Great service, gorgeous decor. LA in Vegas. Thank you Jesus! :) Definitely coming again.

We used to come here all the time,  but the service and food quality have both gone down a lot.  The last few times we've come,  there is a tall Asian manager that we hadn't seen before.   Since we've started seeing him, the bar staff seem to be absolutely miserable and always fighting about stuff. They're also obviously annoyed at the kitchen who keep screwing up customer orders which get delivered by food runners to tables as soon as they're ready.... Even if a table orders 2 large dishes to eat as mains.   

Last 2 times we came,  one of us was done our meal before the second one was even delivered.   Nobody noticed, nobody made sure that the person waiting at least had a drink,  and the food was nowhere as good as it used to be.   

We won't be returning.



Former 5 star review: 

Amazing food.  The dining room is way too bright, but the bar area is fantastic.  Since we sit at the bar, we will be back for sure!!!
Great new place. Some unique food options (both gnocci dishes are great). Good bar service and happy hour.

I absolutely love The Sparklings! It's such a cute and modern space. They hose bridal showers and baby showers. The French toast is amazing, the tomato basil soup is so delicious but my favorite is the seafood ravioli! They provide different sauce options for it and it's so creamy and good! I love Sparklings I'll definitely go back a million times more.

5 stars for: food, drink, decor, ambiance, and Andy! First time meeting the owner but he was awesome. My friend that had an event at this restaurant introduced him and he was accommodating not only to her, but a lot of the guests. I overheard a lot of people calling out to say hello to him. I wish this place well, because it seems like everyone, staff and clientele are all happy in there.
Love this place!!!! Food freshley made  drink are bomb. Staff amazing. Quit and personal. Always fresh food.

Food was 4 star..
The service and the interior design was 5 star..
If they had happy hour or some specials would be nice

Went Sunday  evening for dinner around 6pm.  Hardly anyone in the restaurant  but the bar seemed steady.  The ambiance  and decor was awesome.  Great chandelier in the center and cool velvet seating.  The service was slow. Seemed to be one waiter handling  the whole restaurant the entire time we were there.  We ordered rib kabobs and the Irish nachos as an appetizer. The nachos left much to be desired but the kabobs  were delicious. It took awhile  to get our appetizers out but the main dishes came out in good timing afterwards.  Our table ordered tempura shrimp and mushroom pasta, steak Diane and the chicken pasta with creamy bacon sauce.  The pasta  was cooked beautifully, you can tell it was freshly made as it was thick and dense.  The sauce was flavorful  and the veggies fresh.  The steak medallions  were tender and the sauce was very flavorful.   After dinner, my wife visited the ladies room and she said the bathrooms were filthy.  Water all over the counters, soap dripped all over the sink and floor, paper  towels on the ground... obviously those bathrooms had not been tidied up all day.  Despite the bathrooms and somewhat slow service, the food was great and we definitely will return.

If Anthropology and a restaurant had a baby then this would be that place.

Location: Near the cross streets rainbow and windmill. This place is a literal "don't judge a book from its cover". It seems like an old casual place from the outside, but the inside is a different story. It's decorated very elegantly without it being over bearing. 

Vibe: Great place to catch up with that friend you haven't seen in a awhile. Intimate but not too romantic. 

Customer service & food: Service at the tables have always been okay, the bar on the other hand does a stellar job keeping the guest entertained. I'm a boring BEWB and tend to stick with the sandwiches. Pretty solid stuff. Their gnocchi's on the other hand are superb and always a staple when I eat here. 

Protip: Don't be afraid to lounge and eat in the bar area! :) definitely gives off a good vibe there.
Great service!..I just tried appetizers and they were yummy..I tried zucchini fries, the scallops and gnocchi..they were all pretty good

It was my first time trying this place. Me and my fiance' both loved it and will be returning often.  The appetizer menu is so good we never even ordered an entree. Great place for a formal meal or just some drinks and tapas.

I think this place has a lot of potential but there is one bartender that works there with long black spiked hair that if he's working my girl and I will leave and go somewhere else. On our last visit I got to the bar ahead of my girl and proceeded to order 2 drinks, 2 waters and an appetizer and was told by this guy to "take it easy"!!! When he said it I was totally shocked because I work in the industry and have nothing but respect for my fellow industry people and have never been spoken to like that. He also never gave us our water and had to ask for it from what looked to be the barback who was very nice. They should consider swapping jobs. I told my girl what had happened and instead of sticking around for another drink we left for a different bar. I still left him a 30% tip even tho he didn't deserve it but we will not go back if he's working. We actually was just there a few nights earlier and had a much better experience from a better bartender.

In my humble opinion, the prices are a tiny bit steep here for the portion sizes... but the service at the bar is always spot on and the food is good. The cocktails are really good and we have had the same bartender all three times. I love a bartender that will chat and this guy rocks. We really enjoy hanging out here even if it is only for an hour or so after a long night out. We will continue to stop here for night caps.

incredible. wonderful place. we were there on valentine's day and it was probably their first super busy night. staff was amazing. i ordered the salmon - it was the best salmon i have ever had. and i've eaten a lot of good salmon.
we had a large group and i called a couple of weeks ahead to reserve their party room (seats 12). the room was just as lovely as the rest of the place with chandeliers and comfortable seating. 
our whole group of 12 was quite impressed with the food. steaks were large and looked wonderful. my husband had the grilled veggie sandwich and said it was really good. we both had some sweet potato fries and they were delicious. 
i didn't order dessert - but others in our party did and said they were great. 
our server was very accommodating. they let us decorate the room and do whatever we needed for our group. 
can't say enough good things about this place!

What a cute little place for a fun dinner. They have a great bar atmosphere as well.
We had the meatballs and the skewers, the salmon and the steak between our group of 6.
Everyone was happy and the table was so cute..
We will be going back and maybe even just head to the bar sometimes for drinks.
The happy hour was 30% off drinks.. YAY

This place is off the beaten path, but worth a look. The decor is New York Soho Chic. Country French atmosphere with wide open spacing, high exposed ceilings and central chandelier. comfortable booths and cozy banquet seating. Also, great for really large parties.

The menu is eclectic with a wide variety of choices. Love that it's very reasonable too. Staff friendly and relaxed atmosphere.

I need to share my unfortunate experience at Sparklings so everyone is aware.
I visited Sparklings for the first time on 4/26/18. I sat at the bar and ordered wine and a few vegetarian appetizers, one of which was spinach and cheese ravioli (I am a vegetarian). When the food was brought out, it all looked good and I was excited to try it. I had a bite of the ravioli and immediately thought that something was wrong and indeed it was. They had brought shrimp ravioli to a vegetarian! So this was my very 1st time ever having shrimp. Not only was I furious about the kitchen mistake, but I also got an allergic reaction a few minutes after that bite! There was no managers at the restaurant. However, the bartender was very attentive and sincerely concerned which I appreciated. He took care of the check. I left, bought some benadryl from the nearby store and called it a night. Luckily for the restaurant, the allergic reaction was not bad, otherwise I would have taken legal actions. I will never go back!

+some constructive criticism... the place looks very nice but the bathrooms are disgusting! The food and wine selection is good but the wine list doesn't have info about the region and year of the wines (which is essential for a wine list). And again, train the kitchen staff to take food orders and dietary restrictions seriously.

I went there on a Saturday night and it was very busy. There is no waiting area except for the small bar which was full as well. 

After waiting quite awhile to get sat (our fault-no reservations) our server immediately welcomed us. 

The service was good, but the food was sub-par. It was just ok. I expected to be wowed. I wasn't. After a long wait and so much hype...I was disappointed.

Love love LOVE this place! The service is great, the people are friendly and the food is delicious. The decor inside is so well designed and the high ceilings add to the amazing ambiance. The music is never too loud either so it's a great place to catch up with friends. Highly recommend this place for locals (tourists too :)) looking for a relaxing evening out.

My boyfriend and I went to The Sparklings tonight for dinner. We ordered the gnocchi and the caprese salad as our appetizer, delicious. I ordered the Jambalaya and he ordered the Ribs which were a special for the day. They were both nice and tasty. Our waiter Tyler was a doll. We were celebrating my bf birthday and they treated us to a free dessert. We are definitely making this our once a month date night place. Love love love the sparklings!!

Great brunch spot in the southwest.  Today my friend and I decided to partake in sparklings and we arrived around 1:40 p.m. and it was virtually empty so I guess we missed the brunch Rush. However the food was really delicious. I had the chicken and waffles and my friend had the open-faced chicken sandwich which we both thoroughly enjoyed. It's semi hard to find  a brunch establishment around town who can effectively make a good chicken and waffle, which included a full size Belgian waffle and perfectly seasoned chicken that wasn't overcooked or undercooked. The servers were very friendly and prompt and their bottomless mimosas for $36 was a great way for us to extend our brunch. Overall, I say go check this place out.

I think the best thing is about this place is the decor. It's super cute and spacious! The chandelier definitely sets the tone and I love the oversized flower arrangement under it. We came in after church and ordered the BBQ wings, Brussel sprouts and pancetta, and the jambalaya. It was flavorful and the portions were big enough to share. My son enjoyed his kids meal, bow tie with cream sauce, which was surprisingly good that he ate it all. The restaurant wasn't busy so I expected the server to be more attentive than he was. Maybe it's because we didn't do bottomless? Whatever it was, the basic filling the water and asking if we needed anything was prolonged than usual experiences. Overall, I'd like to come back in the near future to do bottomless and eat some of their other dishes.
Love there's a classy restaurant and bar in the SW. Enjoy seeing familiar faces every time we go in. Restaurants like this are rare in Vegas.

This is the kind of place that you can drive past for years and never realize it's there. On the outside, it looks like just another nondescript strip-mall restaurant.

The Cosmopolitan-esque chandelier in the main dining room gives The Sparklings a feminine feel. This is the ideal place to host any girlie event--like a bridal shower. They placed our party of 12 in a private room towards the back. 

Our server was very hospitable and engaging, but some of his antics need to be toned down a few notches. He recommended the club sandwich, the grilled chicken sandwich, and the shepherds pie. I ordered the shepherds pie and it did not disappoint.

Don't be deceived by the dull exterior, because like your mother says, "It's what's inside that counts."

This place just LOOKS nice. Olive Garden's & Carrabbas pasta are even better! The worst thing about lunch there was a disgusting FLY ended up on my boyfriend's dish and the only thing they our waiter said was "oh sorry" and replaced it. UHHHHH LOL thanks for getting another dish but what if he got sick? NORMALLY when something like that happens for HEALTH reasons they try to do something to accommodate you but that was not the case here. I've never been so disgusted, just like everyone who gives bad reviews for cockroaches in their food, this is one of those reviews. Will never be coming back here, gave it 2 stars for the decor inside the restaurant.

Try all of the appetizers! Nice staff, gorgeous interior.
A must are the bacon & date wrapped meatballs.

A somewhat strange, but overall intriguing restaurant.

Environment: Personally, I find the environment and ambience of this restaurant particularly strange. The exterior is fashioned to look somewhat like a lodge, while the interior could not be any more different. The floorplan is very open, with some strange booth areas in the back as well as a somewhat separate bar/lounge area. However, the whole interior seems to be modeled to look kind of like a big living room or lobby, with the tables placed in the center of the open area. Overall, while the interior decorating does seem a little strange it is oddly inviting, and offers ample place for larger groups to have room without bothering smaller parties.

Food: The food style is American fusion with some European and Asian influences. Their menu is surprisingly extensive, and I was pleasantly surprised when I went in for brunch and we were also allowed to order from the regular and dinner menus. From the brunch menu, the short rib hash was delicious, despite the hollandaise which I typically do not like, but with this dish it fit perfectly. Additionally, we tried the tuna tartare which was very fresh and came mixed with cubes of mango which was very refreshing, baby octopus (which was one of my favorites), as well as the Brussel sprouts. Additionally, the bottomless mimosas are a great deal, as they leave the pitcher with you so that you are never waiting for a refill, and the champagne to OJ ratio is very generous, so you do not feel like you are simply drinking juice.

Service: Being a smaller restaurant, they seemed somewhat understaffed, however despite how busy they were I felt like our server was really trying her best and was very accommodating, being sure to refill our mimosa pitcher, waters, and repeatedly checking in to make sure we had everything that we needed.

Just searched brunch in spring valley and this place popped up. From the reviews it seemed pretty awesome.

Walked in but no one was at the host counter.  Waited a long while, and finally a waiter came over and sat us. No big, wasn't very busy but there was a really large party. We sat and got drinks and ordered pretty quickly from there. Then, the wait. I believe we waited around 30-40 minutes for the food to come. They did apologize for the wait and said the kitchen was behind due to the large group, which I get. But that was also like 30 minutes into waiting for the food to come. About 10-15 minutes later, our food arrived. I ordered chicken fried steak from the brunch menu, and my partner ordered a shrimp poor boy sandwich and a side of corn bread.

The chicken fried steak had burnt edges on one side, the other side was fine. It was pretty tough itself. The biscuits underneath it were pretty hockey pucks - seriously hard to cut through with the butter knife provided.  Super chewy too. Flavor was fine though. Then the gravy....it was alright, nothing special, not super creamy either for country gravy. It also had that look of having been sitting out a while too, the gravy had settled and had that plastic sheen dried on top of it.  Whole thing was barely still warm. Definitely a kitchen timing issue after having to get out the meals for the giant group. The shrimp poor boy was alright, nothing special but not bad either. The highlight of the meal was the cornbread actually. It was good, even without butter (it doesn't come with any, so ask I guess if you like to put some on your bread). Really disappointed with the food. =\

All in all, it's a pretty restaurant that's decorated nicely and the waiter was fine, but the wait and cold/burnt food with the rubber biscuit puck was just....not very good. =\ Menu really sounds great too, I would have liked to try some other things, but I probably wouldn't go back.

I went here after a hot, sweaty workout wearing my KD VI's and yoga pants to meet up with a friend who was wearing a suit looking cute as a button. I was definitely under-dressed but I was too hungry to care. We sat at the bar while waiting on our other friend.

We got a booth. The seats were big, nice and comfy. The table has a marble top. The chandelier was so pretty and I love how they have flowers spell out "The Sparklings" in front. 

We shared a bunch of appetizers and a bottle of sparkling wine. Our bartender/server with wild hair seemed abrasive at first but he loosened up quick when my friend called him out and gave him a hard time the whole night. It was pretty hilarious.

Truffle Parmesan Fries:
Comes with ketchup and lemon garlic sauce. The lemon garlic sauce tasted like it had dill in it. The fries were crisp and were a cross between skinny fries and steak fries in terms of thickness and texture. 
 
Bacon and Dates Wrapped Meatball:
I like bacon-wrapped dates. I like good meatballs. But together smothered in marinara, it was a bit strange. I wish the bacon was a bit more crisp. 3/5

Tuna Tartare:
Fresh tuna with avocado and mango cubes.  It comes with crostini. This was alright. 3.5/5

Gorgonzola Flatbread with Honey:
Just like what the name implies - nothing complicated. It's simple yet tasty. Who doesn't like cheese and honey? 3/5

Grapes, Arugula and Ricotta Flatbread:
With candied walnuts and balsamic vinaigrette. This was good. Sweetness and juiciness from the grapes, peppery arugula, mild taste of ricotta and crunch from the walnuts. 4/5

Roasted Beet and Apple Salad:
With arugula, candied walnuts and balsamic vinaigrette. I don't like beets but this was pretty amazing. It looked pretty and the textures were wonderful. Soft beets, crisp apples and walnuts. 4/5

Crispy Gnocchi:
Gnocchi in pesto with Italian sausage, peas and candied walnuts. I love pesto and the sauce was spot on. The gnocchi was not as crispy as I expected. 4/5

Grilled Octopus:
Baby octopus marinated in soy sauce. It has a nice char to it. A different server put our plate of octopus on our table and said "here's your octopuses" which started a short-lived debate. He told us "octopi is actually wrong...I looked it up". Well, octopuses and octopi are both correct, actually      /endtangent. 4.5/5

I didn't feel too under-dressed when I saw some lady wearing booty shorts and sneakers. It would be nice to come back here and next time, I'll wear a dress and my favorite Gucci heels - yes, it's worth seeing my tomboy self die a little.

I want this restaurant to be good because it is so close to our house, but the terrible service consistently outweighs the quality of the food.

We came in on Monday night as a party of 5. There were two other tables occupied and we were told we would need to wait to be seated. It ended up being about 5 minutes before we were seated. 

Water was spilled on our table, our water glasses remained consistently empty, food had to be sent back because it was missing ingredients, and part of our order was forgotten and never provided. Luckily we didn't get charged for it. 

However, the food and sides are all solid. The food is awesome but the service needs a lot of work.

I love it here! Great ambience, decor, food, service, drinks, HAPPY HOUR!!! Andy is a great manager and always remembers me-- treats me like a true regular! =]
And Anthony is the best for sure!!! We come just to visit him sometimes haha.... Take good care of him, y'all.... Just like he takes good care of YOU!


Planning my next social event here. Gotta spread the love and get the name out there for others to share with their friends!

Love the atmosphere. Very laid back and some cool music going. Try the chandelier cocktail it is fantastic. On to food... I had jambalaya which was incredible. We shared some Parmesan fries which were also great. She had the Philly and said it was very good. She really liked the soft bread they use. The waiter was very laid back and knew the menu. Also gave great recommendations. Like the other reviews said it is the hidden gem of Vegas. If you haven't been yet then get on it.

Not much to eat here that's vegetarian, but that's my only small complaint here.  The servers are courteous and attentive, and the whole place has a very fancy atmosphere to it.  It's not stuffy, though - there are couches / lounges on one side of the restaurant, where you can gather 'round with your friends and relax while you're eating; on the other side are traditional tables.  The drinks are fantastic, the food is delicious, and I can't wait to come back again!

It's not just good. It's not just different.... it's good different.

I am always excited when a place in my neighborhood opens. Call me old fashioned, but I've always wanted to be a cozy person that lived in a cozy neighborhood -- and for some reason cozy to me means being a regular at a handful of places that I take visiting friends to and in turn they envy me living in all my glorious coziness.

Ah, I digress.... The Sparklings took FOREVER to open but it was definitely worth the wait --- and NOT what I expected. The interior and ambiance are unmatched. It is not the type of place you'd expect to share a parking lot with Cheeburger Cheeburger. Think cufflinks and caviar...okay maybe that's a stretch but when you walk through the doors, you can't help but be impressed with the decor and detailed interior. Marble top bars, faux leather bar chairs, dim lighting...and the touch of elegance from floor to ceiling.

With that said, it's not the place you'd expect to see 'Shrimp Po Boy' or 'Club Sandwich on the menu....and that's what makes it good.....good different. The prices, menu selection, and ambiance make this a twist that works for me. It could be a formal dinner date on a Wednesday or a casual Friday happy hour.

On my first visit we ordered portobello fries, zucchini sticks, langosta bruschetta, and the bacon & date wrapped meatballs. The bruschetta was delicious and the portobello fries were my least favorite. The meatballs were my husbands favorite... i only had one small bite of it (he didn't SHARE!!) and it was very good. The zucchini sticks were good too but nothing compared to the uniquely flavored creamy bruschetta.

For our entree I had the shrimp po boy.... it came in a triangular shaped loaf filled to the brim with tempura fried shrimp, tangy spread and slaw. It was a great blend of flavors and well executed. My husband had the Philly cheesesteak and he could not stop raving about it. 

When the bill came we felt like we had a steal of a deal. The service was on point. The food presentation was just as elegant as the location and it didn't break the bank. I know the restaurant is in it's honeymoon period but I hope it keeps up the good work.

The owners of Soyo and Oyshi have outdid themselves. The Sparklings is a great new addition to the southwest area. I'm actually having a fancy dinner with friends tonight and you'll never guess where we're going ---this cozy little place in my neighborhood.

p.s. 2nd time side note- my husband and I ordered the chicken parm and the spaghetti with mushroom & bacon cream sauce... not our favorites. Looks like the sandwiches and appetizers are the way to go---at least for now. :)
The restaurant has a nice atmosphere. The food wasn't all that great. Nice for parties if you like the food.

First time here and I really enjoyed the food and service. Especially our waiter Jason! Very friendly and very funny guy. He was very great with the kids and he kept entertaining us with his humor. He was always on top of everything. I will definitely come back. I highly recommend this place if you want great appetizers and the prices for the entrees are decent also. Happy hour is 5:30-10pm daily on drink specials.

The Sparklings?  Let's start with Inviting, cozy, delicious to name a few.  If you're a regular at Oyshi you will immediately recognize the manager.  Upon entering, you realize that some thought went into the elegant decor.  As you are seated, you begin to wonder if you are an extra on the Great Gatsby set.  

As soon as we are seated at our plush, private table in the bar area, the bartender immediately informs us that it is happy hour.  This means beer and wine are 30% off, including bottles.  Seriously, it's Saturday?  We were not expecting happy hour, but total bonus!  We proceed to order many of their delicious appetizers and a couple of bottles of wine for the group.  Some of our favorite apps include the bacon date meatball, crab spinach dip, and the octopus (different from the calamari).

Service was amazing, every employee that we interacted with was fast, friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable  

My only gripe is that about 1.5 yr ago we lived across the street from The Sparklings; where were you when we needed you??  Now that we live in Summerlin, this little gem appears in our old hood.

No need to hit the Strip.  The place os wonderful.  So very pretty inside!  Food was fantastic!  Our server Char was great.  One of the owners Andy came by a few times to check on us.  I am very excited to have this beautiful place right around the corner!  Highly recommend! Parm garlic fries, are to die for!

This is one of my new favorite place to eat. The food is amazing. Service is always great. My favorite server is Tyler. He's super attentive and friendly. Paul, the owner is always checking in with all the guest. Creates a nice personal experience. Ambience of the restaurant and music are eclectic which is a refreshing touch. Langosta bruschetta is a must try. To all the foodies like myself, this is the place to go.

Aghhhh, I so badly want to like this place but I just can't seem to find a dish I love...and I've been here at least four times. This last time I came is what drove me to disappointment. It never seems busy in there yet service is a bit slow -- although I don't like to dwell on the quickness of the service cus that can't always be helped. But if there are only three parties at the restaurant, you'd think the staff would be checking the food rather just standing at the front lollygagging or looking unhappy to be there.

I ordered the langosta bruschetta which was okay. I liked the cream cheese aioli and lobster mix and the bruschetta was crispy. But I don't think I'd order it again. 

My mother ordered the clam chowder because that's the main reason we came, she was craving it. It tasted very plain. By the looks of the restaurant (and price of the clam chowder) you'd think it'd be a little more hearty and flavorful. It wasn't. 

The thing that set me off was my truffle parmesan fries. I looked at the menu at least three times to make sure that "weird dollop of garlic" was supposed to be in the description. It wasn't. I wanted truffle parmesan fries, not soggy garlic fries. I could barely taste the truffle with all the garlic overpowering it. Maybe if the fries were actually crispy, it might have been decent, but it was way too soggy. Because I paid $6 for it, I tried to finish it but I could barely do it with the strong garlic flavor. I was so disappointed. 

Aside from the food, the decor and the restaurant itself is very pretty. But I don't think I'll be coming back on my own will.

Love this place! This place is a hidden gem. I always tell people about this restaurant whenever someone asks me for any food suggestions. The best way to describe them is like a greatest hits of different restaurants all in one album and that album is Sparklings. EVERYTHING is so good here. Their service is amazing too! Great staff!

The Sparklings makes sparkling moments! I've been here on numerous occasions from birthdays, valentine's day & just for dinner. 

We've rented out the private room once for brunch, we've had the long table and sat at those cute booths with the colorful velour backs. 

I've had:
Roasted buttery herb chicken 
Tuna Tartare
Ceviche 
Roasted beet apple salad
Truffle Parmesan fries
Crispy pesto gnocchi - not so great 
Veggie omelette 

All of them listed about were great, besides the pesto gnocchi. Tasted too bland and a ball of sauce. 

Overall, cute atmosphere and they serve my favorite wine of Chardonnay, Kim Catrelle. Always sets the tone and great time!

This place is the gem definitely a hidden spot in Vegas if you want to take your wife or your mother it's a beautiful Decour old-style... beautiful and the food is so amazing and incredibly good we had the shrimp pasta in it was the delicious ...manager was able to explain to us the menu in the Decor is excellent they do have a bar separate from the restaurant and looks incredibly nice it's a must see

This is our other neighborhood kitchen. My family likes to eat seafood as a default dish. This place has a variety of selections in their menu that has not disappoint, but typically we come here for their seafood pasta. Deliciousness! You cant go wrong. The vibe is great, its clean, and the cost is unbelievable. 100% recommend this awesome joint.
The service was stellar, this drinks stiff, and the food superb.   The crispy gnocchi was stellar.
Nice place. Great food. Great drinks. Would come back again. But. Drink service is just too slow. That makes me nuts! I hate stirring ice in my glass until he comes back.

Very interesting restaurant that I really enjoyed.  it had all the things that I love in a restaurant:  great enventive food with a flare at reasonable prices, good moderate pricing, and wonderful service.  it also has a good lounge and bar area to relax in.  My new favorite place to dine.  the fish cakes made a wonderful appetizer.

If you're ever in the SW part of Las Vegas, #TheSparklings on Rainbow is the place to go for your American fusion fare. The crab and spinach dip with fried and grilled pita was scrumptious! The chandelier cocktail w peach and bubblegum vodka and pineapple and cranberry juice is a good one. You get the ambiance and fun vibe of a Strip restaurant without the Strip prices!

Really? Multiple stars? First time visiting so it's possibly an off night but it's definitely a bad night.   First, the wobbly bar chairs were annoying. Also annoying was the 20 minutes we waited for a drink order (two glasses of wine). We were greeted with food menus as we intended to have dinner. 20 minutes later, after overhearing a verbal disagreement in Spanish behind the bar (I'm a white girl who speaks Spanish), I realized there were issues. With a 1/4 glass of wine left, I asked for the check and the fill-in bartender asked why we were leaving. I was too annoyed to convey my sentiments in any language so we paid the bill, grabbed an uber and ventured down rainbow to an establishment with much more reliable service.

The bartender was so great.... I did not order food....I was on a date it was just a few cocktails....they have a great selection of vodkas.... Do you can create any fun cocktail and the decor was so cute ....im going back soon for a bite to eat since I live within walking distance I think it might be my new place to hang out....

I love this place! The food, atmosphere and service is always good! On September 20th during my fiancé's 30th birthday, the owner and employees helped him with the proposal. I thought it was the sweetest ever. This place is perfect for special events!

I always heard people talk about this place so we ended up choosing this place for a friend's birthday.  I would say this place would be semi casual so it wasn't extremely fancy but it had a little elegance to it. They have a bar inside the place so while we waited for the whole party to come, I went to the bar and tried their blueberry mojito. It was so good and on top of that, the bartender was so sweet! It wasn't too strong and he crushed real blueberries in the drink. 

Now onto the main course, I ordered the Steak Diane which came with slices of steak, mashed potatoes, and veggies. I also ordered a side of fries because I had a feeling I wouldn't be full so I wanted a filler just for in case. For the cons, I would have to say that the slices of steak were quite small and thin so I expected it to be a little thicker at least. It only came with 4 thin slices. The fries were also not warm when they came out as if they were sitting in the back for a while and of course I would like my food to be hot when it's served. I also asked for ranch for my fries and I just want to say that their ranch did not taste like ranch at all. It tasted extremely watered down. 

For dessert I ordered their creme brûlée and that was okay too. It had more of a really strong egg taste rather than a vanilla taste in my opinion. Overall this place was just okay but our waitress was so nice, She was very patient with our party of 10. Maybe I'll come back and try something else on their menu.

The Sparklings is my all time favorite spot. In addition to the phenomenal food (shout out the seafood pasta and creme brûlée) and the out of this world drinks (shout out the chandelier cocktail), I would come here just to hang out with Jose and Ray!!! Best bartenders in the world. I'll probably never go anywhere else for the rest of my life.

We popped in on a Saturday night and what a disappointment! As a local in the Southwest we have given this place a couple of try's and can not seem to catch a break. This last time we waited at least 20-30 mins just to get the check at the tables near the bar after the longest service wait to begin with. My husband called the management a few days after and they seemed uninterested in our complaints, so we will have to take that as a final sign to not repeat our business there. Do not waste the money or time.

They did a great job with the remodel and I really enjoyed the decor.  The patio is super cute and I definitely want to take advantage of it when the weather is a little warmer. The food was good but I agree with another review that the appetizers were better than the entrees and next time I think we will just do apps and cocktails. 

The staff all seemed new to working in a restaurant and a bit nervous.  I felt that our server was much too casual with us and the conversation felt border line inappropriate for dining.  There were a few little kinks they need to work out (example- we didn't get a chiller when we ordered a bottle of white wine) but I'm sure things will keep getting better the longer they're open.

This place has a nice interior and a nice quiet atmosphere. The only thing that was disappointing was the lack of service and food quality. There was nobody refilling our water glasses, and the food tasted just okay.

This restaurant has everything that you can hope for when dinning out. The service is great, the food is decadent and innovative. It has energy and romance and it keeps on going even when most places in town are closed. Everything this gem has to offer comes at a unbelievably affordable price. There's true magic in the southwest. Thank you to Angel and staff for nights to never be forgotten.

A quick review after a birthday celebration dinner

-

I'm giving this place 3 stars for mediocre food, but great service!

I ordered the Rib-Eye steak with zucchini sticks and calamari as appetizers, all of which I can only describe as nothing more than average. While the did cut like butter, the seasoning on it was rather bland. The zucchini sticks were one of the better things I tried as the servings sizes were big, but I do feel like they overcooked the food. One of my main problems with both the zucchini sticks and calamari was that it seemed to be smothered in oil. I can just taste it in my mouth, and halfway through the calamari, I had to stop feeling as I started to feel a gag reflex coming from within me. So yeah, that's the food. 

However, I do have to admit that the ambience is great! Old school, Italian-themed with great music. I almost want to give 4 stars for them having my favorite song on their playlist (Unsteady - XAmbassadors)! The place is very spacious and roomy, and definitely does not seem like your average barstaurant.

One thing I did appreciate though was that our waiter managed to pick up on the fact that it was my birthday today. He gave us a free scoop of ice cream on the house with the words "Happy Birthday" in pretty calligraphy. It makes up for the fact that we got our water 10 minutes late.

I love this place!!! It was beautiful inside..I mean we were thinking oh it's probably just like a little bar/grill type of place just by the house..OH NO!! It was spectacular!!! The decor is very chic and comfortable at the same time..the staff was amazing..Great personalities and very personable..Food?? OMG let's just say we went on Saturday and again on Tuesday!!! I have found a new spot, hopefully can afford the once a week lunch/dinner here :)

Super chic, contemporary, yet home-y feel to this restaurant. I've been here a few times n each time the food n service never disappoints. A few of my personal favorites are the braised short ribs, spicy seafood pasta, crispy gnocchi, and bacon & dates wrapped meatballs. Can't wait to go back! =D

Service is friendly. The four-person table was very wobbly. Dish proportions are satisfying and the food is adequate, but far from remarkable. There is nothing special about the chicken marsala daily special. Texture of chicken was rubbery and sauce could have been from a can. The spaghetti with meatballs were mostly bland. One might expect this from an inexpensive truck stop diner, but not for the prices we paid.

Love the ambiance!!! Same owners of oyshi and soyo. Andy the manager took good care of us. So great to find a new spot that's different. The crispy gnocchi was the bomb!!! I had the seafood pasta. Everything was great and reasonably priced. Our server wasn't really attentive and rarely checked on us but good thing Andy filled in for him. 

Well Def come back. Great First Date Spot lol
Everything about this restaurant is phenomenal- from the server to the food to the ambiance.  You have to stop by!  My new favorite restaurant!

The food here is great. After my first review I came back a few times. The reason for the decline in stars is because the service is verrrrry very slow. The first time I came I was thinking maybe it was because it was busy,  but the last 2 times the restaurant was practically empty and it takes long to get seated, forever to order and a century to get offered for dessert, and even longer to order the dessert. 

The atmosphere is super laid back I understand but please check on your tables.

This place is pretty chill.  Get your date,drink,or dinner on here because the atmosphere is amazing.   The bar tenders are friendly and the outside part is pretty cool.  I come here ofter for their LASAGNA....what can I say besides OM#G.  I am addicted.  Come and see this little gold mine.

The Sparklings was a fun dining experience.    
We were there to celebrate my birthday dinner and it was the first time that half of us has been there.  

The food was good.  I especially liked the zucchini fries and the Gorgonzola Flatbread.    The rib eye was delicious and I like the way they make their mash potatoes.  

I enjoyed the atmosphere and how spacious it is.  Their furniture makes it feel fancy.  The servers are all really nice.  Our waiter was funny and they comped some of my "birthday" shots.  

I can't wait to come back.  Their prices are affordable, the atmosphere and service is great and the food is delicious!
The food is great and the drinks are too. Rey is super friendly. Dining room is bright, but seating is comfortable.
We came for a quick dinner, had a few of the appetizers- bacon date meatballs, the scallops, Brussels sprouts and brown butter gnocchi. The food and service was great!

What a hidden little gem!

I had never heard of this place until a friend invited us to a bday brunch here. Definitely good for large parties as the seating area is spacious and open. It's also really pretty with a gorgeous chandelier in the middle, fresh floral arrangements, and  modern decor mixed with cool little attention to detail type things. 

Seemed pretty empty in the restaurant for a Sunday at 12 but I'm assuming people don't know it's open for brunch. The dining area is big though and the tables are pretty separated from one another so even with our large party and the restaurant starting to fill up, it still seems mellow and quiet. 

The prices are reasonable and the brunch menu options were good. They also have bottomless mimosas for 18. I had a simple item as I was heading to a BBQ after but once everyone else's food came, I was really impressed. The food looked great. The regular menu looked great and we can't wait to come back and try some of those items. 

I'd say the service was definitely slow which seemed weird bc the restaurant was not busy at alll but once my food came, I didn't really care Bc it was great and the overall experience was nice. Would definitely come back.

We came for date night to try something new. Great food! Great atmosphere! Great service! The creme brûlée is heavenly.



We will be back for sure.

Let this be the first review I write since I've moved to Vegas. Not only is this place literally down the street from me- the service, ambience, and food is amazing! Definitely a local gem for me and one of the best restaurants all around near Mountains Edge.

I get the crispy gnocchi and bacon date meatballs everytime. It is my must MUST have no matter what mood I'm in. Both plates are cooked to perfection that will make you say "mmm" with every bite.

Whatever occasion it is, I would recommend everyone to check this place out. I can't get over the décor here... It's very modern classy. Everytime I pop in, I get new ideas for my own home décor. Love it! :)
Very over priced for food and drink- One bartender for the bar and table service.. and not "Pro American born"   just sayin..

Two stars are for the food.  One star is for Samantha picking up the pieces of a table that was ditched.  The lacking two other stars are for Susan.  Yes, I was part of the 6 person party that received horrible service from Susan last night.  Even a chain restaurant will "pass off" service if they are going on a break or no longer serving your table, but we were left to wonder where Susan had gone.  We were under the impression that Samantha was assisting her.  She was very nice, but seemed somewhat inexperienced to serve a table of 6.

We asked several times for our sever and Samantha said she was helping her.  Then after Samantha finally took our order, it was obvious that Susan had ditched us without a word.  I have been a server in many restaurants and I can't imagine treating my customers (especially, potentially tipping customers) in such a manner.  

Andy, I read your responses to our party's concerns and you come off as rather defensive instead of sincerely sorry. You shouldn't tell your customers that they have no idea how to run a restaurant.  Not only is it condescending, but you also have NO idea if your assumption is true.  Two people in our party have owned and run restaurants.  I appreciate that you comp'd the scallops, and gave happy hour prices for the drinks, however that doesn't erase the experience and "make us happy" as you say it should.  I had been to your restaurant one time before and had a pleasant experience.  I think the food is delicious.  Service will make or break a restaurant though, so I hope you take our experience seriously.

One of the best places we have found near Mountain's Edge!

It looks unassuming from the outside, but the inside is nicely decorated and has a great ambiance. My girlfriend said "it's so cute in here" at least 10 times while we were there. 

They also had a nice little bar area that was filled up. 

The menu had a lot of appealing options. Pretty upscale cuisine, but the prices were very reasonable. Food was excellent. 

Lastly, our waiter Jason was awesome and very helpful. Knowledgeable and friendly. 

Loved this place!

I had the Sunday brunch veggie benedict. The flavor was good, more around four stars. They overcooked one of the two eggs, but replaced it when I alerted them. The dessert was a bit disappointing--out of the three trio items, the creme Brule was a bit more tart, the chocolate brownie type item was only average, and the ice cream was just standard ice cream. I'd say based on that that desserts may not be their strong point. The service was professional. Not bad, just not the most impressive.

The inside of this restaurant is beautiful. We entered and waited at the host stand for several minutes before wandering into the bar to find someone to seat us. They did so and gave us menus. After 20 minutes had passed, our waiter arrived and took our drink and entree orders. Someone else brought our food out: my chicken sandwich had minimal toppings that the bun exceeded and the sandwich lacked any flavor. Her ($30) pork loin tasted like it was on a bed of Uncle Ben's rice. No one came back to ask about our meal until it was time to ask if we'd like dessert. The restaurant only had about 3 other tables to serve, one of which was large, so it is unclear if our server had too many people to help, there wasn't enough staff, or the service is not their strength.

This place is a hidden gem.   The decor is very pleasing, beautiful colors of paint on the walls, beautiful flower arrangements on the sitting areas.   I love the fact that thre are various rooms where you can book for a larger group and it offers more privacy.  I thought about booking here to celebrate a special Birthday or other occasion.   The food here is very reasonably priced.  Service was good and I was pleasantly surprised.  I'm so glad I tried it.

My husband and I absolutely love this place!!! We love it so much that we decided to have our wedding reception here. The food is always...and I mean always so delicious!!! All of our guest at our wedding still talk about the great food we had. We also always have great bar service. The service all around is amazing. The owner Andy is a great person. He walks around from time to time and says hi to his guest. He always makes you feel important and welcomed. Once you experience The Sparkling, you'll be sure to come back and make yourself a regular. Enjoy your meal!
